loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase maize, okra and other ingredients

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 40 years old. She is married and has 6 children.  

Evangeline earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. Evangeline has been raising pigs for 17 years and also earns additional income from rice retailing. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to build and expand her business, to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Wahid

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married, and a father of one. 

Wahid has owned a small market since 2009, selling cheese, juice, bread, daily use items and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and is loyal to his clients. 

He is requesting a $2400 loan to make a sliding door and shelves for his market and to buy a refrigerator. He is aiming to increase his income so he can improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To make a sliding door and shelves for his market and to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Gloria Ramona

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Chimborazo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Gloria, tiene 35 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 12, 11 y 8 años de edad los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido es comerciante.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local, nos cuenta que  la mayor parte de su mercadería la vende bajo pedidos que le realizan sus clientes. Trabaja tres  días a la semana desde las 8h00  hasta las 11h00 ya que a esa hora tiene que llegar  a su casa a preparar la comida  para cuando lleguen sus hijos de la escuela y en las tardes a veces cuando tiene tiempo también se va  a  hacer sus ventas. Deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada domingo. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que tiene pedidos. Lleva 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va bastante bien ya que cuenta con bastante clientela.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el banco comunal desde sus inicios y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con estos créditos.

Su sueño es seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Chimborazo” meets every 15 days in the parish of Picoaza of the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for its commercial activity, its traditional festivals for St. Peter and St. Paul, and the cheerfulness of its people.

It is in the place that one can meet Sra. Gloria. She is 35 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three children (ages 12, 11, and 8) who are in school. Her husband is a merchant.

Gloria sells all types of clothing and works by going door-to-door. She also sells from her home where she has a small store. Gloria says that most of her merchandise is sold through orders placed by her customers. She works three days a week from 8am to 11am. After that, she returns home to prepare food for her children when they come back from school. Sometimes Gloria will make sales in the afternoons when she has the time. She offers her products on credit and collects payment every Sunday. Gloria buys her merchandise in Guayaquil every time she receives orders. She has been in business for six years and has done quite well since she has many customers.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise such as trousers, blouses, shirts, and children’s clothing. She has been with the Communal Bank from the beginning and enjoys the assistance she has received through the loans. Her dream is to continue with her business.

loans.use: to purchase trousers, blouses, shirts, and children’s clothing.

loans.name: Dominggus

texts.en:
Dominggus is a 30 year-old-man and is working as a motorbike taxi driver. He is married to Serny, 22 years old, and has been blessed with one handsome boy named Justin, who is 2 years old . Dominggus and his family live at his parent’s house, as requested by his lonely widowed mother. As the backbone of his family, Dominggus prefers to work as a motorbike taxi driver to fulfill his family needs. 

Besides working as a motorbike taxi driver, Dominggus also has a small kiosk business operated by his wife. They utilized a small room at home to run the kiosk business. Dominggus is eager to build up a small kiosk in front of his house instead of the current one to make it more comfortable for the customers in purchasing their needs.  To do so, Dominggus is requesting a loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM.  He plans to buy the building material to build a simple kiosk. He and his family are hoping that TLM will help by providing him the loan.

Note: when the picture was taken, Dominggus was holding his son.

loans.use: To buy building material to build a simple kiosk

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 28-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur who is divorced with two children ages three and six.  

For the past 10 years, he has been running a business selling a variety of goods such as sandals, mirrors, sugar, and salt.  

He needs a loan in order to purchase more of these goods and continue to meet the demands of his customers. 

He plans to use the future profits to build a small business house and to save for his and his children’s futures.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for sale such as sandals, mirrors etc.

loans.name: Affiwa

texts.fr:
Affiwa est une femme  âgée de 55ans. Elle est mariée å un chauffeur. Elle a 03 enfants. 
Affiwa travaille comme revendeuse de tissus coupons depuis 2005. Elle vend à ses  clients  au Grand Marché. Elle achète les produits  au Port de Lomé. 
Affiwa a requis son troisieme cycle de prêt à WAGES afin de renforcer son activité par l’achat des tissus.
texts.en:
Affiwa is 55 years old. She is married to a driver and has 3 children. 

Affiwa has been selling fabric remnants since 2005. She buys her products at the port in Lomé and sells to customers at the Grand Market.  She has requested a third loan from WAGES in order to increase her activity by buying more fabric.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy maize

loans.name: Anarkan's Group

texts.en:
Anarkan is the treasurer of this group. She is 40 and married to a crane operator. Together with her husband she brings up two daughters: the older daughter is at university and the second goes to school. Anarkan works as a cleaner and her monthly salary is 2500 soms. She is also engaged in livestock breeding and reselling livestock after fattening to earn additional money to meet the family needs. Anarkan has applied for the loan because she needs additional funds to pay for her daughter’s education at university. In the near future she plans to start building a shed for livestock. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's university tuition

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
A hardworking woman who strives to provide for her family, Anita is a 40-year-old cattle breeder. She purchases and resells cattle with her husband.

Anita is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase feed and vitamins for her livestock to increase her inventory and to meet customer demand. She believes this will lead to greater revenue and ultimately greater profit for her family.

In the future, Anita would like to reinvest the earnings generated by this loan into her business. She will then purchase additional livestock and further increase her income.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her cattle.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 32 years old and she lives in the airport community. She is married and her husband is a security person and they have four children between 3 months and 13 years old.

For the past seven years she has been selling rice, oil, peppers and onions in the local market. She has many customers and makes a good profit. She  learn her business from friends.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, peppers and onions for her business. 

Her plan is to buy land and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, peppers and onions for her business.

loans.name: Shokir

texts.ru: Шокир возраст 48 лет, женат, имеет 4 детей. У него собственная  грузовая машина. Он 10 лет занимается перевозкой грузов на  КАМАЗ - е с одного региона на другой. Шокир водитель со стажем. Он очень любит свою профессию. Шокир заботливый отец он хочет вырастить детей в хороших условиях и поэтому большее время проводит за рулем машины, он знает, что машина это средство заработки и регулярно ремонтирует ее. Шокир  хотел бы получить займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки запчастей авто, это покупка поможет ему в бизнесе и принесет прибыль и семейному бюджету
texts.en: Shokir is 48 years old, married and has four children.  He has his own truck.  Shokir has been involved in transporting loads on the Kamaz truck from one region to another.  He is a driver with experience.  He loves his profession very much.  Shokir is a caring father and wants to raise his children in good conditions.  This is why he spends the majority of time behind the truck wheel and knows that the truck is a source of income that has to be repaired regularly.  Shokir wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 10,000 somoni to purchase spare auto parts.  This purchase will help him in the business and will benefit the family budget.

loans.use: to buy spare auto parts

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 33 years old and is a married woman with 5 children. Her oldest child is 15 years old.

Luzviminda buys and resells Cignal Digital TV, a satellite television service provider in the Philippines. She has been in this kind of business for 3 years.

Luzviminda earns 4000 PHP per month with her business. She plans to use her loan to purchase 1 set of Cignal Digital TV.   Luzviminda hopes to succeed with her business.

loans.use: buy a Cignal Digital TV set

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food, soft drinks, plates, glasses, spoons, forks, tablecloths, tables, and pay for small advertisements.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: La señora Irma se dedica a la venta de ropa al por menor. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de mercadería como ser chompas para dar variedad a su mercadería y así satisfacer a la clientela y aprovechando las fiestas de fin de año, donde las ventas casi se duplican. Vive en casa sus  padres  la misma queda ubicada en la zona de San Pedro en la ciudad de La Paz, es casada y tiene un hijo.  Esta será la cuarta vez que acude a Impro para un préstamo y es la segunda vez que desea que su solicitud se envie a Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Irma is a retail merchant who sells clothes. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy merchandise, such as sweaters, so that she will have a variety of merchandise to satisfy her customers. She will also take advantage of the year-end festivities since this is the time when her sales almost double. Irma lives at her parents’ house in the District of San Pedro in the city of La Paz. She is married and has one child.

This will be the fourth time she has approached IMPRO for a loan. In addition, this is the second time that her request has been sent to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy sweaters to sell during the holiday season.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia, de 40 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además decidida y alegre. Convive con Clever, fruto de esa unión tienen cinco hijos de 20, 16, 14, 8 y 5 años. Juntos habitan cómodamente en su casa propia, que logró comprar hace 9 años. La actividad que realiza Silvia es la venta de abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su propia casa, asimismo vende golosinas y gaseosas en la misma bodega, iniciándose con un préstamo que le dio su suegra hace 3 años. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación logró mantener su negocio, ahora contando con una buena afluencia de clientes, a los que atiende muy amablemente con el apoyo de su esposo cuando no está trabajando y sus hijos cuando no están en estudios. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el contar con un ingreso económico para apoyar a su esposo ya que con el ingreso de obrero no le alcanzaba. Además del tiempo libre que tiene y el atender a sus pequeños hijos. Sin embargo, lo que no le gusta es cuando le falta capital para surtir su bodega, pero eso no la desanima, y tiene planes de hacer crecer y ampliar su negocio. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP, está agradecida con el apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio, por eso se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en créditos anteriores. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de productos para así surtir su bodega, considera que a mayor variedad de productos, tendrá mayores preferencias de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Silvia, 40, is a hardworking, enterprising woman besides being determined and cheerful.  She lives with Clever and they have five children who are 20, 16, 14, 8 and 5 years old.  They live comfortably together in their own house that she managed to buy nine years ago.  

Silvia sells groceries in a home-based store; she sells snacks and soft-drinks there too.  She started out with a loan from her mother-in-law three years ago.  With much effort and dedication she managed to stay in business with help from her husband when he’s not at work and from her children when they aren’t at school.  What she likes about her activity is having a steady income to help her husband because what he earned as a laborer was insufficient in addition to being able to have free time to tend to her small children.  However, what she doesn’t like is when she lacks capital to stock her store but that does not discourage her and she has plans to make her business grow and expand.

This is loan MFP loan #2.  She’s grateful for the financial support to advance with her business and commits to making her payments like she’s done with previous loans.  She will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy products to stock her store.  She believes that with a wider selection of products her customers will prefer her still more.

loans.use: to buy larger quantities of stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Jhon Richard

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  ”RICCHARY CUSCO; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Jhon Richard;  El socio tiene 32 años de edad, El socio es conviviente, El socio tiene su  propio negocio de compra y venta de peluches, el socio trabaja trayendo la mercadería junto a su conyugue desde las ciudades de Tacna, Arequipa, Lima; el socio viaja cada mes a traer mercadería y en esta ocasión debido a las fiestas navideñas el socio desea viajar a traer peluches para venderlos la víspera de navidad, el socio tiene su local en un conocido centro Comercial, en este local el socio tiene su stand. El socio requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de peluches para la venta en la víspera de navidad, el socio también utilizara el crédito para los pasajes que hará.
El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Jhon Richard is a member of the “Ricchary Cusco” communal bank located in Huanchac District in Cusco Province and Department.  He is 23 years old and has a spouse.


He has his own business selling stuffed toys.  He and his spouse bring merchandise from the cities of Tacna, Arequipa and Lima.  He travels each month to bring merchandise and on this occasion because of the Christmas festivities he wants to make a trip to bring stuffed toys to sell for Christmas.  He has a stand in a well-known shopping center.


He needs the loan to buy stuffed toys to sell during the Christmas season and will also use the loan to pay for transportation costs for the trips he’ll take.  He is grateful for the loan and commits to make his payments according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy stuffed toys and pay transportation costs.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is 44 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a security guard. She has run a food stall in front of their house for the past nine years. She sells soups and noodles to people in her community. 

Thuy is requesting a loan, which she will use to expand her business by purchasing more furniture and cooking appliances. She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income, and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing more furniture and cooking appliances.

loans.name: Nuestra Señora De Guadalupe Group

texts.es: El Banco Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe, está conformado por 9 integrantes en el cual todas son mujeres emprendedoras y luchadoras que buscan el bienestar de ellas y de su familia. Este grupo ya ha tenido crédito con Fundación León 2000, en el cual han sido excelente clientas y ellas nos explican que gracias al apoyo que les han brindado con el financiamiento ha incrementado su inversión y su clientela ofreciéndoles variedad de producto a sus clientes. Mireira de Carmen es una emprendedora que se ha unido a este grupo para salir adelante y apoyarse entre ellas mismas, su actividad económica  a la que se dedica es a la venta de mercadería en general lo cual también tiene venta de ropa usada, actualmente está solicitando crédito para invertir en el negocio en la compra de ropa para damas, caballeros, zapatos, cosméticos entre otros productos que le están demandando su clientela.
texts.en:
The "Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe" communal bank is made up of nine members. All of them are enterprising and determined women, who are seeking their own well-being and that of their families.

This group has already had a loan with Fundación León 2000. They have been excellent clients, and they tell us that thanks to the support given them with the loan, they have increased their investment and their clientele, by offering their customers a variety of products. 

Mireira de Carmen is an entrepreneur who has brought this group together, so that they can move forward and support one another. Her business is selling general merchandise, including used clothing. 

Currently, she is applying for a loan to invest in her business, through the purchase of ladies' and men's clothing, shoes, and cosmetics, and other products that her clientele are asking for.

loans.use: To buy ladies' and men's clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and other products.

loans.name: Maurine

texts.en:
Maurine is 32 years old and married to Bernard, who is a plumber. They have five children. She is a poultry farmer, a business she has been in for five years, and gets a monthly income of Kshs 20,000. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD and she has requested a loan worth Kshs 30,000 which she will be use to buy more chicks to rear and sell later at a profit.

The profit anticipated will help her complete the rental houses that she is constructing. Her dream is to educate her children well.

loans.use: To buy chicks to rear for sale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 48-year-old married woman with three children. She has a tailoring business in Oloitoktok and has been in the business for 13 years now. She makes a monthly income of 54,000 shillings. This will be her second loan with KADET Ltd. She plans to use the entire loan to purchase more fabric for her business. In the future, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to increase her stock of fabric materials

loans.name: Binu

texts.en: Binu is 24 years old. She is married and has one child, age six. Many years ago, she established her vegetable farming business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received, and successfully repaid, a loan from Patan BPW, and used her most recent loan to buy vegetables for her shop. In the future, Binu plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Armindo

texts.pt:
Casado maritalmente tem duas esposas e tem 5 filhos com as idades compreendidas entre os 9 a 20 anos Trabalha como jardineiro e segurança numa empresa pública e estando neste momento a construir sua casa de material convencional..
 É cliente da Hluvuku a 4 anos, e com o valor financiado o cliente pretende comprar chapas de zinco, barrotes e ferros 8.
 Seu maior sonho é ver sua casa concluída.
O seu maior desafio é terminar a sua obra que já esta numa fase bastante avançada e a residir nela.
texts.en:
Armindo is married. He has two wives and five children ranging in age from 9 to 20 years. He works as a gardener and a security guard for a state-owned company, and he's currently building his house using conventional materials.
He has been a client of Hluvuku for four years. With this loan he intends to purchase zinc plates, beams and 8-mm iron.
His biggest dream is to see his house finished.
His biggest challenge is getting the construction work done which is at a very advanced stage, and move into the house.

loans.use: to purchase zinc plates, beams and 8-mm iron.

loans.name: Viviane Lily

texts.fr:
Viviane Lily a 40 ans, elle est mariée. Le mari  est un commerçant, il dirige un magasin général. Le couple a 3 enfants de 17, 13, et 2 ans dont l’aîné vient d’obtenir son baccalauréat, le second est en classe de cinquième dans une école privée.  
Viviane ne travaillait pas en 2010, en raison de l’insuffisance des revenus du magasin général de  son mari, elle s’est adonnée à la vente des collations près du point de vente de son mari. Le développement de cette activité lui a permis de se reconvertir dans son activité actuelle. Viviane vend des produits de seconde main : drap, couverture, tapis etc . . .  
Le couple prévoit de construire leur propre maison car le ménage vit actuellement dans un local hérité de ses parents.
texts.en:
Viviane Lily is a 40-year-old married woman. Her husband is a shopkeeper, he runs a general store. The couple has three children aged 17, 13 and 2; the eldest has just obtained the baccalauréat high school diploma and the second is in grade 5 in a private school. 

Viviane Lily did not work in 2010. Due to the insufficient income acquired from her husband's general store, she began selling snacks near his shop. The development of this activity allowed her to adapt to her current business. 

Viviane Lily sells second-hand products: bed sheets, covers, rugs, etc. The couple plans to build their own house as the family currently lives in a home that she inherited from her parents.

loans.use: to buy second-hand bed sheets, rugs, and covers.

loans.name: Blanca Lilian

texts.en:
Ah! the tortilla is an important staple of honduran cuisine. I have been making corn tortillas for five years, the earnings help me finance the studies of my three children. Every day my children help me to grind and to form the tortillas and also to deliver them to the homes of my clients. Now, I need to increase my earnings because one of my children is enrolled in the University and I want him to graduate so that he can help with his brothers.

Loan Use: Purchase corn, firewood, lime.

Ah!!! la tortilla un complemento importantisimo en la comida hondureña, tengo 5 años de dedicarme a la elaboracion de tortillas de maiz, las ganancias me han ayudado con los estudios de mis 3 hijos. Cada dia mis hijos me ayudan a moler y hacer tortillas y otro a entregarlas en las casas de mis clientes. Ahora necesito incrementar mis ganacias ya que uno de mis hijos ingreso a la Universidad y quiero que se gradue para que ayude a sus hermanos.

loans.use: Compra de maiz, leña, cal.

loans.name: Peata

texts.en: Peata has joined the SPBD programme and has just been given a loan of 300 tala (US$100) to start a pork cake business. She is unemployed, married, and has 6 children. Her husband does not have a permanent job, and is not able to earn enough money to support their family. Peata's biggest worry has been the school fees for her 4 children attending school and other basic needs for her family. She opted for starting the business, because cakes are cheap to make, and because the business would not much interfere with her busy schedule as a full time mother. In addition, pork cakes are a favourite among the locals, especially children. To start out, Peata bought flour and meat, and now makes about 40 buns daily, 7 days a week. She sells the cakes to school children during the week and to other village people during the weekends. Occasionally, Peata's husband delivers the cakes to nearby shops.  She earns up to  280 tala (US$90) a week, and is now able to cover the family's basic needs in addition to paying her children’s school fees. Peata is even able to save some of the money to eventually increase the amount of cakes she supplies. In addition, she still manages to make loan payments on time, so that she can move up to the next loan level. Her determination to improve her family’s standard of living is making her work harder and learn to save with the help of SPBD's savings programme.

loans.use: Purchase of flour, turkey tail, mutton flap, soy sauce, salt, onion, sugar cooking utensils

loans.name: Leaso

texts.en: Leaso has six children who are attending primary school. She chose sewing as her business because she is skillful in doing it and she learned it from her mother. She started with a $750 loan and it was used to buy her brand new electronic sewing machine to replace her old one. She's the one who sewed the National Bank of Samoa's uniform. She also sews different items of clothing and takes them to the flea market in town to be sold. She enjoys doing her business because she believes it is very helpful in supporting her family, especially the raising of her six young kids. Leaso is looking forward to another loan to buy more materials so her customers' supplies aren't limited.

loans.use: To purchase more material, thread, and needles

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Mrs. Carmen is 32 years old, married with 3 children. Because of work, she's been living in the city of Ybycuí for the last 10 years. Her husband works for a cotton "desmontadora" in the area, but his wages are not sufficient to support the family.

In order to face this situation, Carmen had to set up her own small business and make the extra income necessary. With the profits she has been able to help her husband and proviD. her children with a better education. Between them both managing to proviD. them with a better quality of live.

Carmen tells us that she is the best saleswoman in town, since she gets more sales everyday than the other stores in town. She wishes to keep growing for which she is thinking to expand the business. Since winter is drawing closer she wants to buy a greater quantity of winter clothing such as boots, sweaters, wool coats and overalls etc.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


La Señora Carmen tiene 32 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Por cuestiones D. trabajo del marido hace 10 años que resiD. en la ciudad D. Ybycuí. El marido es empleado D. una desmotadora D. algodón D. la zona, pero el salario que el percibe no es suficiente para sostener a la familia, por lo que para afrontar esta situación,Carmen, tuvo que montar su pequeño negocio para obtener ingresos extras. Con las ganancias a podido ayudar a su marido y proveer a sus hijos D. una mejor educación logrando entre ambos mejorar su calidad D. vida. Carmen nos cuenta que es la mejor vendedora del pueblo, pues es ella la que todos los días consigue tener mejores ventas que las demás tiendas. Ella quiere seguir creciendo y para ello tiene pensado expandir su negocio, ya que el invierno se acerca con mayor fuerza ella desea comprar en mayor cantidad ropa para invierno como camperas, buzos, abrigos, etc.

loans.use: Purchasing winter clothing (boots, sweaters, wool coats and overalls)/Compra de ropas para invierno (camperas, buzos,sweters, sacos de lana)

loans.name: Agapito

texts.en:
Agapito sells crab meat to the local community and nearby restaurants. He has been working with seafood for over 15 year. He gets up at 4 every morning to buy crabs from fishermen. He and his wife then spend the next couple of hours cooking the crab and removing the crab meat. He puts the meat in plastic containers and then sells it to the public.

His previous loan with our institution helped him increase his production and target the small restaurants in his area. He was very grateful for the opportunity he received, but is not satisfied. He hopes to invest in new tools that will help him be more efficient and lower prices. He hopes he can provide crab meat to many more restaurants in his area.

He and his wefe have 3 kids who are all in school and often help out in the business. His wife is a housekeeper who works in the city. Their short term goal is to fix their home before the rainy season gets bad. Currently their roof leaks and it is very vulnerable to heavy rains.

loans.use: Buy tools to increase his productivity

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
In spite of her age and injuries, Alica continues to work in the field that she has known all her life. She makes charcoal from the remains of wood and boards left over from the sawmills. She is the mother of four children, and thanks to the earnings she generates, she has been able to educate each of her children, and each are fine men of means within their community. Currently, she works with her spouse in the preparation and sale of charcoal, and they have a sales space in the best market in the city. Due to the increasing demands of her clients, she finds herself in immediate need of more firewood to keep producing more charcoal. For this, she is requesting $600, which will allow her to purchase the pallets of wood from the sawmills for making fuel and cover her customer's needs. It will also ensure her sales and improve the quality of life for her family. She is very grateful in advance for your generous support.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer

Alicia a pesar D. su edad y dolencias, sigue desempeñando la labor que aprendió desD. pequeña; produce carbón D. las sobras D. las maderas y tablones que desechan los aserraderos; es madre D. 4 hijos y gracias a las ganancias que le generó y viene generando hasta hoy esta labor ha podido educar a cada uno D. sus hijos para que ahora se desempeñen como hombres D. bien dentro D. su sociedad. Actualmente trabaja en compañía D. su esposo en la preparación y venta del carbón ya que cuentan con un espacio D. ventas en el mejor mercado D. su ciudad; debido al incremento D. las solicitudes D. sus clientes se encuentra en la imperiosa necesidad D. comprar mas leña para poder seguir produciendo mas carbón. Para ello está solicitando la suma D. 600 dólares, esto le permitirá adquirir más lotes D. leña D. los aserraderos para la preparación del combustible con el que podrá cubrir totalmente las peticiones y además logrará asegurar su venta y mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia. DesD. ya queda muy agradecida por vuestra ayuda generosa.

loans.use: Purchase and supply of firewood for the production and sale of charcoal

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Juliana married Juan Carlos aged 24: he is 37 years old and is a public transport driver.

Juliana, when she was very young, began working in the family business, then she suggested studying a trade in order to begin working independently. It was in this way she undertook various courses including: hairdressing, manicure and pedicure treatments and artistic decoration, but it was artesenal embroidery that she liked the best, and so today she spends her time on this work.

Little by little she attracted customers by making promotional offers among family and friends: this is how today she sends blouses embroidered in aó po´í (traditional Paraguayan weaving technique) to different parts of the country and even exports them to Argentina (Paraguay’s neighbouring country).

The loan she is asking for will be used to buy fabric and threads used in the making of her blouses, as there is a lot of demand.

Translated for the Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Katy Long

Juliana se casó a los 24 años con Juan Carlos que tiene 37 años, el mismo es chofer de transporte público.

Juliana desde muy joven empezó trabajando en un negocio familiar, luego se propuso estudiar una profesión para lograr trabajar en forma independiente. Fue así como realizó varios estudios como: peluquería, manicura y pedicuro, decoración artística, pero fue el bordado artesanal el que más le gustó por lo que hoy día se dedica a dicha profesión.

Poco a poco iba ganando clientes realizando promociones entre familiares y vecinos, es así que hoy día envía camisas bordadas en aó po´í (tejido tradicional del Paraguay) a diferentes puntos del país y hasta los exporta a la Argentina (país limítrofe del Paraguay).

El crédito que está solicitando lo destinará a la compra de telas e hilos empleados en sus confecciones de camisas debido a que tiene mucha demanda.

loans.use: Purchase fabric and thread

loans.name: Nora Carolina

texts.es:
Nora Carolina Gonzáles is a hardworking woman who sells fast food (hot dogs and chicken with fries) and compact discs. She started her business 5 years ago, using a cart to sell her products on the streets of Chinandega.

Months later, upon realizing that she needed to invest in her business, she sought the help of Ceprodel, which provided her with 6 loans that have helped her improve her economic status. These loans have helped her both increase her fast food sales and purchase greater quantities of CD’s to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Nora Carolina Gonzáles es una dama esforzada que se dedica al negocio de venta de comida (hot dog y pollo con papas) y al mismo tiempo venta de discos compactos. Su negocio inició hace 5 años en la ciudad de Chinandega con un carretón que le servía para trabajos ambulantes en las calles de esta ciudad.

Al pasar los meses y darse cuenta de que necesitaba invertir en su negocio, recurrió a Ceprodel por el cual le benefició ya que obtuvo 6 créditos que hoy en día le han ayudado a superar su situación económica aumentando sus ventas de comida y adquiriendo mayores cantidades de discos compactos para comercializarlos.

loans.use: Purchase of food and compact discs

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en: Tahir (his wife is pictured)  was born in 1956. His family lives in the Salyan region in Yenikand village. Tahir has 3 children. They have been in farming business for 17 years.  Now this family needs a loan of $1200 to buy vine props for improving their vineyard.

loans.use: To buy vine props

loans.name: Agapito

texts.es:
Agapito is a 57 year old man, lives with his wife and children and makes a living providing taxi services with a vehicle that he owns.

Agapito has more than 18 years of experience in the area of public transport and concurrently his wife works in the rental of real estate.

Due to the time that he has in the business he has a steady customer base that appreciates his work, timeliness and service quality. These factors minimize the risks presented by his competition. The prices that he charges are in accordance to the norm for the area and the distances traveled.

The money will be used to repair and maintain his vehicle which is the basis of his work. His previous credit history is very good and currently he only has loans with our institution.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Agapito es un señor de 57 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos y se dedica a prestar servicios de taxista con su movilidad que es propia.

Agapito tiene más de 18 años de experiencia en el rubro del transporte público y paralelamente la esposa trabaja ofertando alquiler de inmuebles.

Debido a la antiguedad con la que cuenta es que tiene clientela fija que aprecia su trabajo, puntalidad y buen trato, estos factores minimizan los riesgos que le puede presentar la competencia.

Los precios que maneja son de acuerdo a las tarifas que se manejan en el rubro y de acuerdo a las distancias recorridas.

El dinero será utilizado para reparar y dar mantenimiento general a su movilidad que se constituye en su herramienta de trabajo.

Los antecedentes crediticios de Agapito son muy buenos, actualmente sólo tiene crédito con nuestra Institución.

loans.use: Repair and maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.name: Tranquilina

texts.es:
Tranquilina Colman was born in the city of Luque and is 65 years old, she is mother to two grown women. Their names are Carmen and Mercedes, 40 and 39 years old respectively.

Tranquilina owns a pub in a big laboratory located in the city of Asunción. In the pub she serves breakfast, lunch, and snack to the employees who work there. She's been working there for 10 years and she is very well liked by people who work there.

Three years ago Tranquilina became a widower, pain and sorrow made it difficult for her to get back on track. Her daughters were a big support and she has finally gotten a hold of things in her life.

She cooks for the company but also is taking special orders which her daughter delivers. Tranquilina wishes for some credit in order to offer a wider variety of goods: milk, yogurt, sweets, sodas, fresh fruit, pastries. This way she will be able to satisfy her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Tranquilina Colman nació en la ciudad de Luque y tiene 65 años, ella es madre de dos hijas ambas ya mayores, sus nombres son Carmen y Mercedes de 40 y 39 años respectivamente.

Tranquilina posee una cantina en un laboratorio grande que queda en la ciudad de Asunción. En la cantina da desayuno, almuerzo y merienda a los empleados de la empresa. Hace diez años que trabaja en el lugar y se ha hecho muy querida por todas las personas que trabajan en ese lugar.

Hace tres años, Tranquilina enviudó, lo que hizo que una inmensa tristeza la invada y le tomo un tiempo recuperarse, sus hijas fueron su gran apoyo y hoy día ha vuelto a retomar su vida.

Hoy día además de cocinar para esa empresa también toma pedidos particulares de otros empleados de la zona, su hija Carmen trabaja con ella y realiza los repartos de los pedidos que recibe. Hoy día Tranquilina mucho mejor y desea adquirir el crédito para poder surtir mejor su cantina con cosas como: leche, yogurt, golosinas, gaseosas de varios sabores, frutas frescas, pastelitos, etc. De este modo ella podrá satisfacer la demanda de los empleados de la empresa que le solicitan que venda estos productos también.

loans.use: Purchase of milk, yogurt,sweets, sodas, fresh fruit, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Daysi

texts.es:
For three years Daysi has been running a small grocery store-come-bookshop from her house. She is 35 years old and has 3 kids, for whom she has to get up and work every day so that they never want for anything. Despite relying on help from her husband, who is a welder in a company, she knows that there will always be times of emergency when you need to be able to count on an additional income to supply your needs.

She is a very hard-working and enterprising woman, with a good vision for business. These are skills that allow her to start businesses wherever she can. She is part of an association with some friends, where they meet monthly to plan how to obtain extra income, whether this be baskets of supplies or money. In the future she plans to implement a transport company with her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Desde hace tres años Daysi se en carga de manejar una pequeña bodega-librería dentro de su casa. Ella tiene treinta y cinco años de edad y tres hijos por quienes levantarse cada día y trabajar para que no les haga falta nada. A pesar de que cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo, quien trabaja como soldador en una empresa, ella afirma que siempre se presentan algunas emergencias y que es necesario contar con un ingreso adicional para suplir esas faltas. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora, trabajadora y con visión empresarial. Habilidades que la llevan a iniciar negocios cada vez que puede. Muestra de ello es la asociación que tiene con un grupo de amigas, donde planifica mensualmente diversas formas de obtener un recurso adicional, ya sean canastas de víveres o juntas de dinero. Más adelante planea instituir una empresa de transportes junto con su esposo.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to put in the shop window/Comprar mercadería  para abastecer las vitrinas de su bodega

loans.name: Felipe De Jesús

texts.es:
More than eight years ago, I started to construct some rooms out of wood on the bottom floor of the house. With time and the rains, the wood is giving out, and even more so with the humidity. This is why I am requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase materials and to start constructing two rooms on the bottom floor of the house.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Tengo ya más de 8 años que empecé a construir unos cuartos de madero en la planta alta de la casa. Con el tiempo y las lluvias ya la madera se esta acabando y mas con la humedad. Es por eso que solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 dlls. Para la comprar de material y empezar la construcción de dos cuartos en la planta de baja de la casa.

loans.use: Expansion of the bottom floor of the house

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok N., age 41, is a widow and lives with four of her children in the Prey Veng province. There are not maN. stores that sell soft drinks in the village so Sok has maN. customers. She sells a variety  of soft drinks, and on average she makes US$3 of profit per day. Two of her children are married and live away from home. Sok would like a loan from Kiva to add items to her inventory to meet her customer’s demand.

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks.

loans.name: Edith's Mapinduzi Group

texts.en:
Edith is 48 years old. She is a married woman with 4 children aged 20, 18, 10, and 9. She became a charcoal seller in 1987. Every day, she works from 7am to 2pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

Edith now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who has a small business dealing in fish.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina baji is a wife of M. and a mother of three sons. She lives in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 20 years. Her eldest son makes embroidered dresses; her second son is a tailor, and her youngest son works in a factory. Her husband is a vegetable seller with five years of experience. Sakina baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She successfully completed two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan), and now she is applying for a loan to buy a sewing machine for her second son, who is a tailor.

She is joined in her loan group by two others. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy supplies, such as ink and paper, for her printing business. Another Parveen baji wants a loan to buy crockery to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Nils

texts.es:
La señora Nils, socia del Banco Comunal “Picota”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Picota. Es profesora de profesión, complementa su trabajo con la venta de abarrotes, tiene un locutorio y da alojamiento. El negocio está ubicado en su casa en el Jr. San Martín No 307 y los clientes son sus vecinos y transeúntes que visitan su distrito.   

Con este préstamo de S/. 2000, el cual será cancelado en  6 cuotas, comprará, aceite, conservas de atún, leche en cajas, arroz y azúcar en sacos, galletas de distintas variedades en cajas, chocolates en cajas, chicles en bolsas, chizitos y gaseosas de diferentes marcas, tamaños y sabores para que los clientes encuentren lo que requieren.

En estos últimos tiempos las ventas se han incrementado gracias a su carisma y empeño, además tiene variada mercadería donde los clientes quedan satisfechos.

Nils es una mujer emprendedora y decidida, tiene una meta el cual es construir un segundo piso para alquilar y trabajando como hasta ahora está segura que lo va a conseguir. Es perseverante y responsable, con ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Nils is a member of the community bank "Picota". She lives in the region of San Martin in the province and district of Picota. She is a teacher by profession, but she compliments her work by running a grocery store where she also provides a public telephone service, and she also provides lodging services. Her business is located in her home in Jr. San Martin No. 307. Her clients are mostly her neighbours and out-of-town visitors.

With this loan of S/. 2000, which will be repaid in a term of 6 months, she will purchase cooking oil, canned tuna, cartons of milk, sacks of rice and sugar, boxes of cookies, boxes of chocolates, chilies, chip snacks, and soft drinks of different brands, sizes and flavors. All of this to provide her clientele with what they are looking for.

Lately her sales have been increasing thanks to her great charisma and hard work, but also due to the great variety of products such that all of her clients are satisfied.

Nils is a hardworking woman and very determined. She has a goal to build a second story to her home that she hopes to rent. And working as hard as she has been she will be sure to get what she wants. She is determined and responsible and she has a great want to get ahead.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, canned tuna, milk, rice, sugar, cookies etc..

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her small business

loans.name: Gladys Ivania

texts.es: La Sra. Gladis tiene 24 años de edad, habita en un bario que se llama Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, soltera con mucho deseo de superación, una de sus meta es seguir estudiando para estar capacitada para administrar bien su negocio oh trabajo, tiene una mini pulpería desde hace un año, lo cual comenzó vendiendo pollo y golosinas, pues ha dejado de estudiar por falta de ingreso pues con este negocio le da para sustentarse, cuando comenzó inicio con fondo que sus padre le dieron , ahora para poder invertir y mantener la pulpería con productos variados esta haciendo su segunda solicitud lo cual le ha beneficiado mucho para seguir en el mercado de los negocios. Con este préstamo va hacer  un bajarete frente de la pulpería ya que a los clientes le da mucho el sol, y quiere dar un mejor servicio a su clientela. A largo plazo es comercializar una nueva variedad de productos para atraer mas clientela y así obtener buenos ingresos para poder ahorrar para estudiar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gladis is 24 years old and lives in a neighborhood called Memorial Sandino in Managua. Gladis is single and would very much like to get ahead in life. One of her goals is to keep studying to develop her skills as a business manager. Gladis has been running a small store for a year, which she started by selling chicken and sweets. She had to leave school for lack of an income, and this business allows her to sustain herself. She started with a fund that her father provided, and now she can invest in a variety of products for the store. Gladis is in her second loan cycle, and the first loan has benefited her a lot and allowed her to stay in business. With this loan she will construct a porch in front of the store to protect her clients from the sun, because she wants to provide them with the best service. In the long term Gladis would like to sell a greater variety of products to attract more clients and thereby increase her earnings so that she can save for her education.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to build a porch

loans.name: Enoc

texts.es: Enoc tiene 34 años de edad, es padre de 2 hijos estudiantes, vive junto a su esposa quien lo apoya mucho. Se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde hace dos años atrás. Él es propietario de un motocarro, y él mismo es quien lo maneja durante el día para brindar su servicio. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es conocer a muchas personas y darles un buen trato, eso es lo primordial, nos menciona. Le es rentable porque el mismo administra las ganancias y como no tiene que contratar un chofer, entones los ingresos van directamente a sus manos. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado ser responsable con sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará repuestos para mandar a reparar su herramienta de trabajo y trabajar tranquilamente.
texts.en:
Enoc is 34 years old, father to 2 school-aged children, and he lives with his wife who supports him very much. For two years he has worked providing public transportation. He is the owner of a motorcar, and he himself drives it during the day to provide his service. What he enjoys of his work is meeting many people and providing them good service, and this is the most important thing, he tells us. It is profitable because he himself keeps the earnings and as he doesn’t have to contract a driver, the income goes directly into his hands. This is his 4th loan with MFP, and he has demonstrated responsibility with his payments. With this loan he will buy parts to repair his motorcar and therefore work tranquilly.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy parts for his motorcar

loans.name: 23- Tân Sơn, Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Loan Group 23 consists of six poor women, all of whom live in Tan Son Commune, Thanh Hoa City. Thanh Hoa City is the provincial capital of Thanh Hoa province, one of the poorest provinces in Vietnam. It is located approximately 150 kilometers south of Hanoi, the capital of Vietnam.

Mrs. Hanh is the leader of the group. She is 50 years old, married, and has two grown children (a daughter age 26 and a son age 24). As with her first loan from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women, which was repaid on time and in full, Mrs Hanh will use this loan to buy food for resale (oil, salt, sugar, hot sauce, and so forth) and to buy the ingredients with which to make the breakfast items she sells in her market stall. 

Prior to discovering the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (TCVM), Mrs Hanh, like many of TCVM's borrowers, used to borrow money from a money lender at exorbitant rates – in this case 5,000 VND per day (~US$0.30) on a 1,000,000 VND loan (~US$63), equal to an APR of about 250%!  TCVM charges her an APR of 24%.

* Mrs. Hồng is borrowing 1,963,500 Vietnamese Dong (~ US$123) to buy a range of medicines that she will sell from her little store.
* Mrs. Sơn will use her share of the loan to buy chickens, beef, pork, and onions to cook Phở that she will sell from her small store.
* Mrs. Hải will use her share of the loan to buy vegetables that she will resell in the Nam Ngan market.
* Mrs. Đông will use her share of the loan to buy sauce that she'll sell in her store in the Nam Ngan market.
* Mrs. Hậu is borrowing money to buy wheat flour, pork, and many thing to make bread and dumplings.

loans.use: To buy food items

loans.name: Ghulam Fatima M. Idress Group

texts.en:
Ghulam Fatima baji is a 40 year old married lady, and a citizen of a city named Arifwala, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Her husband's name is M. I. who has a utensils selling business, which he has done for the past 20 years. Ghulam Fatima baji helps her husband by selling utensils in the community. They both are very happy with each other. She is applying for a loan to buy more utensils to expand her husband’s business. 

She is a group leader of some more women of her locale. Hafizan baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Safia baji wants a loan to buy material (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her food business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy utensils to sell.

loans.name: Elia

texts.es: Elia tiene 23 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su propia casa. Se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos desde hace 2 años y tiene su propio horno. Ella conoce perfectamente cada proceso en la fabricación de los ladrillos porque desde niña trabajó en eso. Actualmente solo se dedica a administrar el negocio y a vender. Parte del día se ocupa de atender a sus pequeños hijos, mientras su esposo se dedica a la fabricación, pero también contratan personal para cubrir la producción de 20 millares cada 15 días. En estos últimos tiempos esta actividad se ha convertido en una fuente de ingresos económicos primordial para su familia. Elia y su esposo están planeando extender su fábrica adquiriendo nuevas extensiones de terreno arcilloso que son los adecuados para establecerse. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y tiene grandes deseos de trabajar de manera solidaria para el bienestar de cada uno de los integrantes de su banco comunal. Con el dinero que está solicitando invertirá en el pago de los peones que contratara para esta nueva temporada de fabricación, paga en promedio 300 soles por millar producido y a parte les da sus alimentos.
texts.en:
Elia is 23 years old and lives with her husband and four children in her own home. For the last two years she has sold bricks made in her own oven. She has been making bricks since she was very young and knows each step in their production intimately. Elia currently devotes her time to managing the business and selling the bricks. Part of each day Elia takes care of her children while her husband oversees production. They also employ workers to assist them in making 20,000 bricks every two weeks. Recently, this business has become the family's primary source of income. Elia and her husband are planning to acquire additional land in order to expand their production.

This is Elia's first loan from Kiva's partner Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she is committed to working towards the well-being of all of the members of her community bank. She will invest the loan in paying her employees. She pays them an average of 300 Peruvian nuevos soles (approximately US $92) for every thousand bricks, and also provides them with meals.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay workers at her brick factory

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice L. is currently in the business of selling maize flour at the market and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Joice is 27 years old and is married. Her husband is a soldier. She has three children who go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Alaifue

texts.en: Alaifue I. is thirty-six years old and married with five children.  She has four years of experience in a taxi service business. She serves the general public seven days a week. She has three previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be about $75.  SPBD loans are Alaifue’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase tires, taxi license registration fee, seat cover, air freshener, vacuum and carpet freshener.

loans.name: Soro Yiriwa Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe Soro Yiriwa (toutes mariées) avec une moyenne d’âge de 24ans ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles monogames à Ouayerma I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur troisième  prêt solidaire, tous les prêts précédents  se sont  bien dénoués. Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de tasses, de glacières, de savons et d’articles de boutique.  
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter 3 douzaines de tasses en plastique, 1 dizaine de glacière, 8 cartons de savons et 3 paquets d’ articles de boutique. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville. Les marchandises sont vendues au marché de Ouayerma, de façon ambulante, dans des boutiques et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et la plupart au comptant.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 11.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera mise en épargne.
Certaines femmes du groupe Soro Yiriwa ambitionnent acheter un terrain à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
The women of the Soro Yiriwa group (all married) have an average age of 24 and on average, 2 children. They live in monogamous families in Ouayerma I, one of the districts of the town of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

They work with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to satisfy the needs of their clientele and are on their third solidarity loan, both the preceding loans having been reimbursed correctly. They have various businesses, among others selling dishes, coolers, soap and boutique articles.

With this new loan they expect to buy 3 dozen dishes made of plastic, 1 dozen coolers, 8 cases of bars of soap, and 3 packets of boutique articles. They buy their merchandise at the big marketplace in the town of Sikasso. The merchandise is sold at the market in Ouayerma, door-to-door, in the shops and at home, to a clientele composed of men and women, mostly for cash.

They each expect to make an average monthly profit of 11,500 F CFA of which part will be used for the needs of the family and the rest put into savings.

The ambition of certain women from the Soro Yiriwa group is to buy a plot of land on which to build a home.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en:
Memuna M. is married with one, child and has received an education through Senior High School. For one year Memuna has worked as a petty trader selling rice, sugar, oil, and onions at Siwdo in Cape Coast. While Memuna works as a trader, her husband is employed as a driver.

Memuna uses her income to help pay the family’s bills. She will use the loan to purchase more food items to sell and with the new profits from her expanded business, Memuna plans to reinvest.

loans.use: purchase more food items to sell

loans.name: Bilquis Muhammad Ali Group

texts.en:
Bilquis baji is the wife of M. A.. They have lived in Kasur, Pakistan, for the past 14 years. Kasur city is famous for its shrines and sweetmeat. Her husband is an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) driver and earns income. He drives a rented auto-rickshaw. Bilquis baji operates a thread-selling business. She gets thread from old clothes and after washing it, makes a roll of thread and sells it to shops. After that struggle she earns income. Bilquis baji is applying for a loan to repair her husband’s auto-rickshaw because it has a problem and needs urgent repairs because its engine seizes.

She is the group leader of four other women from her area. Rehana baji wants a loan to buy shoes for her shoe-selling business. Sajida baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw. Anayat baji and Suraiya baji each want loans to buy material (beads and thread) for their Paranda-making business. (Paranda is an item to tie back the hair tightly.)

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To repair the auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty F. is 52 years old. She is a widow and has five children – one daughter and four sons. They live in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western region, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso. Gifty is a hard working woman. She sells beverages in her community in the mornings and the evenings. She serves drinks such as coffee, tea, milo, and so forth. Gifty has been in business for some years now and wants a loan to buy more provision to expand her business. She wants to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị is a 45 year-old married mother of 5 grown children living in the town of Vĩnh Phúc in the Phuc Yen province.  To making a living, H. raises water buffalo.  H. has been in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month.

H. joined TYM Fund in 1999 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000,000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell.  H. is now requesting her 5th loan from TYM Fund in the amount of 10,000,000 VND in order to purchase breeding livestock.  H. believes this will help to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock.

loans.name: Clorinda Elena

texts.es:
Clorinda vive en la parroquia de Zhidmad comunidad de San José, se encuentra ubicado al noreste de la ciudad de Cuenca, es un sector rural, a 45 minutos del centro de la ciudad, Zhidmad tiene un clima muy variado parecido al de Cuenca, en este lugar se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales.
Tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y tiene 5 hijos la primera tiene 19 y la última 2 años de edad, todas sus hijos viven con ella, da gracias a Dios que la primera  le ayuda a mantener su hogar ya que trabaja en Cuenca en quehaceres domésticos y lo que gana comparte con su familia, Clorinda trabaja de dos a tres días en la ciudad realizando limpiezas en departamentos, también huertos en los campos aledaños a la ciudad, y los demás días de la semana se dedica a cuidar a sus hijas y cultivar las tierras que posee, tiene pocos animales pero solo para uso familiar.
Clorinda vive sola hace un año y medio con sus hijas ya que su esposo las dejó para irse a trabajar en la ciudad de Guayaquil, los primeros dos meses venía cada quince días a visitarnos, pero ahora viene cada 7 u 8 meses trayendo alguna cosa como yuca, naranjas, frutas, pero que de allí no deja ni un centavo para sus hijos.
Es socia de la Fundación espoir ya muchos años, el crédito que solicita ahora es el sexto o séptimo, pidió 330 dólares para invertir comprando pollos de cría, y otra parte para alimentación y vitaminas de los mismos, espera que lo que invierta pueda duplicar o triplicar con el tiempo ya que venderá los pollos en pie y pelados luego de unos dos o tres meses según como vayan creciendo los animales.
texts.en:
Clorinda lives in the parish of Zhidmad, community of San José, located north-east of the town of Cuenca. It is a rural area, 45 minutes from the center of the town. Zhidmad has a varied climate like Cuenca and people farm or raise animals for a living.

Clorinda is 40 years old, married, with 5 children, from 19 to 2 years of age. All her children live with her and she thanks God as the oldest helps maintain the home as she works in Cuenca in housekeeping and share her earnings with her family. Clorinda works two-three days in the city cleaning apartments as well as orchards close to the town, and the rest of the week she looks after her daughters and farms her land. She has few animals only for family use.

Clorinda has lived on her own with her daughters for a year and a half as her husband has gone to work in the town of Guayaquil. The first two months he would come to visit them every fortnight, but now he comes every 7-8 months bringing yuca, oranges, fruits, but does not give money for his children. Clorinda has been a partner of "Fundación Espoir" for many years, this is her sixth or seventh loan. She has requested US$330 to be invested in buying chickens,food and vitamins to raise them. She expects to double or triple the investment over time as she will sell the chickens live or plucked after two or three months depending on their growth.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in chickens, food and vitamins.

loans.name: Faasu

texts.en:
Faasu V. is a 39-year-old woman living in the town of Nonoa. She is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Faasu owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. Her main source of income comes primarily from planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Faasu has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 600 WST a month.

In 2007, Faasu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Faasu has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,250 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

Faasu is now requesting a new loan of 1,800 WST, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. The loan will be the third loan she has taken out from SPBD. Faasu plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive, and self-esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is among the villagers in St. Catalina Ilagan, Isabela who is engaged in the charcoal vending business.  Her business has been the major source of income of her family.  She is also aiming to be competitive just like others entrepreneurs in their village. Marilou is distributing her charcoals in different markets in order to gain more income. She needs to develop her business a profitable one because her children have their growing needs. With this, she would like to borrow a loan amount of PHP4, 000.00 from Kiva lenders to improve her business.  

Marilou is now 23 years old and a mother of two. Her children are not yet studying but she want to save for their future education while they are still young. She is also dreaming to give them good future by providing them complete education. She hopes that through her diligence in working with her husband, they could provide all their needs.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Turi Centro (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Turí Centro  está  conformado por nueve mujeres trabajadores y decididas a superarse, el banco está ubicado en uno de los  lugares más hermosos que tiene la ciudad de Cuenca  a unos 20 minutos a las afueras de la ciudad, siendo el mirador de Cuenca  es visitado por propios y extraños alcanzando desde allí ha admirar toda la belleza que la ciudad encierra.

Turí Centro esta formado por un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras que han encontrado la formula para salir  adelante tanto en sus hogares como en sus negocios dándonos un ejemplo de superación y  constancia y son:

Gladis  Esperanza  I. C. es socia del Banco Comunal  Turí Centro  en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 43 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos de 23, 21, 19, 17, 14 años de edad, el mayor de sus hijos se encuentra fuera del país migró al exterior para darle un mejor futuro a su familia, la segunda de sus hijas es casada creando su propio hogar, solo tres de sus hijos viven en su hogar, una de sus hijas este año ingresa a la Universidad Estatal de Cuenca y sus 2 últimos hijos estudian en el colegio Técnico Turí, esta divorciada hace 4 años y viven en casa propia.

Gladis se dedica a la crianza  de animales de corral como pollos y cuyes y también a los quehaceres domésticos, lleva 6 años en su criadero y le va muy bien, nos cuenta que depende cuanto se invierte es la ganancia y estas pueden variar porque  no  todos los pollos se crían ya que algunos se mueren, pero se encuentra contenta por que este negocio es el sustento de su hogar.

Este es su segundo ciclo trabajando con la Fundación,  aunque por un tiempo se retiro, el dinero que hoy recibe de la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR  lo va a invertir en el alimento de los pollos (chanca, balanceado), y los cuyes

 Su meta para el futuro es seguir creciendo con su negocio de crianza de animales y brindarles un presente y futuro mejor a sus hijos

Tania Paola M. C. también es socia  activa del Banco Turi Centro, vive en el Centro de Turí  en el mirador de Cuenca, tiene 30 años de edad, esta felizmente casada testigo de su amor procreo 3 hijos de 12, 9, 7 años de edad, su hijo mayor esta en el colegio Miguel Merchán, y sus dos últimos  hijos estudian en la escuela Príncipe de Paz. Su esposo trabaja como carpintero siendo su amigo inseparable en los momentos de dolor y felicidad, viven arrendando por falta de dinero para comprar o construir su propia casa.

Tania estudia en una academia de corte y confección pasando al segundo año,  se dedica al comercio de ropa dos  días a la semana,  el miércoles en la feria libre en un espacio que le brinda su mamá, y el sábado compra todo el surtido de ropa para su negocio, una de sus mayores dificultades es no contar con un puesto propio tiene que incomodar un poco a su mamá, la ventaja es que trabajando junto a su madre conoce mucha más gente  y cada vez tiene más clientes

El préstamo solicitado a la fundación lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería para incrementar  su negocio y tener un gran surtido para su exigente clientela.

Su meta para el futuro es llegar hacer una profesora de corte y confección y continuar con su negocio de ropa.

Elizabeth Patricia es otra socia activa del Banco Comunal Turi Centro, anteriormente  era miembro de otro banco que se desintegró,  ella tiene 39 años de edad,  está  separada hace 7 años y vive con sus cuatro hijos, su ex esposo les pasa la pensión a sus niños solo cuando se acuerda, nos dice.
 
Elizabeth trabaja en el mercado vendiendo una gran variedad de frutas todos los jueves y domingos, inicia sus actividades desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Desde hace  cinco años; el resto de la semana se dedica a su hogar. Nos manifiesta que la dificultad más grande es cuando bajan las ventas y apenas obtiene el dinero  para cubrir las deudas con sus proveedores y, cuando son buenas las ventas obtiene ganancia para invertir en su negocio y para el sustento diario de su hogar.

Este es su quinto ciclo trabajando junto a la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR, anteriormente era miembro de otro banco comunal que se desintegró, el dinero solicitado  lo va a invertir en su negocio comprando más frutas,  surtiendo más y mejor a  su puesto porque existe mucha competencia.

El sueño de Elizabeth  para el futuro es  sobresalir en su negocio y poder  educar a sus hijos hasta verlos convertidos en  unos buenos  profesionales.
texts.en:
The Turí Centro Communal Bank is comprised of nine hard working women who are dedicated to succeeding. The bank is located in one of the most beautiful places that the city Cuenca has, which is about 20 minutes outside of the city. Being the viewpoint of Cuenca, it is visited by natives and foreigners coming here to admire the beauty of the enclosed city. Turí Centro is comprised of a group of enterprising women who have found the formula to get ahead in their households and in their businesses. They serve as an examples of success and perseverance. They are: Gladis Esperanza I. C. is a member of the Turí Centro Communal Bank in the city of Cuenca. She is 43, and she has five children who are 23, 21, 19, 17, and 14. Her oldest child is outside of the country. He migrated to the exterior to give his family a better future. Her second daughter is married and making her own home. Only three of her children live in her home. One of her daughters enrolled this year in the State University of Cuenca. Her two last children study in the Técnico Turí school. She has been divorced for four years, and they live in their own home. Gladis raises small animals like chickens and guinea pigs. She also does the household chores. She has been raising animals for six years, and it is going very well. She tells us that the earnings are dependent upon how much is invested. And that can vary because not all of the chickens are raised, some die. But, she is happy because this business supports her household. This is her second cycle working with the Foundation, although she did withdraw for a while. The money that she gets now from the ESPOIR Foundation will be used for food for the chickens (ground, balanced) and the guinea pigs. Her future goal is to keep growing with her business of raising animals and giving her children a better today and tomorrow. Tania Paola M. C. is also an active member of the Turi Centro Bank. She lives in the Centro de Turí in the viewpoint of Cuenca. She is 30 and happily married. Her three children; 12, 9, and 7, are testaments to their love. Her oldest child goes to the Miguel Merchán school. The last two goes to the Príncipe de Paz school. Her husband works as a carpenter. Being her friend, they are inseperable in the moments of pain and happiness. They rent where they live because they do not have the money to buy or build their own house. Tania studied tailoring and passed to the second year. She sells clothes two day a week. On Wednesdays she sells in the free marked in a space her mother gives her. On Saturday she buys all her clothing stock for her business. One of her biggest difficulties is not having her own place. She has to inconvenience her mother a little bit. The advantage is that working with her mother she knows lots of people, and she gets new customers each time. The loan she is asking the foundation for is to buy merchandise to increase her business and to have a large stock for her demanding customers. Her future goal is to be a tailoring teacher and to continue with her clothing business. Elizabeth Patricia is another active member of the Turi Centro Communal Bank. She was previously a member of another bank that broke up. She is 39, and she has been separated for seven years. She lives with her four children. Her ex husband gives her child support only when her remembers. Elizabeth works in the market on Thursdays and Sundays selling a great variety of fruit. She starts at six in the morning and works until nine at night. She has been doing this for five years. The rest of the week she devotes to her home. The greatest difficulty she has is when sales drop and she barely gets enough money to cover the debts that she owes. When sales are good, she gets income to invest in her business and for the daily sustenance of her household. This is her fifth cycle working with the ESPOIR Foundation. She previously was a member of another communal bank that broke up. The money she is asking for is to buy more fruit to better stock and improve her stand because there is a lot of competition. Elizabeth’s dream for the future is to succeed in her business and to be able to educate her children until they become good professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for stock to increase their businesses

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita M. is from the village of Balanlinao, Bato. She is 45 years old. Mercedita is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Mercedita owns & operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing & selling generally manufactured products to local businesses and community members. Mercedita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Mercedita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercedita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings. Mercedita is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Mercedita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:
