Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle B. is from the village of Manabay Ozamiz City. She is 32 years old. Annabelle is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Annabelle owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. Annabelle has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Annabelle joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annabelle is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Annabelle from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her  family and save for future emergencies. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units with offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feed & other supplies

loans.name: Pacajes Group

texts.es: Artesanía en hojalata,  confección de ropa,  trenzado de mantas, venta de comida, servicio de transporte, venta de CDS, tapicería son algunos de los negocios de las integrantes del grupo Pacajes que se reúnen cada dos semanas en el Centro Focal Juan Pablo II. Dirigidas por su presidenta FeL. C. elaboran su reglamento interno, están juntas hace aproximadamente 4 años, ellas han visto en Pro Mujer una oportunidad para hacer crecer sus negocios, ahora requieren del préstamo para comprar mercadería, materia prima o insumos, de esta manera diversificar sus productos  y mejorar sus ingresos  para darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Tin handicrafts, clothing production, blanket weaving, clothing sales, transportation services, CD sales, and carpet weaving are a few of the businesses run by the members of the Pacajes group, which meetings every two weeks in the Focal Juan Pablo II center. Directed by FeL. C., the president, they create their own internal management policies. They have been together approximately four year, and have already seen that working with Pro Mujer is an opportunity to develop their businesses. They need this current loan to buy merchandise, supplies, or services in order to diversify their products and increase their revenues in order to improve their children's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise, supplies, and services

loans.name: Alba Marina

texts.es:
la sra. Alba Marina M. tiene 60 años de edad, es casada, su esposo trabaja en la Portuaria, sus hujos viven en Estados Unidos. Alba necesita el credito para ampliar su negocio que es en su casa de habitacion,necesita comprar otro tipo de zapatos para esta navidad. en esta epoca las ventas son muy buenas entonces tiene que aprovechar a comprar mercaderia al por mayor y tiene que viajar a El Salvador para comprar la mercaderia.
esta es su unica fuente de ingresos, a parte de unas remesas que le envian sus hijos.
ella se siente muy feliz ya que todo le esta saliendo bien y que su calidad de vida esta mejorando.
texts.en:
Alba Marina M. is 60 years old and married. Her husband works on the docks. Her children live in the United States. Alba needs the loan to expand her business, which is in her house. She needs to buy other types of shoes for this Christmas. Sales are very good in the Christmas season. She needs to take advantage of this and buy wholesale merchandise. She has to travel to El Salvador to buy the merchandise. This is her only source of income besides the remittances her children send her. She is very happy that everything is going well for her and that the quality of her life is improving.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shoes for women, men, and children

loans.name: Zainura

texts.en:
A. Zainura is 27 years old. She lives with her husband, and their two children. Zainura works with her husband every day in the grocery store they opened together 7 years ago. Because demand for their grocery products has increased, Zainura is requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni, which will be used to purchase key grocery items in bulk for resale. Zainura and her husband hope to use their business' earnings to provide a solid education for their children.  
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Foodstuff for selling for increasing of the stock

loans.name: Ireneo

texts.en:
Ireneo S. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao Camiguin Province. He is 43 years old, married and has three school-aged children. Ireneo's main source of income comes from his "habal habal" (motorcycle) transportation business, which he has been operating for over six year. Hi business generates approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Ireneo joined HSPFI to access their financial services in an effort to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Ireneo is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP to purchase materials needed to expand his service offerings. This loan will be his first HSPFI loan. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand service offerings.

loans.name: Fagaitaua

texts.en:
Fagaitaua F. is 43 and married with 6 children.  She owns a business venture, selling puletasi (Samoan formal wear).  Fagaitaua has 2 years of experience in this business.  Fagaitaua needs a loan of WST $1250 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

Fagaitaua joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Fagaitaua's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Fagaitaua F. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.4 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.8 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Julio

texts.en:
Julio G. is from the village of Bayabo East, Tumauini, Isabela. He is 59 years old. Julio is married and has 12 school-aged children. To make a living, Julio owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice to sell. Julio has been engaged in his business for over fifteen years and earns approximately $340 per harvest for this activity.

Julio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Julio is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be his sixth loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlingsand young crops to raise

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou S. est âgée de 51 ans, elle est veuve et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 4 ans et demis et a été 9 fois de suite bénéficiaire de prêts. Son objectif est de développer son activité principal de restauration et son activité secondaire de transformation et vente de pâte d'arachide, de poisson fumé et/ou séché et de légumes. Avec ses revenus financiers elle parvient à assurer la prise en charge de ses enfants et à subvenir à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Fatou S. is a 51-year old widowed mother of five children. She has been a member of the local village loan group for 4 and a half years, and has had 9 previous loan experiences. Her goal is to develop her principal business of preparing and selling food and her secondary activity of processing and selling peanut paste, smoked and/or dried fish, and vegetables. With her income, she is able to take care of her children and provide for herself.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her self-financing capability

loans.name: Pastora Tagab Group

texts.en:
Pastora T. is from the village of Tipolo, Plaridel. She is 56 years old. Pastora is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are each responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if that person is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 'Pastora T.'. Pastora is married and has 8 adult children. To make a living, Pastora owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Pastora has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Pastora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pastora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Pastora is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Pastora from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Regzenlham

texts.en:
Regzenlham is 55 years old and lives with her daughter in Arhangai province, Mongolia. She and her daughter live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. In 2005 Regzenlham started a cosmetic products trading business. In addition, she has been operating a construction material trading business since 1997, which has a working capital of 1,000,000 MNT ($703). She operates both businesses because her construction material business is seasonal. As a result of her hard work, the working capital of her cosmetics business has grown to 3,000,000 MNT ($2111). 

Regzenlham is a very hardworking person and has great communication skills. She likes to quote the Mongolian saying, “Right-mind, Right-action”. She is requesting a 200,000 MNT ($140) loan to purchase a variety of products at wholesale prices and sell them for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products at wholesale prices

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela A. is 24 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Nyamasaria, Kisumu, Kenya. Pamela is an entrepreneur who plants and sells vegetables, a business she began in 2007 after the collapse of her tailoring business. She gets her stock from around Kisumu and has it restocked every three months after harvesting.
She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy her own sewing machine as she plans to revive her tailoring business.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo F. is from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. He is 46 years old, is separated from his spouse, and has three school-aged children.

Wilfredo owns and operates a business providing motorcycle transport services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Wilfredo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI.

Wilfredo is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to repair his motorcycle for him to continually operate his transport business. This loan will be his 3rd from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family’s income and support his children’s education. 


About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 47 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y a un hijo dependiente en el caserío Cruz del Medano del distrito de Mórrope, un distrito caracterizado por tener a la mayoría de su población dispersa en zonas rurales que tienen como actividades principales la agricultura y la crianza de animales, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y queda ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales desde hace mas de 20 años. El cría aves de corral y cerdos en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que visitan la zona y también a sus vecinos. Esta actividad le provee de ingresos con los cuales se ayuda para sostener a su familia, ya que los ingresos que percibe de su trabajo como agricultor no le bastan para solventar a la familia. 

Esta actividad tiene muy buena acogida por la zona y Juan desea ampliar su negocio para percibir mas ganancias y salir adelante, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más animales menores y alimentos balanceados con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.

Juan es un padre basntante entregado a su familia, el siempre piensa en el bienestar y progreso de los suyos y por ello se esfuerza al máximo en su trabajo, sus vecinos y conocidos le sonsideran una persona responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Juan is 47years old, and he is married. He lives with his wife and one dependent child in the rural community of Cruz del Medano in the Mórrope district. This district characteristically has most of its population dispersed in rural areas. The main activities are farming and raising animals. It belongs to the Lambayeque province, which is located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Juan has been raising and selling animals for over 20 years. He raises poultry and pigs in the area behind his house. When the animals have grown well enough, he sells them to businessmen who visit the area. He also sells to his neighbors. This activity provides income to help support his family. The income from his farming work is not enough to support his family. This activity is well received in the area. Juan wishes to expand his business in order to get more income and get ahead. Therefore, he has seen the need, for the first time, to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 2,000 PEN. He plans to use the money to buy more small animals and balanced food. This way he plans to achieve his objective. Juan is very devoted to his family. He always thinks about the well-being and progress of his loved ones. That is why he puts forth maximum effort in his work. His neighbors and the people who know him consider him to be a responsible and trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy small animals and balanced food to expand his business of raising and selling animals

loans.name: Kusumawathi

texts.en:
Kusumawathi is a 48-year-old married woman living in Telijjawila, part of the Matara area of Sri Lanka.  She has three daughters who are 8, 6, and 4 years old.

Kusumawathi has run a tuition class (private education service) for four years, teaching local children in her area.  She has asked for a 20,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri Lanka, to help purchase desks for her pupils in the classroom.

Thank you for taking time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To purchase desks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy palm nuts

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa I. is from the village of San Fermin, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 59 years old. Jesusa is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Jesusa runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Aside from that, she also sells rice in her store. Jesusa has been engaged in her business for more than 14 years and earns approximately 9,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jesusa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jesusa is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Jesusa from ASKI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
La   Sra. Brigida F. de Zaracho  es de San Estanislao, tiene 46 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos  y tiene casa propia.
 
           La Señora es propietaria de  una despensa que funciona en su domicilio,  con clientela formada, tiene buenos ingresos, y buenas referencias comerciales y personales, hace un tiempo que también realiza repartos de mercaderías  en su vehículo con su hijo.
           Su marido se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 10 has de tierra en donde tiene sus cultivos diversos y también animales vacunos.
            Este crédito utilizó para la compra de maderas y chapas para construcción de un galpón para su deposito de mercaderías.
texts.en:
Sra. Brigida F. de Zaracho is from San Estanislao. She is 46 years old, married, has four children, and lives in her own home.

Brigida is the owner of a food pantry that she operates out of her home. She has an established customer base, earns good income, and has excellent business and personal references. In addition, she makes deliveries with her son using her vehicle. Her husband is a farmer and has ten hectares of land on which he grows different crops and raises cattle.

This loan will be used to buy lumber and boards in order to build a storage shed for keeping her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lumber & boards to build a storage shed for her merchandise

loans.name: Jackbed

texts.en:
Jackbed is a 36-year-old married lady who has an embroidery business. She makes tablecloths and also does embroidery work for other tailors for a fee. She has been in this business for two years.

Jackbed previously took out a loan of 20,000 KES which was guaranteed by the members of Joy Group in Faulu Kenya. This loan made her business grow and she now employs one person.

Jackbed needs to purchase another embroidery machine for faster and better services to her customers. Therefore, she has requested 40,000 KES. She hopes to expand her business and employ more people. She sees herself opening a textile and accessories shop in five years time.

loans.use: To buy another embroidery machine

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en: Sadia A.  is currently in the business of selling various perfumes, gels and body lotions in the shop and is requesting a loan to stock more perfumes to sell.  Sadia is 27 years old and is married to a husband who is a driver. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her shop.

loans.use: Stock more perfumes, etc., to sell

loans.name: Hellen Juma

texts.en:
Hellen Juma O. is a woman of thirty-eight years old. Married to Eliud Oyoo and blessed with six children, they live in the road block area in Eldoret town. Her business is in Eldoret town, where she buys fruits like bananas in bulk and sells them in small quantities. Hellen has been in this business for fourteen years now and gets a monthly salary of fifty thousand.

This will be Hellen's second loan from KADET. She plans to use the loan to buy more stock, like bananas and green maize for resale. With the income she is going to get, she plans to pay school fees for her children.

In the future Hellen plans to provide for her children by educating them to the highest level, and providing for their basic needs.

loans.use: To buy more stock for resale

loans.name: Juvelin

texts.en:
Juvelin L. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 30 years old. Juvelin is married and has 2 school-age children. To make a living, Juvelin owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Juvelin has been engaged in her business for over 8 years. She works hard to sustain her children's education. She wants them to have bright futures.

Juvelin joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juvelin has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Juvelin is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Juvelin from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Byambadolgor

texts.en:
Byambadolgor T. is 46 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her two children both currently attend university in Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia. 

Byambadolgor operates a grocery and consumer goods trading business in the street with help of her husband. She began her own business in 2000 and has been selling a variety of products in the street since 2004. One or two times a month, she buys her inventory both from wholesale stores locally and in Ulaanbaatar. She is a very accurate and tough minded person. 

Byambadolgor would like to one day own her own grocery store where she can sell a larger variety of goods that will attract many more customers. And also she wants to provide her children a good education. She is requesting a 3,700,000 Mongolian tugrug loan so that he can purchase a larger variety of grocery products at wholesale price from Ulaanbaatar.

loans.use: To purchase a larger variety of grocery products

loans.name: Independencia Group

texts.es: Aura Marina G. C., tiene 23 años de edad, soltera, de oficios domesticos, se dedica a la artesanía, con el fin de ampliar se capital de trabajo organiza un grupo conformado por 5 personas, señoras, las que se dedican a la artesanía elaborando canastas  y trajes típicos, son originarias de la misma zona y tienen un estrecho lazo de compañerismo. Es el segundo crédito que solicitan para ampliación de capital de trabajo igual que sus compañeras, sus referencia personales indican que son mujeres responsables y trabajadoras, en la fase de conformación del grupo anterior demostraron ser muy solidarias entre ellas, tiene grandes objetivos por lo que saben que su negocio es rentable.
texts.en: The Grupo Solidario La Independencia (Independence Solidarity Group) is composed of five women, who all engage in crafts producing traditional baskets and costumes. They come from the same area and they are united by a strong friendship. The coordinator is 23 years old and she is single. They are requesting their second loan to increase their working capital. According to their personal references, they are all responsible and hard-working women, and they demonstrated being very caring with each other during the organizing phase of their group. They will be able to comply with their monthly repayments with the help of their families.

loans.use: To increse their working capital.

loans.name: Tamarsu Group

texts.en:
Kadie M. (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Kadie was born in Makeni city about 30 years ago. She is married to a miner and the couple has four children: two are in primary school and two are not of school-going age. For many years, Kadie has been selling rice, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), vegetable oil, fish, etc. 

This is the first loan that Kadie and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and, consequently, improve their living conditions. 

Kadie will use her share of the loan (SLL 800,000) to expand her business. She will buy rice, palm oil, vegetable oil, fish, etc. in large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy rice, palm oil, vegetable oil, fish, etc. in large quantity to add to her current stock

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan N. lives in the Ndeeba neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has six children, all of whom are in school.  Susan has a business that began as a shop, but is now a beauty salon. She has been in this business for less than a year, and she works seven days a week. Susan has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of hair relaxers and braids. The main business challenges for Susan include defaulters and the rainy season. Her goals and aspirations are to own a bridal salon and buy a plot of land. Susan lives in a rented home and has access to electricity, but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and medication.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of hair relaxers and braids

loans.name: Maintain Yourself Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Maintain Yourself” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and, consequently, improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Fatmata K.. Fatmata is age 35. She was born in Magburaka town where she is currently residing together with her husband and two children. Her husband is a businessman and one of her children is attending primary school. For 10 years now, Fatmata has been selling body lotion, baby clothes, and underwear. She has been a businesswoman for many years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to her stock.

loans.use: To buy body lotion, baby clothes, and underwear in large quantity to add to her stock

loans.name: Houssein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a 36-year-old husband and father of four children. 

Houssein has been the owner of a turnery since 1995. Since he is very experienced in this field, he has an excellent reputation and he is well known in his community.

After benefiting from his prior loan, now he is applying for a $3,000 loan to buy a big generator. He aims to expand his business to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a big generator

loans.name: Mrs. Taet Eth Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The nine people wH. make up this village bank loan group live in Pou Bay village, Takeo province. They have selected Mrs. Taet E. to become the village bank president. They will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' living standards. 

Mrs. Taet E. and her husband, Mr. Han Loeng, are farmers wH. own a more than 2-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell to support their family. She is a pig breeder, too. 

She has some challenges, both in farming and breeding because her field is infertile and she wants to breed more pigs, but she does not have enough money. Mrs. Taet E. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and two piglets. She has five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another one is a laborer, another lives with aunt and two others are students.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and two piglets

loans.name: Javier Jose

texts.es:
Javier de 45 años, tiene la tienda de víveres en donde vende arroz, bebidas, enlatados etc. Desde ese tiempo ella ha continuado trabajando para asegurar su futuro.

Viviendo en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo ha trabajado con esfuerzo y dedicación todos estos años para surtir su tienda con diversos víveres. Quiere continuar con su negocio porque tiene muchas aspiración para asegurar su vejez por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, enlatados, bebidas para su negocio. Uno de los objetivos para su tienda es agrandarla y surtirla con varia mercadería.
texts.en:
Javier, 45, has a grocery store where he sells rice, beverages, canned goods, etc.  He has been working for quite some time to assure his future.

Living in an urban zone, called Guasmo, he has worked hard and with dedication all these years to stock his store with various groceries.  He wants to stay in business because he has many hopes to assure his old age.  This is why he wants a loan to buy rice, sugar, canned goods and beverages for his store.  One of his goals is to enlarge the store and stock it with assorted merchandise.

loans.use: For rice, sugar, canned goods and beverages.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married and has one child. 

In 2005, Ahmad decided to open his own business, a mobile phone shop. The business is located in an area where competition is minimal; this makes him well known in the market. He has an excellent reputation as well.

He is requesting a $2000 loan to pay the annual rent for the shop and increase his inventory. He is aiming to expand his business and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for the shop and increase his inventory

loans.name: Las Manzanitas 1 Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en la casa de Isabel G. L., una integrante del grupo de Manzanitas I, que esta ubicado en el estado de Veracruz en México. Se ve a las 11 integrantes del grupo en la foto. Ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos,que inició hace 25 años. Solicita este prestamo para adquirir, sillas y mesas para su puesto de memelas ( sopes ) en el nuevo mercado de orizaba. Sus ganacias han aumentado por la nueva ubicación que tiene el negocio de la señora. Al momento de solicitar este prestamo se siente satisfecha y muy contenta por el nuevo prestamo.Tiene 40 años estudio hasta primaria, es madre y  tiene 6 hijos, 3 hombres y 3 mujeres. Quiere este credito para comprar sillas y mesas para su nuevo puesto en el mercado orizaba. Tambien espera obtener ganancias para terminar de construir su casa y tener mejor calidad de vida. Observación: la segunda señora de izquierda a derecha, que carga un bebe, pero no se ve ella bien se llama Rosa P..
texts.en:
This photo was taken at the home of Isabel G. L., a member of the group “Las Manzanitas I” (The Little Apples I), which is located in the State of Veracruz in Mexico. There are eleven group members who appear in the photo. Isabel began selling snacks 25 years ago and is requesting a loan to acquire chairs and tables for her soup stand at the new market in Orizaba. Her earnings have increased since starting her business in this new location. Upon submitting her request, Isabel felt satisfied and happy to be receiving a new loan. She is 40 years old and studied through elementary school. Isabel is the mother of six children, three sons and three daughters. Isabel wants his loan so that she can buy chairs and tables for her new stand at the Orizaba Market. In addition, she hopes to earn money to finish the construction of her house and have a better quality of life.

Note: The woman standing second to the left and holding a baby is Rosa P., but she cannot be seen very well.

loans.use: Purchase tables & chairs

loans.name: Vang's Group

texts.en:
Vang T. P. is 55 years old and has two married children. Being a farmer, her main activities focus on growing rice and vegetables and raising pigs. Her agricultural products are used both to feed the family and to earn money. Ms Vang became a SEDA client in 2006 and has been a good group leader during her participation in the program. This year, she hopes to have a bigger loan size (7,194,000 VND ) than last year (5,014,000 VND) to buy more pigs to raise.

Ly T. P. is 46 years old. She raises 300 chickens for eggs. She wants to have a loan of 7,194,000 VND to buy food for them.

Khanh T. D. is 38 years old, with two children who attend high school. She raises 200 chickens for meat. She wants to have a loan of 7,194,000 VND to buy food for them.

Chin T. T. is 35 years old, with 2 children. She grows rice and vegetables in a paddy of 3,600 square meters. She wants to have a loan of 7,630,000 VND to buy fertilizer and pesticide to improve the quality of her products.

Quy T. H. is 48 years old. She raises 200 chickens for meat. She wants to have a loan of 7,194,000 VND to buy food for them.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to raise

loans.name: Jose Hector

texts.es:
Don José, reside en Corinto departamento de Morazán, vive con dos hijas Ana Raquel de 9 años y  Angélica de 8 años de edad, el posee una tienda hace 16 años, el horario de ventas es de 6:30 am a 7:00pm, las dificultades de don José son las ventas al crédito ya que muchos clientes no regresan a cancelar su pendiente.
Pero aun así don José quiere invertir en mercadería solicitando un préstamo que le ayude a abastecer la tienda, comprando productos como aceite, arroz, huevos, jabón, ya que estos son demandados por sus clientes.
Este préstamo le diversificara los productos para ofrecer y así mejorar su atención y servicio. La aspiración de él es tener un negocio fuerte conservar buenos clientes, salir adelante con la ayuda de financiamiento.
texts.en:
José lives in Corinto, Morazán department with two daughters, Ana Raquel, 9, and Angélica, 8.  He has had a store for 16 years.  Its hours of operation are from 6:30am until 7pm.  José’s difficulties are sales on credit because lots of customers don’t return to pay their debts.

But, nevertheless, José wants to invest in merchandise and is asking for a loan to stock the store buying such items as: oil, rice, eggs and soap, since they are requested by his customers.

He will diversity his products with this loan to offer better customer service.  His goal is to have a strong business, to retain good customers and to get ahead with the loan’s assistance.

loans.use: To buy oil, rice, eggs and soap.

loans.name: Levenia

texts.en:
Levenia M. is from the village of Batinay, Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 32 years old. Levenia is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Levenia owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling firewood, bananas & coconuts in the local community. She is also providing services such as pedicure & manicure. Levenia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Levenia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Levenia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Levenia is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional firewood & bananas to sell. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Levenia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional firewood & bananas to sell.

location.town: Batinay, Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Or

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna is a farmer from the town of Banga, South Cotabato. She is 27 years old and married. She has 2 children ages 4 and 2. Erna has been in the farming business for more than 6 years. She grows rice and corn crops to sell to her community. Erna works hard to earn to be able to save for her children's education. She said she only wants the best for them.

Erna's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony N. O. is 28 and married to Abigail. Together they have two children. He has been in the motorbike transport business (bodaboda) for the past three years. 

He was introduced to KADET by a credit officer, thus applying for his first loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from KADET Ltd, which he will use to improve his business by servicing the motorbike.

With the profits generated from his business he plans to pay school fees for his children. He dreams of being rich. He is an assiduous man who works with effort to attain more despite limited resources.

loans.use: to improve his business by servicing the motorbike

loans.name: Nan

texts.en: Nan S. is a 38 year-old rice cultivator who lives in Kompong Cham province. For many years now, she and her husband always help each other to grow their rice crop on their land. They get a profit from their planting-rice crop of approximately 3.5USD each day. They use this for food expenses and other miscellaneous. Nan S. has difficulties meeting her traveling needs because she always pays a lot of money to taxi drivers when she and her family want to go anywhere. Therefore, she hopes to reduce the amount she spends on transportation by using her loan to purchase a motorbike. Nan S. has three children, who still study in public school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Barbara Guilliana

texts.es:
Barbara es una madre D. familia D. 48 años D. edad, vive con su hijo en su casa propia la cula cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicado en el distrito D. Olmos a unos 40 minutos del departamento D. Lambayeque.  Estas zonas se caracterizan por su alta actividad comercial, agricola y turismo que desarrollan sus pobladores.

Barbara ha puesto  en su casa una bodega a la cual se dedica  hace varios años.  En su bodega sus vecinos encuentran toda clase D. productos comestibles, con la venta D. su productos obtendra un mejor nivel D. vida.

Mediante una visita a Edpyme Alternativa Barbara trata D. poder adquirir un préstamo D. 1500 nuevos soles para comprar más productos para su tienda para obtener mayores ganacias.

Barbara es conocida por sus vecinos, por ser una mujer  alegre, dispuesta a ayudar a otros y una madre responsable con el objetivo D. que hija salgan adelante apunta D. esfuerzo y trabajo.
texts.en:
Barbara is a 48 year old housewife. She lives with her child in her own house which has all the basic services and is located in the Olmos district, about 40 minutes from the department of Lambayeque. These areas are characterized by a lot of business activity, farming, and tourism that their inhabitants are developing.

For several years, Barbara has had a grocery shop in her house. In her shop, her neighbors find all kinds of edible products. Through the sale of these products she will obtain a better quality of life. By means of a visit to Epydme Alternative Barbara has applied for a loan of 1500 new soles in order to purchase more products for her shop so that she can obtain greater earnings.

Barbara is known to her neighbors as a happy women determined to help others and as a responsible mother. Her goal is for her child to get ahead as a result of her effort and work

loans.use: to purchase more products in order to stock her shop.

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es:
Maria de 55 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene un negocio de venta de ropa en su casa. Pero antes de comenzar a vender la ropa ella era empleada domestica en una casa pero decidió salir de ese trabajo porque le pagaban muy poco y necesitaba pasar tiempo con sus hijos y darle una mejor vida.

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere continuar trabajando para darle una buena vida a sus hijos ya que esta separa de su esposo hace 10 años y ella ha mantenido el hogar. Por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar ropa como pantalones, camisas, blusas.
texts.en:
María, 55, is a hard working woman who sells clothes at home.  However, before starting to sell clothes she was a domestic employee at a house but decided to leave that job because she was paid very little and she needed to be able to spend time with her children and give them a better life.

She has many goals for her business and wants to continue working to provide her children with a good life since she’s been separated from her husband for the last 10 years and she’s supported the household.  Because of this, she wants the loan to buy clothes like pants, shirts and blouses.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Dolgorsuren

texts.en:
Dolgorsuren is 48 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Hovd province in Mongolia. Her older son is an attorney and her second son is a student. Her younger daughter, Ariunzaya, attends the local secondary school. 

Dolgorsuren manages a vegetable trading business in her town, with the help of her husband. They started their business in 2003 and are planning to continue it in the future. She is responsible for selling the harvested vegetables, and her husband is responsible for planting them. Now they own one hectare of land where they plant carrots, cabbage and potatoes. They are one of the experienced planters in their town. 

Dolgorsuren is a polite woman who is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase seeds for her business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds

loans.name: Mupakasya

texts.en: Mupakasya is a twenty-three-year-old married man with two children, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling groundnuts for five years. He started the business with 200,000 Uganda shillings and now he has capital of 5,000,000 Uganda shillings. His hardship is high rent costs and his vision is owning a food store and educating his children. Mupakasya intends to use the loan to buy groundnuts for resale.

loans.use: To buy groundnuts for sale.

loans.name: Nelly Mireya

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Las Américas se reúne cada quince días en  la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde tiempos coloniales  como la Ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, por la inmensa cantidad de arboles de esta fruta de ahí este nombre, con el que se lo conoce hasta la actualidad.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Nelly, ella tiene 41 años, está soltera  pero de una relación que tuvo hace mucho  tiene  cuatro hijos de 20, 18, 13 y 8 años los mismos que estudian en Universidad, colegio y escuela.

Ella es una abnegada madre que para que sus hijos tengan un buen futuro y que nunca les falte nada se dedica a la venta de ropa por catálogo tanto nacional como colombiana de algunas marcas, también vende productos de Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorio para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedidos, nos cuenta que lo que más vende es la ropa íntima de mujer que son muy solicitada por las damas y los perfumes tanto de damas y caballeros. Trabaja todos los días unas cinco horas por dia, su mercadería la deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, nos cuenta que lleva como 15 años dedicada a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería, como camisas, blusas, pantalones, ropa interior, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Está en el Banco hace cuatro ciclos y le gusta porque con los créditos se ayuda mucho.
 
Sus sueños son  tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es arrendado y que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Las Américas” meets every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí. This city has been known since colonial times as the city of “Reales Tamarindos” because of the large number of tamarind trees that continue to exist today.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Nelly. She is 41 years old and single, but was in a relationship for many years. Nelly has four children (ages 20, 18, 13, and 8) who are studying either at the university, high school, or elementary school.

She is a devoted mother who wants her children to have a good future and lack nothing. Nelly sells clothing through catalogs but also carries garments made by Colombian brands. In addition, she sells products made by Yanbal (a company known for beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories). Her sales are generated by going door-to-door and taking orders. She says that the products that are most requested are women’s lingerie and fragrances for both men and women. Nelly works every day for approximately five hours each day. Her merchandise is offered on credit and she collects payments on a weekly basis. She says that she has been in business for 15 years and has done very well.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise such as shirts, blouses, trousers, undergarments, perfumes, crèmes, and cosmetics. Nelly has been with the Communal Bank for four loan cycles and enjoys being a member because the loans have been a great help.

Her dreams are to own a home since she currently rents and to see her children become successful professionals.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, blouses, trousers, undergarments, perfumes, crèmes, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Anita has a shop that sells snacks, beverages & canned goods. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional snacks & beverages.

Anita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Anita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional snacks & beverages

loans.name: Constace

texts.en:
Constance is a 50-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur with five children between the ages of 7 and 27 years old, all of whom are in school.  She is a widow and sells vegetables.

She has been running her business for the past 27 years and it has enabled her to feed her family and pay for her children’s medical insurance. 

She will use the money from this loan to purchase 250 kg of peanuts, 250 kg of onions, 20 basins of tomatoes, carrots, and green beans.  

With the future profits from this business, she plans to pay the school fees for her children and save funds for their futures

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with two children, one attends school while one is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

For the past three years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her greatest challenge is seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Patriciah

texts.en: Patriciah is 29 years old and a single mother of a six-year-old. She runs a quarrying business to earn a living.  She is able to provide a good education for her child with the income she gets from her business. She has two years of experience in operating her business and she has employed two people. Patriciah hopes to expand her business in the future. She has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy a drilling machine.

loans.use: To buy a drilling machine

loans.name: Gedion

texts.en:
Gedion is  27 years-old, is married and a father of one child. Gedion owns a barber shop in Bombolulu, Mombasa. He has been in this business for the last eight months and it has been a success.

This marks his first borrowing from KADET LTD to finance his business.He plans to expand his business by purchasing another shaving machine, spirits and after shave. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand his business. His dream is to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: purchase another shaving machine, spirits and after shave.

loans.name: Akram

texts.ru: Акрам умный и честный человек. Он женат и ответственный отец 3 детей.  Он занимается купля продажей скот. Он знал данный бизнес с детство, и он мечтал, открыт свой маленький бизнес. Более 5 лет он успешно продолжает данный бизнес. До этого времени во всем помогал ему его отец и с помощью отца он купил старый дом, и теперь он хочет от своего бизнеса перестроить дом и отремонтировать  двор по своему вкусу по новому стилю. Акрам хотел бы получить займ в размере 2200$ США для покупки бычков с целью расширения бизнеса и получения максимальной прибыли.
texts.en: Akram is a smart and honest person.  He is married and is a responsible father of three children.  He is involved in buying and selling livestock.  Akram has known this business since childhood and dreamt of opening his own small business.  He has been successfully running this business for over five years.  Until now, his father helped him with everything, and Akram was able to buy an old house with his father's help.  Now Akram wants to use his business income to rebuild this house and redo his yard according to his own taste and new style.  Akram wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $2200 for the purchase of calves in order to expand his business and maximize his profits.

loans.use: to purchase calves and expand his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials (sand, cinder blocks, cement, stone, etc.) to continue the construction on his house.

loans.name: Rubielyn

texts.en:
Rubielyn is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family. 

Rubielyn requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Rubielyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Yarjah

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Yarjah. He is married and has three children aged 15, 9 and 6. He has two additional dependents who live with him because they are his relatives.  

In 1991, Yarjah established his patient drugs, cosmetics and video cassettes business. He began his business because he wants to be able to take care of his family. Working six days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about 1,300,000 Sierra Leone leones (SLL) every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Yarjah has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to improve the sale of cosmetics. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. 

In the future, Yarjah plans to improve the cooling facilities of the shop to make it more standard and to support the education of his children. The loan helped him to improve his shop to meet the pharmacy board standard. He thanks you for your support

loans.use: To buy more medicines for his pharmacy.

loans.name: Ricardina

texts.es: La socia actualmente sigue con su negocio de administración y atención de sus tienda de abarrotes, la socia trabaja de lunes a sabados en su tienda de abarrotes, ella también esta entrando en la artesanía, la socia esta aprendiendo el negocio del arte en especial en la artesanía como ceniceros, silvatos, adornos hechos en arcilla y pintados con oxidos naturales. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad y de panetones para las fiesta navideñas y un poco invertir en la compra de artesanía hecha para la venta y ver si este nuevo negocio le renta.
texts.en: The member currently continues with her business administering and tending to her grocery store. She works from Monday to Saturday in her store, and is also beginning to get into handicrafts. She is learning the business of art, especially handicrafts like ashtrays, whistles, and ornaments made from clay and painted with natural oxide paints. She is requesting the loan to be able to purchase staple products and fruitcakes for Christmas time, as well as a little bit to be able to purchase handicrafts made to be sold and see if this new business proves profitable for her.

loans.use: to stock her store and a little bit to invest in purchasing handicrafts.

loans.name: Ayesa Paola

texts.es:
Ayesa es de la ciudad de luque, vive en casa de sus padres donde tiene una despensa bien surtida. Comenta que gracias a su negocio ella puede ayudar a sus padres y cubrir los gastos que diariamente surgen. 
Cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela, gracias a que tiene muy buena variedad de productos y sumado a eso la buena atención que ella da a los clientes. Uno de sus sueños es seguir creciendo y el día de mañana tener un supermercado bien equipado. 
Ella solicita su crédito para la compra de bebidas, panificados, lácteos, cárnicos, embutido y otros productos, los cuales le será muy conveniente para abastecer su local, ya que podrá de esa forma podrá cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ayesa is from the city of Luque.  She lives in her parents’ house where she has a well-stocked store.  She comments that thanks to her business she can help her parents cover daily expenses.

She comments that she has a good, regular clientele because she has a good variety of products plus the good service she gives to her customers.  One of her dreams is to continue growing and someday have a well-equipped supermarket.

She is asking for her loan to buy beverages, baked goods, dairy products, meats, cured meats and other products which will be very convenient for stocking her store and be able to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy beverages, baked goods, dairy goods, meat, cured meats and others.

loans.name: Oscar Vicente

texts.es: El señor Oscar  , es un humilde agricultor de la zona de Nindirí , junto a su esposa la cual labora como comerciante para apoyarle con los gatos del hogar , ya que tienen hijos a su cargo , los planes hacia du familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida ya que su mayor ilusión es que sus hijos lleguen a la universidad , don Oscar desde hace varios años se dedica a los cultivos de piña , la mayor afectación que se le presenta son las plagas que invaden el cultivos ya que este carece de fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para una mejor producción .Agradece la confianza que le brinda Afodenic atraves de los fondos Kiva ; ya que son muchos los agricultores que se benefician con estos programas de apoyo a la personas del campo .
texts.en: Oscar is a humble farmer in the Nindirí area of Nicaragua. He lives with his wife, who works as a merchant to help with household expenses, and they have children under their care. Their plan is to improve their living conditions because their biggest dream is for their children to attend college. Oscar has cultivated pineapple for a number of years. The biggest problem he faces is when pests invade his crops, since he lacks fertilizer and necessary ingredients for better production. He is grateful for the support Afodenic provides through the Kiva loans since there are many farmers who benefit from these programs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Shandy

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”RICCHARY CUSCO; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Shandy;  La socia tiene 28 años de edad, La socia es soltera, La socia tiene 1 hijo de 8 años, la socia tiene su negocio de compra y venta de vinos, de forma independiente, la socia desea invertir en la compra de mercadería, la socia aprovechara las fiestas de navidad para comprar vinos en cajas al por mayor para distribuirlos en las diferentes tiendas. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de vinos al por mayor para las fiestas navideñas.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This member belongs to RICCHARY CUSCO Communal Bank, located in Huanchac district, Cusco Province, Cusco Department.
Her name is Shandy, 28. She is the single mother of a 8 year old child. She has an independent wine selling business. Shandy wants to invest buying stock. She wants to make a profit during the holiday season by buying wholesale wine boxes and retailing them to various stores. She requests this loan in order to buy wholesale wine for the holiday season.
Shandy is thankful for the loan and promises to repay on time, according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy wholesale wine for the holiday season

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr:
Ama( en tricot gris avec des rayures)est une femme âgé(e) de 27 ans. Elle est mariée à un électronicien et a 01 enfant.
Ama travaille comme revendeuse de mèches depuis 04ans. Elle est aidée par une personne et vend dans un marché de la place. Son approvisionnement se fait à ACCRA et à LOME.
Ama a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des mèches de toutes catégories. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Ama voudrait agrandir son commerce et prendre bien soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ama (wearing a gray knit with stripes) is 27 years old. She is married to an electronics engineer and has one child.

Ama has been working as a retailer of hair locks for the past four years. She is assisted by one person and sells in a local market. She resupplies in Accra and Lome.

Ama has requested her first WAGES credit loan to purchase different types of hair locks, as she wants to reinvest in her business activity.

In coming years, Ama would like to expand her business and take good care of her family.

loans.use: Buy hair locks

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN VALENTIN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio tiene 45 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de carne, el socio vende desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio el socio quiere salir adelante, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de carne. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar carne al por mayor.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the "San Valentin" communal bank, located in the district of Cusco, which is part of Cusco province, in Cusco department. He is 45 years old and single. 

He alternates his daily activities with his business of buying and selling meat. He sells from 9:00am to 6:00pm. By means of this business, the borrower wants to get ahead in life. His dream is to expand his meat-selling business.

He is applying for the loan in order to buy meat at wholesale. The borrower is happy about the loan, and promises to make his instalment payments.

loans.use: To buy meat at wholesale for later sale.

loans.name: Rajabu

texts.en:
Rajabu is a married man with two children who attend school. His wife is a businesswoman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. He lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children. 

Rajabu has worked as a driver for the past three years; his potential clients are local area residents. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. He dreams of starting a new vegetable grocery business.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase vegetables like carrots, tomatoes, onions and cabbages for his new grocery business. He decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables like carrots, tomatoes, onions and cabbages for his new greengrocery business.

loans.name: Sakeena

texts.en:
Sakeena is responsible mother of five children and is 35 years of age. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, where her son has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for the last 20 years.

Sakeena's son needs now to buy a new vehicle because the current condition of his vehicle is not good. Due to insufficient financial means he is unable to buy a new vehicle. Therefore his mother Sakeena has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan Sakeena's son can afford the cost easily. In this way he can provide the better transport facilities to earn the profitable income.

She also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her son's income to meet her family's needs in future.

loans.use: to help her son purchase a taxi.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar I., born in Pichincha, Ecuador, has been a “guayaco” (a Guayaquilian) for 25 years now. He is married with two children that are in school. He owns a business selling used clothes and doing shoe repair. Oscar was originally a factory worker who did not know how to run such a business, but through the encouragement of a friend, he decided to sell second-hand clothes and exhibit them at his parents’ house. He chose to locate the business there since so many people pass by everyday. His decision paid off because bit-by-bit more customers started walking through the door. Now, Oscar’s business is located along a major thoroughfare, and the all of the locals know him for his low prices and quality work. Mr. I. has taken courses in shoe repair as well. He needs this loan so that he can purchase material for cloths such as cotton, silk, a new sewing machine, and shoe repair products such as buffers and vices.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about Ecuadorian businesses and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: purchase material for clothes such as cotton, silk, a new sewing machine, and shoe repair products such as buffers and vices.

loans.name: Hasena

texts.en:
Hasena is 32 years old and lives with her 5 children in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

Hasena shares a business with her two sons and one daughter, weaving carpets at home. She has 6 years' experience in the current business.

Hasena took a 1st loan cycle to buy thread and other materials. Before she had problems with a lack of materials.

Hasena is an uneducated women but she wants her children to be educated. Therefore her children are only working part time.

loans.use: To buy carpet materials

loans.name: Eliepa

texts.en: Eliepa is a 69-year-old woman living in a small Samoan village.  She has a small pension entitlement from the government, but this isn't enough to live on or to help her build up her savings account balance.  So Eliepa runs a flea market stall.  She started just selling peanuts, but she has now expanded into merchandise, including women's and men's clothing.  Eliepa is a rarity in Samoan society – a woman of nearly 70 years who is financially independent.  She is quick to report that she doesn't believe that age is limiting – you just need to have passion for what you do, and then you can find the strength to do it.  A loan will ensure that Eliepa can keep her flea market stall fully stocked and continue working daily for her much-prized financial independence.

loans.use: Merchandise for flea market stall

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina A. González has worked for several years in a clothing assembly shop where they pay her based on the number of pieces she produces. The wages she earns are not enough, so she does her own work at home in the evenings and on the weekends making custom ordered clothing for clients she has gained through the years. She uses a sewing machine that she obtained thanks to her savings. Delfina has been increasing her number of clients and this has generated better income for her, which helps add to the income she earns from the clothing assembly shop where she works. For this reason, Delfina would like to leave her job and open her own business.

To do this she needs a more modern sewing machine that can hold three spools of thread. This will enable her to work more quickly and increase her production. The machine she currently has only holds two spools, and this prevents her from sewing many of the styles people request. Delina has already decided on the sewing machine she wants to buy and it costs $350.00. If she gets the loan to finance the new machine and things go well, she is thinking of leaving the clothing assembly shop and working full-time at her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Delfina A. González trabaja desde hace varios años en un taller de costura donde le pagan en función a las piezas de ropa que produce. Los ingresos que obtiene no son suficientes por lo que Delfina trabaja de forma particular por las noches y fines de semanas en su casa confeccionando ropas para por encargo de una clientela que ha formado atra vez de los años. Su herramienta de trabajo es una máquina de coser que adquirio gracias a sus ahorros. Delfina ha ido ampliando cada vez mas su cartera de clientes y esto le va generando mayores ingresos cada día que superan ampliamente a los ingresos que provienen de su trabajo en el taller de costura al que va por las mañanas a trabajar. Por tal motivo, Delfina, desea independizarse y establecer su propio negocio, para ello necesita una máquina de coser de 3 hilos, más moderna, que la ayudará a agilizar su trabajo e incrementar la producción, pues la máquina de coser que tiene actualmente sólo tiene dos hilos y no le permite hacer mucho de los modelos que le demandan. Doña Delfina ya tiene localizada la herramienta que quiere comprar, una máquina de coser cuyo valor en el mercado es de US$350. Si consigue el préstamo para financiar su nueva máquina de coser y las cosas le van bien, Delfina piensa dejar el taller de costura y dedicarse de lleno a su propio negocio.

loans.use: To buy a three-spool sewing machine

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Business Description

Julia has 6 years of experience in this type of work. She used to work at the snack bar of a school, where little by little she was saving her money. Not being close to her children motivated her to start this business in her home. She attended classes at a bakery where she acquired the knowledge and she created her shop. She supplied her shop with other types of products, such as candy and now housewares and gifts. She works every day of the week from 6 a.m. until 9 p.m. Her children help her serve her customers and in making the bakery products.

Loan Use

The loan will be invested in the purchase of merchandise for her store. She will supply it with candy, housewares and gifts, and also with the ingredients for making her bread.

Información Personal

Julia is 43 years old and she is a single mother. She has 2 children who are already adults. One of them helps her look after the business, and the other works at a gas station as a gas pumper. Her house is made of cane. Thanks to her work, she has succeeded in giving her children education and nutrition. She hopes, with this investment, she will be able to continue improving the life of her family.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Descripción del Negocio

Julia tiene una experiencia de 6 años en esta actividad. Ella trabajaba en el bar de una escuela donde poco a poco fue haciendo sus ahorritos. El no estar cerca de sus hijos la motivo a poner un negocio en su domicilio. Asistió a cursos de panadería de donde adquirió el conocimiento y puso su local. Surtió su local con otra clase de productos. Como lo son confites y actualmente artículos de bazar. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 6 a.m. hasta las 9 p.m. Sus hijos les ayudan con el servicio a sus clientes y en la elaboración de sus productos para la panadería.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de mercadería para su local. Surtirlo con productos de confites y artículos de bazar. Además de materia prima para la elaboración de sus panes.

Información Personal

Julia tiene 43 años y es madre soltera. Tiene 2 hijos los cuales ya son adultos. Una le ayuda con la atención del negocio. Y el otro trabaja en una gasolinera como despachador de combustible. Su casita es de caña. Gracias a su trabajo ha logrado darles educación y alimentación a sus hijos. Espera con la inversión que realizara poder seguir mejorando la vida de su familia.

loans.use: To diversify the merchandise in her shop.

loans.name: Placida

texts.es:
Placida and her husband, Victor, left the town where they were born, Santiago de Nicasio, hopeful of succeeding in life and improving their economic situation, above all in order to provide higher education for their 4 young children. At first, Placida sold groceries from a cart, but, thanks to her hard work and dedication, she was able to rent a small store to sell products that met the basic needs of her clients. She never imagined that this new business would bring her so much satisfaction and that the income generated would become essential for her family. She is now able to support her husband in covering household expenses and her children's university educations. Placida wants to expand her small store and increase her product variety so as to offer greater, thorough service to her clients and therefore earn more income for her family. This is why she is asking for a $200 loan with which to increase her store's stock. "With your generous contribution, you will be able to help Placida and her family continue to prosper everyday."

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Placida y su esposo Víctor, salieron de su pueblo natal Santiago de Nicasio con muchas expectativas de triunfar en la vida y mejorar su situación económica, sobre todo brindarles una educación superior a sus 4 hijos menores. En un principio Doña Placida se dedicó a la venta de abarrotes en forma ambulatoria, pero gracias a su empeño y dedicación pudo abrir su pequeña bodeguita en su domicilio alquilado y ofrece productos de primera necesidad a sus nuevos vecinos, nunca se imaginó que este nuevo negocio le traería mucha satisfacción y que se convertiría en un ingreso económico indispensable para su familia, con el ahora puede apoyar a su esposo para cubrir los gastos de su hogar y estudios superiores de sus hijos.El deseo que tiene Placida es ampliar su pequeña tiendita y aumentar la variedad de sus productos con el fin de ofrecer un mejor y completo servicio a sus clientes y por ende generar mayor ingreso económico para su familia, es por esa razón que solicita un préstamo de 200 dólares, dinero que podrá invertir en ampliar el stock de su negocio. “Con tu generoso apoyo podrás ayudar a Placida y a su familia a seguir prosperando día a día”

loans.use: To expand the small family grocery store and buy more items to sell

loans.name: Isna

texts.en: Isna is 27 years old and the mother of an 8-year-old daughter. She produces and sells various fried snacks and usually earns $5 per day. Her husband, Enjum, sells sandals and usually earns $1.5 per day. She requests $100 loan to expand her business and make it more sustainable. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To produce more various snacks.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Cảnh, 49 years of age, her husband 51, has been a member of the TYM Fund for 10 years. They have a son and two daughters. All are grown up. Her husband sells bus tickets, and she tends a small grocery stand at the open market near their house. She’s been having this stand for 11 years now. The daily income is about 4USD. The money flow of this grocery business is convenient for weekly loan repayments. She would like to apply for a loan of 950USD to buy more merchandise. The loan would help her to avoid buying by credit with a much higher interest rate.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.
