Chị Nguyễn Thị Cảnh, một thành viên vào Quỹ 10 năm, năm nay 49 tuổi, còn chồng chị 51. Họ có 1 con trai 2 con gái đều đã trưởng thành. Trong khi chồng chị bán vé xe tại chợ thì chị có một cửa hàng bán hàng tạp hoá nhỏ. Việc bán hàng tạp hoá tại khu chợ nơi gia đình chị Cảnh sinh sống rất thuận lợi cho việc hoàn trả hàng tuần. Mỗi ngày chị Cảnh bán được rất nhiều mặt hàng các loại với tiền lãi hàng ngày là 4USD. Tính đến nay chị Cảnh đã bán hàng được 11 năm. Chị muốn vay thêm 950USD từ Quỹ TYM để mua thêm hàng phục vụ cho người dân và không phải mua chịu từ bên ngoài với lãi suất cao.

loans.use: Buy goods for grocery store

loans.name: Giovanna

texts.es:
When Giovanna gave birth to her first child, she left behind her work as an accountant at a beauty products company in order to take care of him.

That is how she started 10 years ago a business selling gas door-to-door. She started the business together with a family friend because there was a lack of gas offer. The business allowed Giovanna to financially help her husband, who is a sailor, to sustain their 2 sons.

Giovanna sells the gas door to door, pushing a little car around the area of San Juan de Lurigancho, where she lives.

Even though the business is doing well, she and her husband would like to set-up an Accounting’s Office in the 3rd floor of their house. In order to reach this objective, she would need 2000 soles (700 USD).

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Cuando Giovanna tuvo su primer hijo dejó su trabajo como contable en una empresa de productos de belleza para cuidarlo; pero esto no significó que ella dejara de trabajar. Es así como hace 10 años puso, con la ayuda de un amigo de la familia, un negocio de venta de gas a domicilio al ver que no había uno similar cerca de su casa. De esta manera Giovanna ayuda económicamente a su esposo marino a mantener a sus 2 hijos menores.

Jalando un pequeño carrito, Giovanna reparte gas en los alrededores de su casa en San Juan de Lurigancho. A pesar que le va bien, junto a su esposo quisieran poner un estudio contable en el tercer piso de su casa. Para poder lograr este sueño necesitarían de 2 mil soles.

loans.use: Giovanna had worked as an accountant before and would like to set up an Accounting's Office

loans.name: Sergey

texts.en:
Sergey is married with two kids. He and his family live in Zaporozhye. Sergey owns a small van and offers transportation services in the city. He understands his role as the head and provider for his family, and is ready to work 24/7 to provide for the needs of his loved ones. He has been faithfully working in this business for 8 years.

Sergey has found his niche in this business. Today, it’s a lot harder to start your own business as a public van driver. Currently, Sergey’s net profit is about $500 a month. An economical diesel engine in his vehicle helps him reduce his operating costs and adds to his bottom line. Loans that Sergey has received from “Nadiya Ukraine” have helped to promote stability and growth in his business. Sergey is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase necessary car parts and fix his van. He understands the effort and commitment it takes to be a private entrepreneur, and is willing to work hard in his business to be able to support his family which is the first priority in his life.

loans.use: To repair the van for his transportation service.

loans.name: Tania Maribel

texts.es:
Señora Tania Maribel M. A. is 26 years old and has completed her studies to the fifth year of secondary school. She has a son that depends on her for support. She lives on Deam Saavedra street in the El Cortijo sector of the province of Trujillo in the La Libertad department – Peru.

She is dedicated to the breeding of small animals such as: chickens, hens and ducks that she sells to her neighbors and friends after they have reached their ideal size. She also sells Avon beauty products. Her business was started with the sale of prepared meals. At present she also sells prepared meals but she only prepares a specific quantity that are ordered in advance.

She belongs to the “New Peru” Communal Bank where she obtained her first loan of 300 soles. With this money she bought the ingredients to cook.

With the loan of 500 soles, which will be repaid in four months, she will buy balanced food for her birds and beauty products that she would like to have in stock.

Her greater dream is to have a farm where she can increase the number of small animals.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Tania Maribel M. A. tiene 26 años de edad, estudio hasta el quinto año de secundaria. Tiene un hijo que aun depende de ella. Vive en la calle Deam Saavedra en el sector El Cortijo en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad – Perú.

Se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como: pollos, gallinas y patos que después de haber adquirido su tamaño ideal los vende a sus vecinos y amigos. Así también vende productos de belleza de la línea de productos “avon”. Su negocio se inicia con la venta de menú. Actualmente también vende menú pero solo prepara una cantidad determinada que le hacen pedido anticipadamente.

Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuevo Perú” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro los ingredientes para cocinar.

Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00 el cual cancelara en cuatro meses comprará alimento balanceado para sus aves y productos de belleza que estén en oferta para tener en stock.

Su mayor sueño es tener una granja en la que pueda incrementar el número de animales menores.

loans.use: To buy balanced food for her birds and beauty products for resale.

loans.name: Mujeres Virtuosas Group

texts.es:
This group from the Arroyo Pora neighborhood has come about due to the influence of another group of women who already have a loan group and are very pleased with the results they’ve obtained. Teresa A. is the General Director of the group, Claudia B. is the Director of Finances, Esmeralda S. is the Director of Public Relations, Victoria C. is the Director of Social Matters, and Wilma Martínez is the Director of Training.

Currently, the group is composed of 20 hardworking women whose businesses are diverse. Among them we can cite: kiosks, bars, seamstressing, cosmetics sales, the sale of a variety of merchandise, food sales, fuel sales, making and selling homemade bread, the sale of aloe vera products, and making aho poí (a typical Paraguayan embroidery), among others. Each member receives, on average, the sum of G. 685,000, which they reinvest in their businesses for the purchase of the ingredients and supplies they need for their small businesses and also a variety of merchandise for resale.

It is for this reason that credit is also a very important tool for these women. With it, they have the possibility of growing and expanding their businesses, so that they can continually increase their income.

With the loan that is being requested on this occasion, these enterprising women will be able to do the following: buy clothing, cosmetics, ingredients for making homemade bread and fast foods—such as flour, milk, eggs, yeast, meats, vegetables, salt, and sugar, among others; to by a variety of items for the sale of jewelry, cosmetics, toys, ect.; also merchandise for small grocery stores, such as canned goods, rice, noodles, and beverages in general; and for the women who work as seamstresses—fabrics, threads, elastics, zippers, buttons, and other sewing supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Este comité del Barrio Arroyo Pora ha surgido gracias a las influencias de otro grupo de mujeres que poseen ya su comité y están encantadas con el resultado que obtienen. Teresa A. es la Directora General del grupo, Claudia B. es la Directorias de Finanzas, Esmeralda S. Directora de Relaciones Públicas, Victoria C. es Directoria de Asuntos Sociales, y Wilma Martínez es Directora de Capacitación.

Actualmente el comité esta integrado por 20 mujeres trabajadoras cuyas actividades son diversas, entre ellas podemos citar: kioscos, copetín (bar), costureras, venta de ropas, venta de cosméticos, venta de mercaderías varias, venta de comestibles, venta de combustibles, elaboración y venta de pan casero, venta de productos de Aloe Vera, elaboración de Bordados en Aho poí (bordado típico de Paraguay), entre otros. Cada integrante recibe en promedio la suma de G. 685.000 que lo reinvierten en sus negocios para la compra de insumos necesarios para sus microempresas así como también mercaderías varias para sus ventas.

Es por eso que el crédito también es una herramienta muy importante de trabajo para estas señoras, ya que con él tienen la posibilidad de ir creciendo y expandiendo sus actividades, de modo a obtener cada vez más mayores ingresos.

Con el crédito solicitado en esta ocasión estas mujeres emprendedoras podrán adquirir lo siguiente: compra de prendas de vestir, cosméticos, ingredientes para la elaboración de pan casero y comidas rápidas como harina, leche, huevos, levadura, carnes, verduras, sal, azúcar, entre otros; compra de artículos variados para la venta como bijouterie, cosméticos, juguetes, etc.; también mercaderías para despensa como productos enlatados, arroz, fideos y bebidas en general, y para las señoras que se dedican a la costura telas, hilos, elásticos, cierres, botones y demás insumos para la confección.

loans.use: To buy clothing, cosmetics, flour, salt, meta, fruits and vegetables, milk, eggs, canned products, rice, noodles, and beverages in general; to buy fabrics, threads, elastic, zippers, and buttons, among others.

loans.name: Luzmila Elida

texts.es:
Luzmila belongs to the Communal Bank “Señor de los Milagros de Chavin,” and she has a small store where she sells candy, soda pop, cookies, and has communications call center, where she sells phone cards, phone chips, videos and CDs. Her business is located in the Chavin district of Huantar in Huaraz Province of Ancash state.

With the S/.600.00 nuevos soles loan, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy phone cards in denominations of 10, 20 and 30 nuevos soles, 10 phone chips for Claro and Movistar. She will also buy 10 packages of cookies to stock her store.

She is 38 years old, married, and has 4 children. Her husband is an electrician and has temporary jobs. Her income enables her to support her husband and provide an education for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Luzmila, pertenece al Banco Comunal Señor de los Milagros de Chavin , ella tiene su pequeña tienda de venta de golosinas, gaseosa, galletas, tiene locutorio, en el cual vende tarjetas, chip, videos, CDs. Su negocio esta ubicado en el distrito de Chavin de Huantar, Provincia de Huaraz, Departamento de Ancash.

Con el préstamo de 600.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará tarjetas, de 10, 20, 30 nuevos soles, 10 chips de claro, movistar. También comprará 10 paquetes de galletas surtidos para su tienda.

Ella tiene 38 años de edad, es casada con 4 hijos, su esposo es electricistas y tiene trabajos eventuales, sus ingresos le permite apoyar a su esposo en la educación de sus hijos

loans.use: Purchase a variety of products to sell in her call center

loans.name: Darou Salam Santhie Group

texts.fr:
The Darou Salam group unites 3 merchants who hold a fruit and vegetable stand at the corner market. To help themselves out, they have a daily contribution system set in place; however, now they are requesting a loan of 500000 cfa (1200 USD) to build the operating fund for their small business.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Le groupement darou salam réunit 3 commerçants qui tiennent des étales de fruits et légumes au marché du coin.Pour s'entre aider ils ont d 'abord mis en place un systeme de cotisations journaliéres avant de solliciter un pret de 500000f cfa pour renforcer leur fonds de commerce.

loans.use: Operating funds

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia started her own business because she needed the extra income to help her family with the household expenses and to improve her children’s quality of life. Three years ago, she started selling clothing outside her home. Little by little, however, her clientele kept increasing, which is why she currently sells her merchandise at the local flea markets.

She needs a loan of $250.00 USD, which she will repay in 3 months, in order to purchase a bundle of clothing, thus allowing her to continue with her business. With your help, this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Lucia inició el negocio porque necesitaba ingresos extras para sacar adelante a su familia con los gastos de la casa y darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Comenzó hace 3 años vendiendo ropa afuera de su domicilio, poco a poco se fue haciendo de clientes por lo que actualmente ya vende en mercados rodantes.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar una paca de ropa y así poder continuar con su negocio. Con tu ayuda esto será posible.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Time

texts.en:
Time is 26 years old. She is married and has two children who are 1 and 5 years old.

Time became a food seller in 2008. Each day, she works at her business selling food. She can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

Time now seeks a loan so she can buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
La señora Roxana es socia del B.C. “Maria Magdalena”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. Se dedica a la venta de anticuchos de carne de pollo asados al carbón, juanes y arroz chaufa. Desarrolla su negocio en la puerta de su casa, situado en el Jr, La Punta Nº 118 del mismo distrito donde vive. Decide iniciar esta actividad porque no le fue bien con la venta de ropa. Los clientes son moradores de la propia localidad y transeúntes de lugares cercanos.

Con este crédito de S/.500, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará los insumos para la preparación de los alimentos como arroz, azúcar, carnes de res, pollo y cerdo también en kilos, cecina, chorizo, los cuales le permitirá variar los platos a ofertar y atender los requerimientos de los clientes.
 
Roxana es una mujer entusiasta de 38 años de edad, vive con su esposo, quien la apoya en las compras diarias y con sus 04 hijos a quienes quiere darle un futuro mejor. Su meta es comprar un refrigerador para ampliar su negocio con la venta de bebidas y salchipapas.
texts.en:
Señora Roxana is a member of the community bank "Maria Magdalena." She lives in the region San Martín, province of Mariscal Cáceres, district of Juanjui. She is dedicated to selling anticuchos (Andean dish) of charcoal-grilled chicken and Chinese fried rice. She developed her business in the gate of her home, located at Jr. La Punta No. 118. She decided to begin this activity because clothing sales did not go well for her. Her clients are neighbors and people commuting from nearby places. With this loan of 500 Soles, which she will pay back in four months, she will buy ingredients for the preparation of the food like rice, sugar, beef, chicken, and pork in large quantities, and also smoked meat and chorizo, which will allow her to vary the plates that she offers and meet the requirements of her clients. Roxana is an enthusiastic woman. She is 38 years old, lives with her husband, who supports her in the daily purchases, and with their four children, who she wants to give a better future. Her goal is to buy a refrigerator to make her business bigger with the sales of beverages and salchipapas (Andean dish).

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients for the preparation of food, like rice, sugar, meat, etc.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 39-year-old Rukia K. from Mbeya. She is married with five children between the ages of 7 and 20, and is also responsible for supporting one dependent because he is schooling in the area. Rukia has been operating a grocery store since 2000 selling goods such as rice, cooking oil, and soda. Assisted by her husband, she works 14 hours per day, 7 days per week, earning about $200 each month from her business.

Rukia is requesting a loan of $400 in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, cooking oil, and soda. In the future, she plans to open another business and increase the quantity and range of her stock. Rukia thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, cooking oil, and soda.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Hương tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2001. Vòng vốn đầu chị vay 2 triệu đồng để đầu tư cho việc chăn nuôi lợn. Trong suốt thời gian tham gia Quỹ tình thương chị Hương luôn sử  dụng vốn hiệu quả, hoàn trả vốn đúng hạn và chấp hành tốt các quy định của Quỹ. Hiện tại ngoài thu nhập từ chăn nuôi gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu nhập từ lương thợ xây của chồng nên kinh tế rất ổn định. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 15 triệu đồng, một phần chị đầu tư mua lợn giống về nuôi phần còn lại chị dự định đầu tư xây dựng bioga để phụcvụ cho công việc chăn nuôi.
Thu nhập 3,5  triệu/ tháng
texts.en:
Mrs. H. Thi Nguyen has been participating in the fund since 2001. In the first round of funding she borrowed 2 million VND to invest in raising pigs. In the whole time in which she has been participating in the Fund, Mrs. Nguyen has always utilized the loan with successful results, making all repayments on time and satisfying all other conditions of the Fund. Currently besides income from the livestock, her family also has an income stream from her husband's salary as a construction worker, so the family's finances are very stable. In this round of funding she is borrowing 15 million VND, part of which go towards purchasing a sow to raise, and the remainder of which will be used to invest in a biogas system to serve the livestock operations. The family's income is 3.5 million VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a sow, construct biogas system

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina tiene 36 años de edad, es viuda, vive con sus tres hijos que estudian y la quieren mucho. Ella se dedica  a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, en las instalaciones de su domicilio, donde implementó un espacio para su bodega, este negocio lo inició hace 2 años atrás, y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar una muy buena atención a sus clientes, ya que de eso depende que regresen a comprar sus productos. Le es rentable debido a que tiene una clientela que continuamente consumen sus productos. Este es su 5to préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado ser responsable con sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más productos para implementar su negocio y posteriormente ampliarlo y ambientarlo mejor.
texts.en:
Karina is a 36-year-old widow who lives with her three school-aged children that love her a lot. She dedicates herself to selling groceries and other necessities out of her home, where she arranged a space for her store. She began this business two years ago, and what she likes about her job is providing very good service to her customers, since their decision to return to buy her goods depends on it. Her business is profitable since she has a customer base that continually consumes her products. This is her fifth loan with MFP and she has proven to be responsible in her payments. With the money requested, she will buy more products to stock her store, and later to expand it and improve its atmosphere.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand the merchandise in her grocery store.

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.en:
Bahodur M. is 32 years old. He is married with two children. Four years ago, Bahodur started to use his mechanical skills to do work for his neighbors and acquaintances. He learned this skill at another shop and practiced until he had the opportunity to start his own business. 

With his faith and enthusiasm, his auto mechanic business started to grow little by little. Villagers who use machines for their business always come to him to have their machines repaired. Now, Bahodur is finding that the tools that he has are not enough to work at his job with full speed. For this reason, he is seeking a loan of $600 USD that will be paid back over the course of 12 months. This loan will be used to buy tools and materials used to repair autos. With your help, Bahodur will be able to provide for his children's education and the well-being of his family.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase tools and materials used to repair cars

loans.name: Zemar Group

texts.en:
Zemar is the group leader of Zemar Group. There are three members in this group. They live in Kabul Afghanistan and they would like to receive the loan to improve the business of each.

Zemar wants to take a loan for buying clothes for his shop. Shabana wants to take a loan for her father’s business; he has a retail shop. Nargis wants to take a loan for her sewing business. They are happy that they are supported through this process.

loans.use: To buy clothes for his shop.

loans.name: Mila

texts.es: Mila tiene 18 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo en casa de sus suegros. Ella se dedica a apoyar a su esposo en las tareas de fabricación de ladrillos, su trabajo consiste  en estar en cada proceso de su elaboración, lo cual toma casi todo el día, dedicándose a esta actividad desde hace 1 año atrás; su esposo es el que más se esfuerza en estas tareas y ella lo apoya en todo porque quiere en un futuro puedan tener un terreno propio, para tener su  propia fábrica de ladrillos, ya que el alquiler del terreno causa un gasto adicional. Además de su trabajo Mila se da tiempo para cuidar a su pequeño hijo, y actualmente ha optado por criar animales para luego venderlos, esto la ayuda a solventar los gastos de su hogar en momentos de escasez, lo cual se da generalmente en épocas de lluvia intensa. Es la primera vez que Mila tiene un préstamo con MFP, comprometiéndose a ser puntual y muy responsable en los pagos. Solicita esta cantidad para invertirla en la compra de dos cerdos pequeños, los cuales están valorizados en 400 soles y con el dinero que resta comprará plásticos para  proteger los ladrillos recién elaborados.
texts.en:
Mila is 18 years old and lives with her husband and son in her mother and father-in-law's home. She works by helping her husband make bricks. Her work consists of being there for each step of the process which takes all day. She's been helping her husband to make bricks. Her work consists of being there for each step of the process which takes all day. She has been helping her husband for one year. Her husband is the one who works the hardest and she helps him with everything because she wants them to be able to buy a piece of land. They want to be able to have their own land so that they can have their own Brick factory and not have to pay rent on the land. Besides her work making bricks, Mila also cares for her small child. In addition, she raises animals to sell. Doing so helps her to pay for her family's expenses, especially in times when they experience a shortage of money, which usually happens when it rains a lot. This is the first time that Mila is requesting a loan from MFP. She promises to make her payments on time and to be very responsible. She is requesting this loan amount to be able to invest it in the purchase of two small pigs, which cost 400 Soles and with the rest of the money she will purchase plastic coverings to protect the bricks after they have been made.

(Translated by Ashlee of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of two small pigs to raise and sell and plastic coverings to protect the bricks after they have been made.

loans.name: Violet A.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 22-year-old Violet D. from Mbeya. She is single. Violet has been running a piggery project since 2009. Her business is raising pigs and selling the products. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 7 days per week.

Violet currently earns about US$ 250 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 625 USD in order to purchase pig feed, etc. In the future, she plans to increase the number of pigs for her project. Violet thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed, etc.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es: Rodolfo S. P. vive en la comunidad Buena Vista ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad tiene 49 años de edad, su grupo familiar lo compone su esposa , una hija y la mamá de su esposa que también vive junto con ellos , Rodolfo se dedica a su negocio que está ubicado dentro de su casa y  es un taller de fabricación de cortinas, esta pareja de esposos trabajan en conjunto mientras Rodolfo fabrica las cortinas, la esposa se va al mercado central de San Salvador a venderlas, Rodolfo solicita un crédito para la compra de materia en este caso tela, para poder ampliar su variedad en colores y diseños.
texts.en:
Rodolfo Sanchez Presentacion lives in the Buena Vista neighborhood in La Libertad department. He is 49 years old and his family consists of his wife, his daughter and his mother-in-law who lives with them. Rodolfo manufactures curtains, a commercial activity which he carries out from his own home. This couple work together in this enterprise: Rodolfo manufactures the curtains, his wife takes them to the San Salvador central market to sell them. Rodolfo is asking for a loan to buy fabric so that he can diversify and increase colors and designs of his products.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics.

loans.name: Mauwa

texts.en:
Mauwa is an orange and coconut seller in the Mwera neighborhood of Zanzibar. She belongs to Ega Kwa Bega group loan (Group code 2020). She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 90. Every day she works at her business for 8 hours.

She is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more oranges and coconuts for sale, to improve her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Mauwa is 30 years old, married, and has two children: ages 12 and 6. She also cares for one additional dependent.

loans.use: To buy more oranges and coconuts for sale

loans.name: Ayishetu

texts.en: Ayishetu I. is married and has 3 children. She has received an education through junior high school. Since 2005 she has worked as a trader selling clothing and drinks at Siwdo in Cape Coast. Her husband also works as a trader in the same area. Ayishetu uses her income to pay for utility bills and her children’s school fees. She will use the loan to expand her business and she plans to use her newly gained profits to further support her enterprise.

loans.use: She will use the loan to expand her business selling clothing and drinks

loans.name: Florica

texts.en: Mrs. Florica A., a Paglaum member under PDP-LP program, resides at Minlasag Sibutad, Zamboanga Del Norte. She has been a member since March 10, 2008. Her husband died 3 years ago. She is requesting a loan amounting to 3,000 pesos to have additional capital for her "Sari-sari" (variety) store. Her plan for the business is to improve and grow her business. Future plans for her family are to see her children finish school until college and someday find a decent and stable job.

loans.use: Purchase addtional grocery items

loans.name: Condoray Group

texts.en:
The Banco Comunal Condoray is part of the Wari I Project.   Its members are from the community of Condoray, in the District of Tambillo, of the Province of Huamanga.  It is located about 90 minutes from the city of Ayacucho.  The principal activities of the community are the rearing of small animals as well as agriculture.

The members partake in different businesses, such as the rearing of animals, the buying and selling of grains, bread, the buying and selling of products from a native Peruvian tree called tara, and cochineal insects, which are of commercial value.

For example, Haydee, who lives with her partner, raises guinea pigs, and in recent months has improved her shed, which she sells products from in the city of Ayacucho.

The loans of these members will be used to buy grain, guinea pigs, and pigs.

loans.use: To buy grain, guinea pigs, and pigs.

loans.name: Lelane

texts.en:
Ma. Lelane O., age 39, is the mother of three children ages 8, 11, and 17, and the wife of Juny, a jeepney driver. She is a tricycle operator who lives in a poverty-stricken community in San Mateo, Rizal, Philippines.

Lelane converted her husband’s motorcycle into a tricycle (a motorcycle with a sidecar) with the help of her first loan from CCT. She uses it to transport five children to school, for which she earns 1,750 PHP per month, in addition to 200 PHP per month she earns from its everyday use as a passenger vehicle. She also uses the tricycle to purchase bananas and other food products from the market and deliver them to the neighborhoods where she sells them.

Lelane plans to use her loan to re-open her sari-sari (general) store, which was closed for months due to lack of capital. She hopes that, with improved finances, she will be able to send her eldest daughter to school again to continue her college education.

loans.use: Inventory and other expenses to re-open a general store

loans.name: Flora

texts.es: Flora es una madre muy empeñosa, desde que formó su familia se dedicó a brindarles el cariño y atenciones necesarias y gracias a que logró construir su casa propia gozan de estabilidad. Desde muy joven trabajó en la venta de comida, pero tuvo que interrumpir su actividad para dedicarles mayor atención a sus hijos y ahora que ellos ya son mayores, ha reiniciado sus actividades con el apoyo de su pareja e hijos, quienes la ayudaron a adquirir un coche de comidas, con el cual sale a vender en la puerta de su casa. Esta actividad la realiza todos los días, sobre todo los fines de semana debido a la gran demanda que hay, trabaja desde las 5pm hasta la media noche, ya que aprovechar la clientela que hay por las noches. Sin embargo, Flora   se proyecta para instalar un bazar en su casa, donde pueda iniciar la venta de ropa, ya que sus vecinos están empezando a realizarle pedidos que ella espera entregar con prontitud, sin descuidar su negocio de venta de comida. Este es su crédito número 14 con MFP y lo que más la alienta a continuar con su banco comunal es la unión como grupo y el apoyo que hay todas sus compañeras. Los 1000 soles que viene solicitando le permitirán comprar los comestibles necesarios para la preparación de sus comidas, así como ropa para su  nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Flora is a very determined mother. Ever since she formed her family, she has worked to give them the love and attention they needed. Thanks to her managing to build her own house, they have enjoyed stability. She has worked selling food since she was very young. She had to interrupt her work in order to dedicate more attention to her children. Now that they are older, she has started working again with the help of her partner and children. They helped her get a food cart with which she sells meals from the door of her house. She works every day, above all on the weekends due to the great demand. She works from 5 p.m. until midnight since she takes advantage of the customers that are out at night. Nevertheless, Flora plans to install a store in her house where she can begin to sell clothes. Her neighbors are beginning to make orders which she hopes to deliver shortly, without neglecting her meal-selling business. This is her 14th loan with MFP. What encourages her the most to continue with her community bank is the group unity and the support of all its members. The 1000 PEN she is applying for will allow her to purchase necessary food to prepare her meals as well as clothes for her new business.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Etevise Mele

texts.en:
Etevise Mele G. (10100006957) is a 36-year-old woman who lives in the town of Apia.  She is married and has 3 school-aged children.  To make a living, Etevise Mele plants, harvests, and sells vegetables.  Etevise Mele has just started this business and earns approximately 280 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Etevise Mele joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Etevise Mele has successfully repaid a previous loan of 300 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  Etevise Mele is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  The loan will be her 2nd loanfrom SPBD.  Etevise Mele plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora Barbadan is a mother of six children. She is married to Timotheo who is now 60 years old. They live in a peaceful village surrounded by farms in Sitio Anguapan Tumauini, Isabela. Her husband also does farming and she hopes to help him  to able gain income for their daily needs by maintaining her business. 

Aurora manages a variety store in front of their house. Aside from this, she is also engaged in a livestock business where she raises swine. She decided to venture into  these businesses in 2001  in order to able support the needs of her children. She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 7,000 to use in expanding her businesses.  All her efforts in making her dreams attainable are for the benefit of her children.

loans.use: Additional capital for business expansion

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase four cattle

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es una mujer de 41años, su buen ánimo y la alegría que irradia la distinguen dentro de todas las señoras de su barrio. Vive junto a su pareja y sus hijos, por quienes trabaja con el fin de mejorar su calidad de vida. Su negocio es la preparación y venta de bocadillos y pasteles, los cuales realiza en su casa y allí también recibe los pedidos de sus clientes, que en su mayoría son sus vecinos, amistades y parientes, quienes para cada evento social acuden confiadamente en ella, pues se caracteriza por ser muy cumplida. Lo que más le gusta a Isabel de su trabajo es la decoración de las tortas, pues pone a prueba su creatividad; sin embargo, en los 7 años trabajando de esta manera, considera que lo difícil es trasladar los pedidos a diversos lugares de la ciudad, pues es muy cansado debido a la distancia que tiene que recorrer. Para el futuro, Isabel espera implementar un espacio en su casa con materiales y utensilios necesarios para incrementar su producción, pues en ocasiones ha tenido que rechazar pedidos.
Este es el primer crédito individual que solicita con Microfinanzas PRISMA, pues los anteriores fueron con su banco comunal, donde siempre ha trabajando puntualmente y le tienen en gran estima. Con los dos mil quinientos soles solicitados comprará los ingredientes de pastelería necesarios e implementará su cocina adecuadamente para mejorar su producción.
texts.en:
Isabel is 41-year-old woman, and her energy and happiness separate her from all the women in her neighborhood. She lives with her partner and children, for whom she works with the goal of improving her quality of life. Her business is preparing and selling sandwiches and pastries, which she makes in her house. She also receives orders from her clients, the majority of whom are her neighbors, friends and relatives. Her clients trust her for their social events, because she is known to be very gifted. What she likes most about her work is decorating the cakes, because this puts her creativity to the test. However, in the 7 years she has done this work, she considers it difficult to transport the orders to different places in the city, since she gets very tired from the distance she has to travel. In the future, Isabel hopes to implement a space in her house with materials and utensils necessary to increase her production, because at times she has to reject orders. This is her first individual loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, but her earlier loans were with her community bank, where she has always worked punctually and where they hold her in great esteem. With the 2500 soles that she is requesting, she will buy necessary pastry ingredients and will implement her kitchen adequately to improve her production.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To implement her kitchen

loans.name: Chem

texts.en: Chem S., 29, is married and lives with one of her children in the Takeo province. She decorates handicrafts. Since 1999, she has been using beads and other materials to decorate clothes with flowers, typically making US $1.50 each day. She decorates Khmer traditional dresses, which people wear during the Water Festival, P’chum Ben or the Khmer New Year. It takes around 7-10 days to complete each dress; the price is expensive too. Most of the people prefer handmade to machine manufactured. She learned how to decorate from her mother and has been doing it since before her marriage. Her husband is a moto-taxi driver who is able to make a living about US $2 every day. Chem S. is asking for a loan of US $600, with which she will purchase more silk and beads she can use to expand her business.

loans.use: purchasing more silk and beads

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos es un padre de familia de 37 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 15 y 12 años de edad en el pueblo joven San Martín, ubicado en la ciudad de Lambayeque, a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace cinco años trabaja como chofer de una mototaxi alquilada (las mototaxis son vehículos motorizados utilizados en el transporte de carga y pasajeros). Antes trabajaba como cobrador en una combi que cubría la ruta Lambayeque – Chiclayo. Tuvo que dejar esta labor por que no le brindaba los recursos que necesitaba para seguir sustentando a su familia. 

De vez en cuando trabaja como estibador en el mercado de la ciudad. Estos ingresos son también un apoyo imporante a la economía de su familia. Además su esposa trabaja como empleada del hogar. Juntos se esfuerzan diariamente para seguir adelante y progresar.

El dueño del vehículo que maneja le está vendiendo la mototaxi. Por lo que Carlos quiere aprovechar esta oportunidad para agenciarse de un medio seguro con el cual mantener a los suyos. Por este motivo el está solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para pagar el importe de este vehículo y también para legalizar los documentos de propiedad y licencias que necesita para asegurarse un trabajo formal.

Su sueño es poder arreglar su casa que está construida rústicamente y reunir el capital necesario para instalar una bodega cuyos ingresos aseguren la educación superior de sus hijos. El es una persona estimada por sus vecinos que lo consideran un padre responsable y trabajador.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 37-year-old husband and father of tho children, 15 and 12, who live in the new town of San Martín, which is in the city of Lambayeque, which is 15 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For the past 5 years he has worked as a driver of a leased mototaxi. (Mototaxis are motorized, 3-wheel vehicles that are licensed for the transportation of passengers). He used to work as a fare collector on a minibus which operated on the Lambayeque-Chiclayo route. He had to leave this employment because it did not produce enough income to support his family. Occasionally he worked as a stevedore in the municipal market. This income is an important contribution to his family's economic stability. In addition, his wife works as a domestic employee in a private home. Together they struggle daily to get ahead and progress. The owner of the vehicle he leases is selling it. Carlos wants to take advantage of this situation which will afford him a stable income to care for his family. This is why he is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to purchase this vehicle and to pay the fees to legalize the ownership transfer and to get the necessary licenses to insure formal work. His dream is to be able to improve his house which is currently built only in a very unfinished manner and to open a general store which will provide income which will insure his children's higher education. His neighbors think highly of him and consider him to be a responsible and hard-working father.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a used mototaxi.

loans.name: Mirian

texts.es:
Mirian tiene 32 años, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo. Su deseo siempre fue de formar una familia sólida y criar a su hijo con la presencia de su padre, pero este hombre al saber de su embarazo la dejó. Desde entonces trabaja en sus chacras de plátanos y para las chacras de otras personas con su niño en la espalda. A veces por su bebé se demora más de la hora de descanso, por ello algunos agricultores no la quieren contratar.
Por tal motivo, Mirian quiere tener sus propios cultivos de café, porque es un producto más rentable y aunque sabe que necesitará de mucha inversión, tiene confianza de lograrlo, ya que tiene el deseo de salir a delante para brindarle bienestar a su hijo.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, y pese a sus carencia económicas, en su primer préstamo no tuvo problemas de pago, es por ello es admirada por el resto de los integrantes de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes, además de semillas de café para hacer un vivero.
texts.en:
Mirian, 32, is a single mother; she has one son. She always yearned to form a stable family and to raise her son with the presence of a father. However, this man abandoned her when he learned she was pregnant. Since then, she has farmed her banana fields, and fields belonging to others, with her child on her back. Sometimes, because of her baby, she takes more than the alloted rest time and some of the farmers don't want to hire her. Because of this, Mirian wants to have her own coffee crops because this is a more profitable product and, even though she knows she will require a heavy investment, she trusts that she will be able to succeed because she wishes to get ahead and offer wellbeing for her son. This is her second loan with MFP and, even with her very limited monetary assets, she had no problem repaying the first loan. She is, therefore, highly admired by the members of her communal bank. The funds she is requesting on this occasion are to buy fertilizers and coffee seeds to start a nursery.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Hanin

texts.en:
Hanin is a young woman who is married with one child. She lives in Saffa Village south of Ramallah City. Hanin’s husband used to work in Israel in a pastry shop but three months ago they decided to start their own business since working in Israel depends on getting a work permit so it is not permanent work.

Hanin and her husband work together in making pastries, croissants, desserts, etc., and sell their products upon request within the village and to shops and restaurants in Ramallah.

Hanin has requested 3,000 USD to enhance her business. She will use the loan to buy a bigger oven, a refrigrator, and working materials like flour.

Hanin and her husband are working from their house currently and they hope in the future to have their own pastry shop. Hanin appears in the photo making some pastries.

loans.use: To buy a big refrigrator, a big oven and more flour

loans.name: Chimgee

texts.en:
Chimgee Z. is a single mother of two children and she currently lives with her youngest child in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her oldest son works in South Korea as a contract worker, and he sends money to his mother. His mother recently purchased a new one-bedroom apartment with her son's money. Besides the remittance money she receives, she sells cheap shoes at Sundae Center, a 24-hour shopping mall in the busiest district of Ulaanbaatar. She rents a small stall and sells various men's and women's shoes imported from China. She says that because her stall is located in the busiest section, the business is doing pretty well. She further says that she would like to expand her business by adding more quality shoes in her stall. Her dream is to be financially able to send her youngest daughter to get the best education abroad. She requests a loan to purchase more winter shoes for her business.

About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here:http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All&sectors[]=All&regions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: To purchase more winter shoes

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en: Herminia T., 61 years old, is a residence of Banga, South Cotabato. She has a farm and grows rice. She works from morning until sunset to ensure that she has a very abundant harvest. She wants to earn a bigger income to help her family buy food, clothes and other basic needs. Herminia is asking for a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. The loan will go far buying farm supplies to double the size of her harvest.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more charcoal in bulk

loans.name: Carmen Beatriz

texts.es: Carmen C. solicita este crédito para invertirlo en una tienda que tiene desde hace 9 meses, aunque su negocio desde hace varios años ha sido la venta de ropa típica tuvo la oportunidad de adquirir este negocio y quiere aprovechar para poder surtir mas productos ya que quiere comprar frutas, maíz, frijol, azúcar y aceite, también algunos utiles escolares ya que su negocio esta ubicado cerca de la escuela de la aldea donde ella vive. Una de las metas que la señora tiene es de atender bien a sus clientes y ganar su preferencia, ella dice que sigue trabajando duro ya que después de haber estado enferma y haberse recuperado quiere darle una buena vida a su hija, aunque su hija tiene poco mas de 3 años ella se prepara para el futuro.
texts.en:
Carmen C. is asking for a loan to invest in a store that she has had for 9 months. While her business for many years has been to sell traditional clothing, she had the opportunity to acquire this store and she would like to be able to provide more products that people like to buy such as fruit, corn, beans, sugar, and oil. Also she would like to sell school supplies because the store is near the village school where she lives. One of her goals is to serve her customers well and to gain their loyalty. She says that she continues to work hard even after being sick and having recovered. She wants to provide a good life to her daughter. Even though her daughter is only 3 she is preparing for her daughter’s future.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working captial

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Mrs.Merlyn D. is from Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 46 years old, married and has 3 children. To make a living, Merlyn operates a farm from her residence and it serves as their main source of income. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 a month for these business activities.

Merlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial support, to improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn successfully repaid her previous loan of 30,000 from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Currently, she has a new loan of 40,000, which will be used to add to her business capital. This will be the 6th cycle loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional capital generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her rice trading business.

loans.name: Rashad

texts.en: Rashad was born in 1982. He is married and has a child. Rashad M. and his family live in Baku city. He has been in this business for 5 years. Now Rashad needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy fruits and vegetables for resale to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna sells iced fish at retail prices to make a living in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a very long time. She is 32 years old, married with three children. Her husband is a farmer. She is a friendly and happy woman. She needs a loan of 60,000 nairas to purchase more iced fish to sell. She loves her business and family dearly and she hopes to excel in life. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more iced fish to sell

loans.name: Domingo's Group

texts.en:
Domingo S. is from the village of Rizal in Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 55 years old. Domingo is the leader of a 10-member loan group sponsored by ASKI. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Domingo is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Domingo sells vegetables in the local community. Domingo has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Domingo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Domingo is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be Domingo's fifth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy new items to sell

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina tiene 35 años de edad, es separada y vive junto a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Mórrope, una zona caracterizada por tener a la mayoría de sus habitantes concentrados en áreas rurales que quedan dispersas, el pueblo capital donde vive se caracteriza por poseer bastante comercio, ya que es el principal centro de abasto para los habitantes de la zonas aledañas, este distrito pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Cristina se gana la vida comercializando verduras en un mercadillo de la ciudad de Lambayeque desde hace mas de ocho años, todos los dias ella se moviliza muy temprano al mercado Moshoqueque (mercado mayorista de la región) a comprar sus productos que luego ofrece a sus clientes durante todo el dia y parte de la tarde. Como los productos que ofrece son frescos, su negocio siempre goza de mucha demanda y  ha llegado a tener una clientela fidelizada.

La continua demanda por los productos que ofrece en su negocio han hecho que piense en ampliar su puesto de venta, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de verduras para lograr su objetivo.

Cristina es una mujer luchadora y que da lo mejor de si para sacar a sus hijos adelante, su mayor anhelo es verlos realizados y convertidos en excelentes profesionales. Sus vecinos y compañeros de trabajo la consideran una excelente persona.
texts.en:
Cristina, 35, is separated and lives with her two children in Mórrope district, an area that is notable because most of its residents are scattered in isolated rural areas. The regional capital where she lives, however, does have quite a bit of commerce because it’s the main supply center for the outlying areas. This district is part of Lambayeque province and it’s half an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. Cristina earns her living selling vegetables in a small market in Lambayeque; she’s been in this line of work for over 8 years. Every day she goes to the Moshoqueque market (regional wholesale market) very early to buy her products that she then resells to her customers all day and into the evening. Because all her products are fresh, demand is high and she has built up a good base of regular customers. Continued demand for her products has made her consider expanding her stall. This is why she’s asking Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for a 1500 new sol loan to buy vegetables to reach this goal. Cristina is a tenacious woman who gives all of herself to have her children succeed in life. Her greatest wish is to see them become fully developed into professionals. Her neighbors and coworkers deem her an excellent person.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: James Gichure

texts.en:
James is 39 years old, is married to Virginia, and they have two daughters.

James has been running a transport business for the past three years. He also sells fresh milk as his other source of income. 

James was introduced to KADET through an existing KADET client. He plans to expand his business with the loan he has applied for so that he can supply more milk to hotels and schools near his home town.

James hopes to buy a power saw for timber extraction so as to sell firewood. He describes himself as a hardworking businessman who is honest, optimistic and determined.

loans.use: To supply more milk to hotels and schools

loans.name: Moctar

texts.fr:
Monsieur Moctar Koné  est un homme marié de 29 ans qui vit dans une famille monogame avec ses deux  enfants et son épouse dans le quartier Ouest de Kolondièba dans la troisième région (Sikasso) de la République du  Mali. 
 Monsieur Moctar fait comme activité génératrice de revenu l’achat  stockage vente de céréales depuis maintenant plusieurs années.
Pour mieux alléger sa pauvreté,  il adhéra au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso en optant pour le prêt individuel de stockage et commercialisation de céréales. Il est à son quatrième cycle après avoir bien remboursés les trois prêts précédents.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, il compte avoir 400  kilogrammes de grains d’arachide, 1000  kilogrammes de mil qu’il stockera pour revendre à la période où le cours est plus élevé.
 Il s’approvisionne sur le marché de Kolondièba les jours de foire et revendra aux grossistes venant de Sikasso et Bamako.
Il espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  60.000  FCFA 
Il compte faire prospérer son commerce en faisant varier ses articles pour réaliser un chiffre d’affaire plus élevé dans les jours à venir. Le bénéfice  sera  investi dans l’entreprise.
texts.en:
Mr. Moctar Koné, 29, is married and lives in a monogamous family with his two children and his wife, in the West district of Kolondièba in the third region (Sikasso) of the Republic of Mali. Mr. Moctar stocks and resells cereals to earn his living and has been doing this for several years. Wishing to lift himself out of poverty, he joined the credit program of Soro Yiriwaso, opting for an individual loan for stocking and selling cereals. He is on his fourth loan, after having reimbursed the three preceding loans. With this new loan, he intends to buy 400 kg of peanuts and 1000 kg of millet which he will stockpile for sale at the period where the price is higher. He buys his grains at the market of Kolondièba on market days and sells to wholesalers coming from Sikasso and Bamako. He hopes to make an average monthly profit of 60,000 F CFA. He intends to make his business prosper by varying the items he sells so as to make more sales in the days to come. His profit will be reinvested in his business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cereals to stockpile for resale

loans.name: Oem

texts.en: Mrs. Oem S. is 48 years old and is a villager who lives in Smaong village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1-hectare of land to cultivate rice on. Aside from being a farmer, she is also a pig breeder who wants to earn a small income by selling duck eggs to support her family. To expand her duck breeding, Mrs. Oem S. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice and duck feed for duck breeding. Her husband, Mr.  Chorn S., is a construction worker where he can receive a small salary to help support his family. Mrs. Oem S. is the mother of four children who all are students and also support their mother's businesses.

loans.use: To buy rice and duck feed

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 46 años, vive con su hija Amy de 7 años en su casa propia. Hace mas de dos años se dedica en la venta de Bebidas como gaseosas y cerveza, resultándole muy rentable este negocio, y esto se debe al esfuerzo que le pone a su trabajo. la ventas lo realiza dentro de su casa, en donde los años y la experiencia han hacho que este negocio le sea estable y a la vez conocida por toda la gente que viven dentro de su localidad. Disfruta mucho el trabajo que realiza, puesto que siempre termina la venta muy rápido y se queda con las botellas vacías, entregándolas al camión distribuidor de bebidas. En un futuro desea mejorar su negocio poniendo una gran tienda. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP y siempre se caracterizó por ser muy responsable con sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, desea comprar mayor cantidad de bebidas para aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Gloria is 46 years old and lives in her own house with her seven year old daughter named Amy. For more than two years she has been selling beverages such as sodas and beer. Her business has become highly profitable as a result of the effort she puts into her work. Gloria sells her products out of her home. Due to her years of experience, she has been able to make her business stable and is now known among everyone living in her neighborhood. She enjoys her work and always tries to make quick sales. At the end of the day, she collects the empty bottles to leave for the beverage distribution truck. In the future, she wants to improve her business by converting it into a large store.

This is her sixth loan with MFP. Gloria is always known for being very responsible with her payments. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy large quantities of beverages to increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sodas to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah describes herself as a persevering businesswoman who sells fresh yams to customers and also operates a beauty saloon in her neighborhood. She is married to a teacher. She is thirty years old and she is the mother of two children, 1 and 2 years old. She spends most of her time taking care of her businesses and also supporting her kids in school.

Sarah loves selling, and enjoys serving customers. She believes in customer care and her broad smile and friendliness has helped her retain most of her customers. She plans to invest the loan to purchase fresh yams in bulk and to include the sale of charcoal.

Sarah is optimistic about the future and she hopes to supply fresh yam and charcoal to boarding schools.

loans.use: To purchase fresh yams and charcoal in bulk

loans.name: Mwinda Plus Group

texts.en:
Erick B., aged 27, is the president of the Community Bank “Mwinda Plus,” which is composed of 19 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through MFI HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Erick is single. He sells second-hand clothing. He has been in business since 2001. He manages his business in his area located the center-east of the city of Kinshasa. He has already received one loan and has repaid it properly. He intends to use the next loan to expand the inventory of his business by buying a bundle of used clothing to resell with the aim of increasing his profits. Each week, his business brings in a profit of US$ 30. His ambition is to open a general store.

loans.use: increasing his inventory by buying a bundle of used clothing

loans.name: Tobiko Ole

texts.en:
Tobiko ole N. is 38 years-old.  He is married to Pariote N. and he is a father of four children.  Tobiko is a wheat farmer and, for the last ten years, he has farmed on his own piece of land.

He learned about Kiva partner KADET through a friend who is a KADET registered client in his area of residence. This will be his first loan and he plans to spend the fifteen thousand buying seeds and fertilizer. 

He hopes to use the profit generated from this loan to reinvest on the farm and plant a bigger piece of land with wheat.

Tobiko's dream is to do large scale farming and attain financial independence.

He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Juan Daniel

texts.es:
Juan Daniel A. A. tiene 23 anos. Es casado y vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia Bolívar de Ecuador. Tiene 1 hija de 2 anos y medio. 

Juan es socio de la ventanilla rural Gradas Chico, que está ubicada a quince minutos en carro de la ciudad de Guaranda. Son 20 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz, trigo, papas, y la cría de animales.  Este es el tercer préstamo que sacan con la cooperativa.

A Juan se dedica a la agricultura. Tiene cultivos de maíz y papas que vende en el mercado de Guaranda cada mes. Tambien trabaja en la construccion de casas en la ciudad de Guaranda. 

Solicita el credito para comprar un ganado. Con el apoyo del credito podra mejorar su vida un poco mas. Su sueno es hacerle estudiar a su hija. Se desafia porque han bajado el precio de los cultivos. 

En su tiempo libre le gusta jugar el boli y el futbol.
texts.en:
Juan Daniel A. A., 23, is married and lives in Guaranda, Bolívar Province, Ecuador. He has a two and a half year old daughter. Juan is a member of the Gradas Chico communal bank located fifteen minutes by car from the city of Guaranda. It has 20 members total who are mostly corn, wheat and potato farmers and cattlemen. This is the third loan they take out with the cooperative. Juan is a farmer. He has corn and potato crops that he sells monthly in Guaranda’s market. He also works in home construction in the city of Guaranda. He is asking for funds to buy a head of cattle. With help from the loan he will be able to improve his life a bit more. His dream is to provide an education for his daughter. It’s a challenge because crop prices have dropped. During his free time he likes to play volleyball and soccer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a head of cattle.

loans.name: Benny

texts.en:
Benny A. is a married woman with two children who are 13 and 14 years old. Her husband, Joefran, is 44 years old and works as a tricycle driver. The family lives in Purok Rubia, a part of Barangay Binobohan, Bago City in the Negros Occidental province on the Western Visayas islands. Benny has three businesses: sugarcane farming, buying and selling dry goods, and raising and selling pigs. Joefran also helps his wife with her businesses.

Benny joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past fifteen loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Benny has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 20,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 17,000 PHP, lifting the family's standard of living.

This time, for her sixteenth loan cycle, she is borrowing 29,500 PHP, which she intends to use to pay for more fertilizer for her sugarcane farm. She intends to use the profits to continue saving up for the future education of her children and the expansion of her businesses. Benny A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They are on a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon—a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her sugarcane farm

loans.name: Jose Norlando

texts.es: El señor José Norlando, desde hace mas de dos años instalo en su casa de habitación una pulpería, que es atendía personalmente por él y su esposa, este negocio lo instalo como una fuente de empleo y de ingresos para la familia. Tiene un horario de atención de lunes a viernes de 6 de la mañana a 7 de la noche, vende granos básicos, refrescos naturales y artificiales, cosméticos, golosinas, ropa para niños y otros productos. Con este financiamiento aumentara el inventario de sus productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes y de esa manera aumentar sus ganancias. El sueña con lograr convertir su pulpería en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
For many years, José Norlando has had a general store in his home, which he and his wife run.  The business was started to provide employment and income for his family.  It is open from Monday to Friday from 6 am to 7 pm.  It sells staples, juices and soft drinks, cosmetics, sweets, children's clothes, and other products.  

He will invest this loan in products for his clients so as to increase his income.  He wants to convert his store into a local distributor one day.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Elijah Kariuki

texts.en:
Elijah has been operating his motorcycle for transportation in Naivasha town for the last 3 1/2 years.  He is 24 years old, married to Esther Wanjiru and they have one child.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He paid his first loan of Kshs 67,500 well and on time.  He plans to use the loan amount to open a retail shop, which will be run by his wife.

In future, Elijah hopes to own his own lorry, which he will be use to transport goods for people.

loans.use: To open a retail shop for his wife.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El Señor Mario es cliente nuevo que tiene como actividad  transportista, se dedica al transportista de pasajeros, el vive en la zona de Irpavi alto, la esposa fue una cliente antigua que trabajo con crédito en grupo dentro de la institución sin ningún problema en el pago de sus cuotas,  ambos tienen dos hijas que se encuentran estudiando, pero solo con una vive con ellos  ya que la otra  hija se casó recientemente, el crédito que solicita es para comprar motor para su transporte ya que esta presentando algunas fallas y esto no le permite realizar un buen servicio, es una persona responsable y esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mario is a new client who works as a taxi driver, driving passengers.  He lives in the Irpavi Alto region.  His wife was a former client who worked with a group loan within the organization.  She had no problems in meeting her repayments.  They both have two daughters who are studying but only one of their daughters lives with them since the other recently got married.  The loan which he is requesting is for purchasing an engine for his vehicle since it keeps breaking down which means that he cannot provide a good service.  He is a responsible person and very grateful to the organization for the support it has given him.

loans.use: New engine

loans.name: Cheena's Group

texts.en:
Cheena is married to G. M., who is a painter by profession and paints buildings and homes. He gets work from the house owners and building owners on a contract basis, and after completing the work he gets the full income. 

Cheena  is a very supportive lady by nature. She offers her cooking services to her neighboring families. She is a great cook and earns a reasonably good income from her work. 

She has given birth to 2 sons. Both are illiterate and work for a little income.  She lives with her family in the area named R-A Bazar, which is a residential area of Lahore. Lahore is Pakistan’s second largest city and is known for its history and culture. She has lived there in a 3-room brick house for the past 9 years. 

Cheena has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will invest the loan in purchasing paint boxes of different colors to offer better quality services to his clients. He has been doing this business for the past 8 years and Cheena is hopeful that this investment will be beneficial for his business and will make him good income. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Cheena.

loans.use: To buy paint for painting business

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth A. aged 34 years is a business lady who sells dry fish in Dandora estate. She is married to John Waga and together they have three children, Willis aged 15 years who is in high school, Billy aged 13 and Cynthia aged 10 years who are both is lower primary school. She has been running this business for a period of 4 years and her monthly income is Kshs 10,000.

She was introduced to KADET by other existing clients and she has applied for a loan of Kshs 15000. She plans to use Kshs 13,500 to buy more stocks of fish and Kshs  and Kshs 1,500 for transport it to her business premise. If the loan boosts the business Ruth will add more stocks to expand her business.

Ruth dreams of being a big supplier of different types of fish to many towns.

loans.use: To increase stocks of fish for sale.

loans.name: Naris

texts.en: B. Naris is an individual client in Rukungiri. He is 40 years old and married with 7 children, 5 of them in school. Naris is a police driver and he needs a loan to be able to purchase land that he will use both for farming and cattle keeping. As a result of taking loans, Naris has been able to build a house for his family, educating his children with the help of his wife.

loans.use: Buying a plot of land for agriculture

loans.name: Michael Uriel

texts.es: Michael tiene 27 años, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos. Se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado las ventas las realiza entre sus vecinos y los negociantes de la zona, este negocio le brinda los ingresos que necesita para sacar adelante la economía de su familia. En esta oportunidad él se encuentra trabajando arduamente para que sus animales puedan ser comprados. Michael se encuentra solicitando un crédito que planea invertir en la compra de vacas, terneros pues tiene ciertos pedidos.
texts.en: Michael is 27 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and two children.  His business is buying and selling livestock.  He makes his sales to neighbors and traders in the area.  His business provides him with the income he needs to get his family ahead financially.  Right now, Michael is working hard so that he can sell his animals.  He is requesting a loan that he plans to invest in buying cows and calves as he has some orders to fill.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca W. N. is a 27 year old business lady from Mariakani. She has one dependant who is her sister. Prisca is a shoe supplier and seller and she also owns a motorbike which is used to transport goods and people to various places. She has been in these businesses for the last two years.

This marks her second loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the funds from this loan in addition to her savings to buy a piece of land in which she will build rental houses. The anticipated profits will be directed into the expansion of her shoe supply and motorbike business. Her dream is to own more plots in future.

loans.use: buy a piece of land

loans.name: Tep

texts.en: Tep N. T. is a 65-year-old married woman who currently lives with her family members in a small house in Kompong Thom Province. She earns her living by cultivating a rice crop on her farmland. Tep N. T. has many years of experience in the field and she always gets great results from her farming, both dry season and rainy season. She has another financial supporter in her husband who works in the construction field as a building worker. This couple has only one child who sells a few items in front of her house. Due to the fact that the rice-harvesting season is coming, Tep N. T. has decided to seek a loan from Kiva for capital to buy more rice when prices are low for future sales, and to use the rest for the whole family to eat.

loans.use: To buy more rice for future sales and for the whole family to eat.

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en:
Ilham is a young mother of two daughters and one son. Ilham and her husband Muhammad have a small farm raising goats and sheep for sale. Jabalia refugee camp which is known for its high population secures them a good number of clients, both individuals and butcheries.

Ilham took a loan from FATEN to purchase more livestock and feed to enlarge the business and increase the returns. They depend on the farm as it is their primary and only source of income.

Ilham's husband appears in the picture here as she is a religious woman.

About this loan product:

 FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money.
