This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the culturA. context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. 

In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principA. loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m

loans.use: Purchase more goats and enlarge the business

loans.name: Luz María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal La Inmaculada, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Luz, tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos de 28, 27, 20 y 19 años, todos viven en su casa y la última está  estudiando en Universidad. 

Ella tiene una tienda de viveras de consumo en su casa, vende productos como  arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, etc. en ella trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos le ayudan en su trabajo, los productos los compra en el centro de Tosagua aunque la mayoría de sus productos los recibe en su local, nos cuenta que lleva dos años con su negocio y que lo empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del banco.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace tres ciclos  y le gusta porque ha hecho muchas amigas en el grupo. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The “La Inmaculada” communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua, a place known for being very dynamic most of whose residents raise animals and are farmers because it’s an area with much vegetation.

We met Luz in this place.  She’s 44 years old and a single mother of four children who are 28, 27, 20 and 19 years of age.  They all live together in their house and the youngest is going to the university.

She has a home-based grocery store.  She sells products like rice, sugar, oil, detergents, etc.  She is open every day from 6am until 8pm and sometimes even later.  Her children help her with the work.  She buys her stock items in downtown Tosagua although most of her merchandise is delivered to the store.  She tells us that she’s been in business two years and that she started it with the first loan she got from the bank.

This loan will be used to better stock the store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, cured meats and other basic need products.  

She’s been in the communal bank for three cycles and she likes it because she’s made many friends in the group.  Her goals are to stay in business and that her store grows more every day.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, cured meats and other basic need items.

loans.name: Ikpindji

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Ikpindji est âgée  de  47 ans.  Elle  est née  à Bassar  et  habite  quartier  Kpogan.  Elle  fait  l’élevage de porc  à  son domicile à Kpogan.  Elle  a débuté son activité  en 2005 et achète leurs   nourritures au  grand  marché  de Lomé. Elle sollicite  un  prêt  pour  acheter de nouvelles  races de  porc.
texts.en: Miss Ikpindji is 47 years old. She was born in Bassar and lives in the Kpogan district. She raises pigs at her home in Kpogan. She began her activity in 2005 and buys the pigs' food at the large market in Lomé. She is requesting a loan to buy new breeds of pigs.

loans.use: To buy new breeds of pigs

loans.name: Tharch

texts.en: Tharch S., 32, resides in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. S. sell groceries, earning an income of about 5 USD each per day. Her husband is a construction foreman, earning an income of 8.33 USD per day. Each month, the family has to spend 60 USD on food and 110 USD on other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase traditional baskets to resell. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy traditional baskets to resell

loans.name: Yolanda Del Carmen

texts.es: Yolanda del Carmen M. G. de treinta y siete años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y su hija en el departamento de Santa Ana. Ella posee una tienda en su residencia la cual es muy visitada por la gente del lugar.  Yolanda es una mujer muy servicial, muy entregada a su negocio y tiene como lema al cliente lo que necesita. Últimamente se ha hecho de más clientela y quiere satisfacer las necesidades de todos es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL  un crédito que le permita abastecer con más producto como sopas instantáneas, pan, huevos, bebidas, golosinas entre otros.  Yolanda tiene la esperanza que su negocio le dará un mejor futuro a su hija y podrá solventar todas las necesidades de su hogar.
texts.en: Yolanda del Carmen M. G. is 37 years old; she lives with her life partner and her daughter in the Department of Santa Ana. She has a store in her home, which is very well-visited by people in the neighborhood. Yolanda is a dedicated mother and businesswoman; her motto is "give the customers what they need." Recently, Yolanda's customer base has grown she wants to satisfy everyone's needs; for this reason, she is applying for a loan from INTEGRAL, which would allow her to stock up on more products, such as instant soups, bread, eggs, drinks, and candy, among others. Yolanda hopes that her business will give her daughter a better future, and can pay for all her household necessities.

loans.use: to buy instant soups, bread, eggs, beverages, and candy.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce S. is 28 years old. She is currently in the business of selling clothes. She will use her loan to stock more clothes. Joyce is married to a jobless man and they have two children (only one is in school). Her future goal is to build a house.

loans.use: stock more clothes.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael is a 30-year-old man from Jabalia Refugee camp in Gaza Strip. Ismael is an accountant in a textile factory in Jabalia. Ismael got married recently and even though he is an employee with a decent salary, he couldn't furnish his house. Ismael took out a loan from FATEN to purchase the furniture that the family needs.

Ismael is photographed in the picture above.

loans.use: to purchase home furniture

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.es:
La señora Ignacia es soltera y tiene 3 hijos, todos mayores de edad.
Ignacia desde hace 27 años se dedica a la comercialización de artículos de primera  necesidad, y desea aumentar su stock de mercaderías con la inversión del crédito solicitado en la compra de arroz, yerba, azúcar, fideos, gaseosas, etc. ya que posee su propio local de ventas en su domicilio donde le abastece  a todo el vecindario.
Ignacia posee muchas más mercaderías debido a la cantidad de clientes que tiene en la actualidad. 
Ella espera poder superar más aún la pobreza en la que viven, porque desea poder tener una vejez tranquila.
texts.en:
Ignacia is single and has three grown-up children.  For the past 27 years, she has been selling basic household products.  She would like to increase her stock by investing the loan that she has requested in buying rice, yerba mate, sugar, noodles, soda, etc.  She has a sales location in her own home from which she supplies the whole neighborhood.

Ignacia has a lot of merchandise owing to the number of customers that she has right now.  She hopes to be able to further overcome the poverty in which she lives because she would like to enjoy a peaceful old age.

loans.use: to buy rice, yerba mate, sugar, noodles, soda, etc.

loans.name: Bin

texts.en: Bin has been in the farming business for years. She plants various crops to earn a living and typically generates an income of $2 per day. Her husband earns a living driving a motor-trailer taxi in the busy market, Prey Chor district. This couple has been married for years and has three children, all of whom are teenagers attending school. Bin will be using her loan for rebuilding her house. Bin and her husband were taken in this photo in front of their house.

loans.use: to rebuild her house.

loans.name: Lateifa

texts.en:
Lateifa is a 27-year-old woman. She and her mom live with her married brother as they have no other family left to live with or take care of them. Lateifa takes care of her sick mother hence she can't go to work. Lateifa's brother is employed at a clothes store.

Lateifa took out a loan from FATEN as the family live in the Noor Shams refugee camp and the house, like most of the refugee camp houses, needs a lot of maintenance. The house floor is made out of concrete.

 Lateifa, who appears in the picture, wants to replace it with tiles and fix water lines as well.

loans.use: to pay for tiles and construction material to fix up her house in the refugee camp.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma  is 50 years  old.  She  is married  with two children. 

 Emma   is engaged in buying and selling seafood products like fish, shrimp, shells and crabs.  She has had this business for three years.  She  requested a loan of 8000 to  buy more seafood products to sell.

 Emma  has been a member of HSPFI  since the year 2008.  In the future,  Emma  hopes to have a better business to be of more help to her family.

loans.use: To buy more seafood products to sell.

loans.name: Ntungamo Bakyara Tuhirirwe Group

texts.en:
Ruth is a 48-year-old married woman with five children aged between 8 and 15 years of age all of whom go to school. Ruth owns a guest house and therefore offers accommodation to the traders who come to town and to tourists who sometimes trickle into the local area to see some of Ntungamo's fascinating scenery. Ruth loudly explains how happy she is to have managed to set up and run a good accommodation facility for five years with a steady income of 150,000 Ugandan shillings as average weekly profits. She, however, stresses that it has not been easy but through hard work, valuing customers and above all, providing comfortable accommodation and an environment that has made it a place to think about as a priority for accommodation in the area. 

This determined woman, with a temperament for work, also participates in agriculture particularly in banana growing and her goal in future is to open up a modern restaurant within the guest house to sell her bananas since she has a ready market. With the Kiva loan, Ruth intends to expand and modernize her banana plantation by mulching and applying fertilisers for better yields.

loans.use: To mulch and apply fertilisers to her banana plantation for better yields.

loans.name: Annonciata

texts.en: Annonciata is a 48-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur with three children between the ages of 20 and 26. All her children are in school and she is a widow. For the past four years, she has run a business selling foodstuffs and this enterprise has helped her feed her family. She requires this loan so she can purchase 100 kg of beans and sorghum that she will sell to make a profit. With her profits, she plans to accumulate savings that will allow her to provide for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated an open-air food business, selling to local residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality; during peak season the demand is higher. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase sacks of beans, cooking fat, and charcoal. She decided to join Yehu because of the efficiency of its loan products.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of beans, cooking fat, and charcoal.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 48 years old and married to Paul. They are blessed with one child. Rose has been running her business for the past year, making a monthly profit of KES 62,400. She has been loaned KES 30,000, which she plans to use to purchase more clothing for her shop.

With the anticipated profit made, she plans to open another branch in Kitengela and in Mlolongo. In the near future, she hopes to be a big supplier of the curtains and cushions that she makes.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing for her shop

loans.name: Ronkosi

texts.en:
Ronkosi has been farming for the last fifteen  years.  He is 60 years old, married and supports ten people in the family.

He was introduced to KADET by a KADET staff, and he is applying for his second loan. He plans to use this loan amount to buy maize seeds and fertilizer, and also to hire temporary field workers to assist him in planting. 

In the future, he hopes to become a leading farmer in the region.

loans.use: buy maize seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin is a businessman aged 39. He is married and blessed with  three children who are still in school. For the last six years, he has been managing a welding business to earn a living. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how to save his money and manage his business.  In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy metal sheets and welding rods.

loans.use: To buy  sheet metal and welding rods.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un enseignant.Il est marié et père de trois enfants.IPour améliorer sesrevenus, il a acheté un taxi et a recruté un chauffeur pour faire du transport urbain.Ces activités lui assurent des revenus assez consistants pour entretenir sa famille. Actuellement, il sollicite un pret de 400000f pour acheter un moteur neuf et des accessoirs pour son véhicule.
texts.en: This borrower is a teacher. He is married and the father of three children. To improve his revenues, he bought a taxi and has recruited a driver to operate in urban transport. This work ensures the revenues sufficient enough to support his family. Currently, he is requesting a loan of 400,000 francs to buy a new motor and some accessories for his vehicle.

loans.use: to buy a new motor and accessories for his vehicle

loans.name: Heidi

texts.en: Heidi is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Heidi provides motorcycle or habal-habal services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service. Heidi has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Heidi hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Granda conocida por sus estructuras coloniales y artesanía precolombinas, vive doña María Auxiliadora, una comerciante de 51 años de edad, madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 26 años de edad, independiente. Ella se dedica a vender artesanías, anteriormente trabajaba como secretaria para una empresa en la ciudad de Managua, y fue ahí que una adquirió conocimiento, experiencia que la motivo a tener su propio negocio además a ella le gusta nuestra cultura y riqueza artesanal que posee el país, esto le ayuda a identificarse con el tipo de negocio que ella quería tener, ya lleva 6 años con su venta de artesanías, hamacas y cuadros pintorescos que por cierto son muy buscados por los turistas. Ella nos cuenta que su negocio le ha permitido conocer y aprender de nuestra propia cultura y entender porque los visitantes les gustan mucho las artesanías además este negocio le  ha proveído alimentación y pagar gastos de su hogar.
Ella realizo el préstamo para comprar artesanías tales como hamacas tejidas, cuadros, jarrones, hoyas.  Esta inversión le ayudara a tener más inventario ya que se acerca una época fuerte  donde viene  al país bastantes turistas  y quiere aprovechar a vender. Ella desea tener un local propio y es por ello que trabaja fuerte y duro todos los días.
texts.en:
In the city of Granada, known for its colonial buildings and pre-Columbian handicrafts, lives María Auxiliadora, a 51-year-old merchant. She is a single mother with a son who is 26 years old and independent. She works selling handicrafts. Previously, she worked as a secretary for a company in the city of Managua, and there she acquired knowledge and experience which motivated her to have her own business. In addition, she likes our culture and the country's rich tradition of handicrafts -- this helped her to decide on the type of business she wanted to operate. She has now worked for 6 years selling handicrafts, hammocks and picturesque paintings which are in great demand among tourists. She reports that her business has allowed her to learn about and get to know our own culture and to understand why visitors are very fond of handicrafts. In addition, this business has provided her with her daily bread and covered her household expenses. 

She applied for this loan to buy handicrafts such as woven hammocks, paintings, pots and jewelry. This investment will help her expand her inventory, since a high season is approaching when many tourists come to the country, and she would like to take advantage of this to sell to them. She would like to have her own building for her shop, and for this reason she is working long and hard every day.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts to sell such as woven hammocks, paintings, pots and jewelry.

loans.name: 06.07.03 Đông Vệ Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Lan has a retail business selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dry food to resell. Lan has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Lan faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Lan is 41-years-old and she is married with 3 children. Lan lives with 2 dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 03 Đông Vệ solidarity group. 


In 2010, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Lan has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Lan hopes for her children to find good jobs, to repair her house, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more dry food to resell.

loans.name: Mbossé

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée.Elle vit chez son mari avec ses deux enfants.Pour participer  à l'entretien de la petite famille et subvenir à ses propres besoins, elle exerce un commerce de produits cosmétiques.Ses produits lui proviennent des pays environnants sur commande et elle les place auprès des  magasins locaux.Pour renforcer son activité, elle sollicite un prêt de 400 000f avec lequel elle va acheter des caisses de parfum, de  lait de beauté, des mèches et d'autres produits  cosmétiques divers.Son ambition est d'installer en centre ville un magasin de vente en gros de produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
This borrower is a married woman who lives with her husband and their two children. She sells beauty products to support herself and help with the household responsibilities. She orders her merchandise from surrounding countries to supply local shops. 

In order to strengthen her business, she is seeking a loan of 400,000F to buy cases of perfume, beauty lotion, hair extensions and various other cosmetic products. Her goal is to set up a wholesale store downtown.

loans.use: to buy cases of perfume, beauty lotion, hair extensions and various other cosmetic products

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa, D. 63 años D. edad, es una mujer que le gusta el campo, trabajadora y empeñosa, además D. dinámica  y alegre. Esta casada con Nicolás, vive en compañía D. su esposo y su hija D. 20 años D. edad, habitando cómodamente una casa que es D. su propiedad, que le fue heredada por sus padres. La actividad que realiza Elsa es la agricultura, cultivando maíz, frijoles, chiclayos, plátanos y otros. Para eso cuenta con un terreno ubicado en el caserío D. Pacacocha, con una extensión D. 3 hectáreas, donD. cultiva estos productos desD. hace 15 años, con la ayuda D. 6  peones que contrata y paga por día trabajado. Lo que le gusta D. su actividad es el trabajo D. campo, estar en contacto con la naturaleza, oficio que aprendió D. sus padres, además que con los ingresos económicos que tiene apoya a su esposo que es obrero, a solventar los gastos D. su hogar, así como arreglar el techado D. su casa. Por otro lado, se siente contenta ya que logra vender toda lo que produce, pero por ahora dado su edad, solo tiene planes D. mantener su negocio. Este será el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP, está agradecida por la línea D. crédito que tiene, por eso se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas, como en créditos anteriores. Además D. sentirse cómoda con el grupo que forma parte, pues considera a sus miembros ser personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado D. 2500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la contratación D. peones para la cosecha D. la producción D. maíz.
texts.en: Elsa, 63, is a woman who loves the countrysiD., is hardworking and tenacious, as well as dynamic and cheerful. She is married to Nicholas, living with her husband and daughter, 20, comfortably inhabiting a house that is his property, inherited by his parents. The activity that Elsa performs is agriculture, growing corn, beans, Chiclayo, bananas and others. For that she has a lot located in the hamlet of Pacacocha, with an area of 3 hectares. She has been cultivating these products for 15 years with the help of 6 pawns who she hires and pays for days worked. What she likes about her business is field work, staying in touch with nature, a traD. she learned from her parents, as well as with the income that has supported her husband who is a worker, to cover the costs of her home and fix the roof of her house. On the other hand, she feels happy to sells all she produces, but for now, given her age, she only has plans to maintain her business. This will be the 4th loan with the institution MFP, and for that, she is grateful for the line of credit she has, so she agrees to comply with the repayment, as in previous loans. In addition to feeling comfortable with the group, she considers their members to be responsible and caring. With the requested amount of 2500 nuevos soles, she will invest in hiring laborers for the corn harvest.

loans.use: to hire laborers.

loans.name: Laura Lila Clariza

texts.es:
En el municipio de Quezalguaque, la señora Laura se siente muy orgullosa de ser maestra de primaria porque le apasiona enseñar a los niños ya que así contribuye al desarrollo de estos pequeños para que mañana sean grandes profesionales. Son 27 años de su vida que ha dedicado a la docencia, es soltera y con una hija a su cargo.

Una de las necesidades que la  señora  Laura atraviesa, es de mejorar el techo de su vivienda debido a que ha estado en malas condiciones, por lo que se decidió  acudir a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como, alfajillas, zinc, bloques y mano de obra para realizar las mejoras en la casa en lo que es el techo. 

De esta forma, brindará mayor seguridad a su vivienda y por tanto a su hija que tanto ama.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Quezalguaque, Sra. Laura is very proud of being an elementary school teacher because she is passionate about educating children. She contributes to the development of the little ones so that they can become successful professionals in the future. Laura has spent 27 years of her life teaching. She is single and has a daughter under her care.

One of Sra. Laura’s existing needs is to improve the roof of her home, which is in poor condition. For this reason, she decided to approach CEPRODEL in order to request a loan for purchasing construction materials such as lumber, zinc, blocks, as well as pay for labor so that that the improvements to the roof of her home can be completed. This will provide greater security at home for her daughter, who she loves dearly.

loans.use: to pay for materials and labor in order to renovate the roof of her house.

loans.name: Dembe Ku 2 Dev't Group

texts.en:
Jim supports himself with a vehicle repair business that is located a stone's throw away from the metropolis of Kampala.

Jim, a father of three, is a sprightly and purposeful businessman who credits his business's growth to the good service he offers his clients. Weekly he makes about UGX 100,000. He is envisaging expansion in the not-too-distant future.

Jim says he needs to purchase more tires, car spray, tire rims, oils, and other supplies. He is hoping this loan will go a long way in improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase more tires, car spray, tire rims, and oils.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more guinea pigs.

loans.name: Derly Hubert

texts.es:
El socio Derly pertenece al banco comunal "MAMACHA ASUNTA DE CALCA"; El banco se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Calca perteneciente al departamento de Cusco, a una hora de la ciudad del Cusco.

El socio tiene 24 años de edad y es soltero, el socio es estudiante y también realiza trabajos nemores como prestacion de reparto a domicilio, el socio tiene una moto en la cual se mobiliza para entregar los mandatos y desea en esta ocasióin implementarla para continuar con este apoyo el cual le permite pagar sus estudios. El socio solicita el prestamo para invertir en la implementación y mantenimiento de sus moto.

El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en: Derly belongs to the "Mamacha Ausnta de Calca" community bank located in the province of Calca, one hour from the city of Cusco. He is 24 years old and single. He is a student and also does odd jobs like home deliveries. He has a motorcycle that he uses to deliver the items, and at this time he wants to set it up so he can further use the bike to pay for his studies. He is requesting the loan to set up his motorcycle for more work and pay for its maintenance. Derly is grateful for the loan and promises to makes his payments at the established times.

loans.use: to pay for the implementation and maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn isthe mother of Jorel and is a member of NWTF. She needs PHP 6355 to pay for Jorel's tuition fees of the first semester of the school year 2014-2015.

Jorel is 23 years old and is studying toward his Bachelor of Science in Industrial Technology. He is currently in his 2nd year of this 4-year course.

When he graduates, Jorel plans to be gainfully employed so that he can help his family in the future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
ENGLISH

In 1984 Mr. Juan S. left his town looking for a better life. He moved to Linares City to study in an agricultural school, but when he finished his studies he could not find a job in the area in which he studied. For this reason, he began to work in a furniture store as a collector and salesman, where he learned about the furniture business. Six years ago he started his own small business looking for a better future for his wife and three children. His wife supports him by helping with the organization of his business.

Juan is requesting a loan for $925 USD for the purchase of chairs and tables for the next season. In this upcoming season, their sales of this type of furniture are increased. He wants to pay the loan back in a term of 6-12 months.

ESPAÑOL

En 1984 el señor Juan S. salió de su pueblo buscando una vida mejor y se mudó a Linares a estudiar en una escuela agropecuaria, pero al terminar sus estudios no encontró empleo en el área en que estudió y comenzó a trabajar en una mueblería como cobrador y vendedor de muebles, en donde aprendió el negocio. Hace seis años que inició su negocio buscando poder ofrecer un mejor futuro para su familia, la cual esta compuesta por su esposa y tres hijos. Su esposa además de atender el hogar le ayuda en la organización del negocio.

Juan esta solicitando un préstamo por $925 USD para la compra de sillas y mesas para vender en su negocio ya que piensa aprovechar la próxima temporada en que se incrementan sus ventas por este tipo de muebles. El plazo que solicita para pagar el préstamo es de 6-12 meses.

loans.use: Chairs and Tables

loans.name: Faig

texts.en:
Faig lives in Yenikand village, Salyan region.He is married and has 3 children. He started his business 5 years ago. 
Faig does auto maintainance on most cars which operate in his region and other regions.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy spare parts for all types of vehicles in order to meet his customer's needs.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Merita Seilala

texts.en: Merita is raising four children who are all still in school.  With the motive of keeping them in school and ensuring they have a bright future filled with opportunities, Merita opened a small stall at the local market.  She works hard to make this venture successful.  In her stall she sells baskets and local handicrafts, as well as the popular Samoan dresses, puletasis. She is seeking a small loan to purchase additional merchandise to ensure she will be able to keep a consistent supply of goods. When she keeps her stall fully stocked, she earns ST 100 (about USD 40) a day from her sales; This makes Merita the primary breadwinner in her family and she is anxious to keep investing in her business to increase her income.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her stall

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is a widow who supports herself by selling clothes. She is a smart and capable businesswoman who enjoys her work. Her business is located at the new Image shopping center in Beregovo, which is popular with locals and tourists. Elena has been in business for about eight years and no longer has to pay rent, because she now owns her retail space. In the future, she would like to expand to a second location and hire an employee to help with sales. Elena has asked for a loan to help purchase new inventory so that she can keep up with fast-changing summer fashions. We are happy to have this opportunity to help a hard-working entrepreneur.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase medicine and beauty products at wholesale prices

loans.name: Selemena

texts.en: Selemena is a new member of the Samusu P Centre borrowing group.  She is 18 years old and is living with her parents, sisters, and brothers.  Over the years they lived and worked on their plantation to maintain an income.  She felt sorry for her father who had to work in very bad weather cleaning and weeding the plantation, which is very hard manual labor.  Selemena thought of getting a loan to buy equipment to help him perform these difficult tasks.  She is very thankful for this opportunity to develop her business and her family living.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her plantation

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Shoe-repair businesses are quite common in Uganda. Often times --  when riding down the road -- one sees a shoe-repair business set up under a shade tree with just a tarp, a bench and lots of old shoes and new soles. Shoe -epair persons not only repair shoes for clients, they often buy bulk quantities of old shoes, repair them and resell them. So, you see, repairing soles is not just the domain of the church. (Forgive our agent, it was late and he'd been writing a lot of stories!)

Moses has had his business for three years and does well at his location. He is able to employ and assistant. Moses is 30 years old and married with three children. He and his wife also care for two orphans. 

Moses dreams of buying a plot of land, building his own house where he can continue doing his shoe repair business and raise his family. He is requesting a loan of $550 so he can purchase more more soles. He wants to buy soles in larger quantities at wholesale, so that he can resell them to other shoe repair people. He has a keen sense of business, and one can tell he is a self promoter who gives his clients excellent service. He lee[s benches around his business so people can visit with each other while they get their shoes repaired. Sometimes they just stop by for the company.

loans.use: To stock more soles for shoe-repair business.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: My name is Rukhsana B.. I have six children: four of whom attend a local school; the other two are not old enough to attend school yet. My husband, Muhammad Mushtaq, manufactures shoes on daily wages. We are unable to make both the ends meet on his small income. Therefore, my husband has decided to start his own shoe business and for this he requires a loan of $250 to buy the necessary raw materials.

loans.use: To start a shoe business

loans.name: Jaloliddin

texts.ru:
Jaloliddin M., 44, is married and has 6 children. For 10 years, Jaloliddin has been buying, raising, and selling cattle. Since finding another job has been hard, cattle farming has been Jaloliddin’s main source of income. Jaloliddin plans to use this loan to purchase a few young animals, raise and then resell them. Jaloliddin plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Меликов Джалолиддин, возраст – 44 года, образование среднее, женат, имеет 6-х детей. Джалолиддин занимается разведением и продажей мелкого и крупного роагтого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 10 лет. Так как в настоящее время трудно найти работу, это является его источником получения дохода для содержание семьи. На полученный кредит он планирует приобрести несколько голов крупного и мелкого рогатого скота для откорма и продажи. На вырученные деньги он будет приобретать молодой скот, а полученную прибыль будет использовать на погашение кредита и содержание своей семьи. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Mrs. Clara belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres Valientes" (Brave Women), located in Callería, Ucayali in Peru. She is a single woman, 37 years old. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for S./300 soles, she decided to invest in a manicure business.

Currently, she continues with her manicure business. Her customers have increased thanks to the quality of the service she provides, and they are very satisfied. She is also on top of the latest styles, and always tries to bring the ultimate service, many times requested at the customers' homes.

With this loan for $450, which she will repay in five months, she will invest in different types and colors of nail polishes, pedicure equipment, acrylic nails, cosmetics, and creams.

Ever since she was young, Clara has been fascinated by the art of nail painting, and she never thought she'd make her living in this business. But she is very pleased to be doing what she loves, and this has helped her to become independent.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Clara pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres Valientes, ubicado en el Jr. Coronel Portillo N° 836, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 37 años y es soltera. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en un negocio de manicura.

En la actualidad continúa con el negocio de manicura, sus clientas han aumentando por la calidad del servicio que presta, t se quedan muy satisfechas, además esta a la vanguardia de los últimos modelos, siempre tratando de dar lo último a sus servicios que muchas veces son solicitados a domicilio.

Con el préstamo de S/.1,300, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de diferentes tipos y colores de esmaltes, aparatos para pedicura, uñas acrílicas, cosméticos, cremas.

Clara, desde muy joven, le llamo la atención de arte de pintar las uñas y no pensó que ello sería el negocio del cual iba a vivir, pero se siente muy a gusto haciendo lo que mas le gusta y eso la ayudó a independizarse.

loans.use: Purchase of nail polish, cosmetics, acrylic nails, etc.

loans.name: Zoila Azucena

texts.es:
Ms. C. G. is a young woman of 27 years old who works in the Town hall of Juigalpa. She is enterprising and bought her house located in the Residencial Bosques of Juigalpa. Her house is located in the Rotonda (traffic circle) 2c, south 1/2, west W-3. She is making improvements to her house such as building a wall and upgrading the floor with ceramic tiles, so that her house will be decent, safe and comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva volunteer

Joven de 27 años, trabajadora de la Alcaldia de Juigalpa, es emprendedora, ya que compro una casa en el Residencial Bosques de Juigalpan, su casa esta ubicada de la Rotonda 2c al sur ½c al oeste, W-3, donde realizara mejoras como son la construccion de una tapia y mejorar el piso con ceramica para tener una casa digna, segura y reconfortable.

loans.use: To buy the building materials in order to build a wall

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Mrs. Marisol T. F. is a member of the “All United” Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martin region of Peru, in the Picota province, district of Picota. She works selling clothing for men, women and children from her house located on Jr. Las Vegas S/N Street. She travels to nearby communities in order to sell her clothing. With this loan of 1,000 soles ($375), which she will repay over 6 months, she will invest in the purchase of underwear by the dozen for boys and girls, pants and polo shirts for men, women, boys and girls, and athletic shirts for women. She hopes to supply her business in order to satisfy her customers with varying tastes in fashion. She is 27 years old, originally from Picota, and has two children, both minors. She is known to her clients as being courteous and helpful. She is concerned with getting her family ahead and being an example for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Marisol T. F., socia del Banco Comunal “Todas Unidas”, vive el la Región San Martín, Provincia de Picota y distrito de Picota, se dedica al negocio de venta de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, en su casa situado en el Jr. Las Vegas S/N. desde donde sale a vender a las comunidades mas cercanas. Con el préstamo de S/.1000.00, que será pagado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de ropas interiores por docenas, para niñas y niños, pantalones y polos para damas y caballeros, niños y niñas, blusas sport para damas, Para surtir su negocio busca satisfacer a sus clientes en todos sus gustos con las novedades. Ella tiene 27 años de edad, natural de Picota y 02 hijos, ambos menores de edad. Se caracteriza por ser gentil y muy atenta con sus clientes. Se preocupada por sacar adelante a su familia y por ser un ejemplo para sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell

loans.name: Las Rosas De Anco Group

texts.en:
“Las Rosas D. Anco” is a small rural community bank of FINCA Peru’s Wari-project which provides its credit with education services in the rural areas of Huancavelica. Huancavelica is considered one of the poorest regions of Peru and has many limitations being a very mountainous area (altituD. ranges from 2,000 – 5,000 meters above sea level). These limitations incluD. the cold, the difficulty to grow crops, and the lack of an adequate infrastructure of roads and communication systems.

BCR “Las Rosas D. Anco”, is located at approximately 2,300 meters above sea level in the community of Anco, in the district with the same name, province of Churcampa. Anco is located at the border of the Mantaro river and is one of the lowest places in the department of Huancavelica. Due to its relatively low altituD., the area has a warm, almost tropical climate. The warm climate and the vicinity of the river make the area very suitable for growing fruits like oranges, lemons, avocado, papaya and mango. Besides the fruits, most of the people dedicate their time raising guinea-pigs and chicken. They also produce alfalfa, the crop that makes the diet of the guinea-pigs. The town of Anco is situated on the main road between 2 prominent Andes cities: Ayacucho and Huancayo. Business is done with both cities, and also people stopping on the road use the variety of services in town.

Currently the bank is starting its first loan cycle with 10 female borrowers and a total loan of 4,800 soles (about 1,750 US$). The loans range from 200, 300, 400, 500 and up to 600 soles. Because the bank has been formed recently, it has no history yet. The expectations working with FINCA Peru are very clear: increase business and save. For all members, the main use of the savings they will be generating now is for investing in their businesses or for the education of their children, whether to buy school uniforms, supplies, books, or even to pay the fees for entering primary or secondary school.

One of the members of the community bank is Flor D. María Q. A.. Flor will receive a loan of 600 soles and has a small business selling food in a kiosk on the main road. Besides that she also raises guinea-pigs. She almost has 200, and business is going well. Her dream for the future is to have her own restaurant, to have a guinea-pig farm with more than 1,000 small animals, and for her children to study. With her savings, she hopes to open her restaurant and maybe go to a bigger place with her husband, somewhere where there is a university where their children can study, where it will be more easy to have a better business. In FINCA Peru, she wants to learn and save more and learn to valuate herself as a person.

Doris Sara M. P. tells another story. She runs a small grocery store and has an internet cabin. Besides that, she serves meals to the employees of the district government. In the future, she wants to improve her grocery store and send her children to study at the university, so they can be professionals. She would like to improve the number of computers. With her 300 soles loan, she will increase her groceries. Now that she will be working with FINCA Peru, she hopes to save more and to work more responsibly to be able to pay for her loan. She will use her savings to reinvest in her business, increasing her internet business, install a fax machine, and open her restaurant. Now that she is in FINCA Perú, she hopes to to care for and value herself. Most women do not value themselves a lot. Fortunately now there is FINCA Perú which works only with women. She expects to receive trainings on how to improve business and how to work equally with men. (Her husband will do the cooking while she will attend the bank reunion and afterwards she will explain to him what she has learned!).

Tabita Durcal C. A. has a small business selling an elixir of 7 seeds and is running a small grocery store. Besides that she buys and sells cereals and school supplies for the children. With her 400 soles loan, she will buy more supplies for her store. Tabita has many dreams, like improving the lives of her children. When her husband left her, she thought that she would never improve her life and get out of her misery. FINCA Perú, an institution, has come to help the women of the community and help her to be reborn and run her business. With her savings she wants to buy herself her own house and not rent anymore. In FINCA Peru, in her community bank, she hopes to find a new family that will support each other.

loans.use: Buy new supplies

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is a small entrepreneur from Kamenka who sells leather goods, cosmetics, and small items like batteries, flashlights and blades in the central city market. Galina has chosen this market segment, because there are very few other businessmen working in it despite the high demand. She has a lot of experience selling clothing, since she has been working as a market entrepreneur for about 11 years. Currently, Galina has about US$6,000 worth of goods in the store inventory, and her monthly income is about US$600. Previously, Galina used to work as a book-keeper, and this practical skill now helps her in her everyday work. 

Currently, Galina would like to take out a short-term "express" loan (to be repaid within one month) to be able to purchase additional merchandise for the summer season, thus better meeting the needs of her customers. Financial assistance also previously has helped Galina sustain her business and herself, since, like most retired people, she receives a very small retirement fee which is not sufficient for covering even the basic expenses. The current loan will be of considerable support for Galina and will help her feel financially more secure.

loans.use: Purchase of goods for inventory

loans.name: Chhanthou

texts.en: Mrs. Chhanthou C. is a vegetable seller in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province. Since her business is doing well, she is requesting a loan to purchase a greater variety of vegetables to resell. With this loan she hopes to increase her business profits and improve her living conditions. Her husband, Mr. Amila Pok, is a motor-taxi driver who generates only a small income to support his family. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a widow with 4 children. Her children are 5, 9, 14 and 20 years old.

Mariam has a business selling fish and clothes. She has been in business since 1993. Each day, she works at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Mariam now hopes for a loan so she can buy more fish and clothes to resell.

loans.use: To buy more fish and clothes to sell

loans.name: Qurban

texts.en:
Qurban K. is 56 years old. He is married and has 5 children. He is a very active man. Almost twenty years ago, he started his business of raising sheep. His family has a small herd of sheep and one cow. He usually sells sheep to local restaurants. This is his primary and stable activity. Also during harvest season, Qurban earns additional income as a tractor driver.

Despite these two jobs, since his business is still quite small, it doesn't generate enough income for the whole family. Qurban would like to request a loan to expand his business and increase family income. He will use the profit generated by the business to repay the loan on time. With this purpose in mind, he is asking for a loan of 1000 USD in order to buy more lambs to sell when they are fully grown. The well-being of his family and his business are in your hands. Qurban and his children are sincerely grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase 15 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase footwear and toys to sell in her small business.

loans.name: Aliheydar

texts.en:
Aliheydar H. was born in 1972. Aliheydar is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Agdam region. He is in the Khirdalan settlement.

He has been in the cafe business for six years, and needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy necessary items for the cafe.

loans.use: To buy necessary items for the cafe

loans.name: Christophe

texts.fr: Né vers 1971 dans l’arrondissement de KESSOUNOU de la commune de DANGBO, monsieur  B. M. Christophe est marié et père de 2 enfants dont 1 scolarisé. Il est un cultivateur dans le village de GLAHOUNSA de la vallée de l’Ouémé et est membre du groupement  GH MISSIMAHOU DE GLAHOUNSA. Les habitants de ce village font les travaux champêtres à la décrue du fleuve ouémé. Leurs terres sont riches et les offrent un bon rendement.  Leurs spéculations principales sont la culture du maïs, du piment, des légumes, du gombo, de la tomate et du manioc. Le problème de ces habitants riverains du fleuve est que, en période de crue, ils n’ont plus d’activité et dépensent tout le revenu issu de la campagne écoulée à la consommation. A la décrue ils n’ont plus d’argent pour payer la main d’œuvre indispensable pour emblaver la superficie à eux disponible.  La pratique dans le milieu qui consiste au bradage des récoltes ne les sécurise pas et les runes d’avantage. Cette pratique est la vente à un prix dérisoire de la récolte future a un nantis pour disposer de la somme nécessaire aux travaux champêtres. Fatigués de cette pratique il a sollicité un prêt de 140 000 FCFA pour l’exploitation d’environ 1,5hectares des spéculations susse indiquées.
texts.en:
Mr. Christophe M.B. was born around 1971 in the KESSOUNOU district in the town of DANGBO. He is married and the father of two children, one of whom attends school. He is a farmer in GLAHOUNSA village in the Ouémé valley and is a member of the HOUEDOME group GH MISSIMAHOU DE GLAHOUNSA. The inhabitants of this village work the land after the fall of the level of the Ouémé river. Their land is rich and offers a high yield. Their main activity is growing corn, peppers, vegetables, okra, tomatoes and manioc. The problem for these riverside residents is that, during the flood period, they no longer have anything to do and spend all the income generated from the sale of their harvested produce. When the river level drops they do not have any money left to pay for the workforce essential for sowing the available land. The local practice of selling cheaply the harvest does not provide them with financial security and further bankrupts them. This practice involves selling the future harvest at a rock-bottom price to an affluent person in order to have the required money to continue farming. Tired of this practice, they are requesting a loan of 140 000 FCFA (USD 275) to farm about 1.5 hectares of the aforementioned land.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farming of 1.5 hectares of corn and peppers

loans.name: Marisiano

texts.en:
Marisiano K. is 32 years old and lives in Gari Village in the Rongo District of Kenya. She runs a food kiosk in the town of Migori, a business she initiated in 2008. Before starting the food kiosk, Marisiano had a vegetable stall for many years.

Currently, Marisiano sells tea, mandazi (fried dough eaten for breakfast), chapatti (a flat bread made with wheat flour similar to a tortilla in shape and size), ugali (a staple carbohydrate made of flour and water), and beef stew, among other items.

The best days for the business are market days, Mondays and Fridays, when people are passing by on their way to and from the local market. On average, Marisiano is able to make a profit of KSH 100 (approximately USD 1.33) a day. She says that she is able to make enough money to pay the household expenses of her family. Marisiano is married to a computer technician and together they have 4 children, all of whom are in school.

Marisiano is applying for a loan of KSH 11,250 (USD 150) in order to purchase food so that she may add more selections to her menu. She would like to be able to cook some dishes that are frequently requested by customers that she is currently unable to make due to lack of ingredients.

loans.use: To purchase food items for preparing dishes to sell

loans.name: Homa Sharifa Group

texts.en:
Homa is the group leader of Homa Sharifa group. There are two members in this group. They live in district 10 of Kabul Afghanistan and each of them would like to take a loan for their own business.

Homa wants to take the loan for her husband’s shop to buy leather, thread and so on for sewing shoes. Wahida wants to take a loan for her husband’s hairdressing shop to buy the needed materials. They want to improvetheir business and to have a higher monthly income to support their families in a better way.

loans.use: To buy leather, thread and other materials.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia V., 58, is presently residing in Brgy. Balintawak, Pagadian City, Zamboanga Del Sur.  She used to be a widow with 9 children, all of whom are married.  She got  married again to a retired teacher, with whom she has 1 child, who still studying.  Their major source of income comes from the rental of passenger motorcycl, driven by her son-in-law.

Mrs. V. also has existing sari-sari (variety) store for 30 years.  She is a member of Paglaum Cooperative for 10 months and she is already on her second loan.  She applied loan worth Php 8,000 for purchasing additional  detergent soap, powder soap, 10 cases of different soft drinks and 5 different candies for her store.  She has existing capital of P2,000, including her store inventory.  She plans to expand her business into snack vending for additional income to prepare for her daughter's college education.  Aside from that she also dreams to purchase a residential house in sub-division someday came from the profit of her business.

loans.use: to expand her sari sari (variety) store business

loans.name: Sobirboy

texts.ru: Собирбою 55 лет, он женат и имеет 5 детей. Уже много лет он занимается ремонтом велосипедов в своей мастерской недалеко от центрального рынка. У многих людей в городе и деревнях велосипед является единственным транспортным средством и поэтому у Собирбоя всегда много клиентов. Каждый день от 10 до 15 человек обращаются к нему. Для Собирбоя данная деятельность является единственным источником дохода для его семейного бюджета. Собирбой планирует обновить свои инструменты в мастерской и поэтому подал заявку на получение займа.
texts.en:
Sobirboy is 55 years old, he is married and has five children. For many years he has a business repairing bicycles in his shop not far from the central market. Many people in the city and villages use bicycles as main transportation and this is why Sobirboy always has many customers. Every day around ten to fifteen people come to his shop. For Sobirboy this business is the only source of income for his family. Sobirboy plans to buy new tools for his shop and this is why he applied for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy new tools

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Pen K. is 52 years old and a resident of Pursat Province. She currently sells Khmer cakes and raises a few pigs out of her home to make a daily revenue. Her husband Thean is 50; he helps with the responsibility of the family's expenses by making and selling charcoal. The old couple has five children; four of them are single and the other is married and lives independently. Pen K. is asking for a loan to buy a pair of buffalo to be used as transportation for her husband's business.

loans.use: To buy a pair of buffalo

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda S. J. is a 55 year-old mother of three. Her husband Jimmy is a tricycle driver (motorcycle with sidecar). She sells food in her small restaurant in the port of Lipata, Culasi, Antique, the northern port of the province. She also does buying and selling of salts in the market during market day.

She joins ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) four years ago to support her growing businesses. She applied for this loan to buy 70 sacks of salt for retail sale. She wants to purchase the salt to get a lower price from the wholesaler she is getting her stocks from in order to earn a bigger income. She will use some of her loan to finance her restaurant. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand her business and build a better house for the family.

loans.use: To buy sacks of salt for resale

loans.name: Mateus

texts.pt:
Mateus nasceu em inhambane tem 33 anos de idade, vive maritalmente estudou ate a 7 classe e teve que interroper devido a guerra. E pai de 5 filhos com idades cooprieendidas entre os 5 aos 15 anos de idade os quatro mais velhos e que vao a escola somente o mais novo e que vai ao centro infantil.
 
Mateus sai de inhambane a namaacha uma vila a fronteira de swazilandia aprocura de emprego, apois sua chegada começa a trabalhar na vizinha swazilandia como empregado domestico durante 2 anos e teve que abandonar porque a sua residencia distava kilometros do seu serviço. De seguida consegue aranjar um emprego no hotel libombos como guarda onde trabalha a mais de 12 anos  auferindo um valor de 2.000.00mt por mes, porque o seu trabalho e nucturno de dia ele resolve praticar negocio de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade tem como melhor produto refrigerantes, bebidas ,bolos , arroz e peixe. Hoje e proprietario de tres bancas das quais  uma citada em casa, outra na shoprite e na fronteira conta com 2 trabalhadores e com ajuda da sua esposa tem tido um lucro mensal de 5.000.00mt por mês não consegue poupar nenhum valor porque o seu objectivo e expandir mais ainda o seu negocio e pra isso e necessario que ele ponha todo valor a movimentar o seu negocio. Conhece a hluvuku atraves dos seus colegas e aproxima se solicitando um emprestimo no valor de 8.000.00mt para progredir mais ainda com o negocio.

Este e o primeiro emprestimo de maa~tei~us na hluvuku e kiva estes 8.000.00mt seram usados para aumentar o volume do stock dos seus produtoas esta confiante que bai pagar sem nenhum problema e solicitar um outro para iniciar com a construçao da sua obra.
texts.en:
Mateus was born in Inhambane. He is 33 years old, married, and went to school until the 7th grade. He had to stop due to the war. He is the father of 5 children with ages between 5 and 15 years old. The 4 oldest are in school, and the youngest is in day care. Mateus left Inhambane for Namaacha, a town on the border of Swaziland, in search of work. After his arrival he began working in neighboring Swaziland as a domestic servant for 2 years. He had to quit his job because his home was kilometers from work. After that he was able to arrange a job in the Hotel Libombos as a security guard where he has worked for over 12 years earning a monthly sum of 2,000MT. Since his job is during the night during the day he resolved to do business selling staple products. His best products are sodas, beer, desserts, rice, and fish. Today he is the owner of 3 stands of which one is at home, another in the Shoprite, and one on the border. He has 2 employees, and with his wife's help he has earned a monthly sum of 5,000MT. He is not able to save any money because his objective is to further expand his business, and to do this it is necessary that he put all of his earnings toward stimulating his business. He came to know Hluvuku through one of his colleagues, and he requested a loan for 8,000MT to progress his business. This is his first loan with Hluvuku and with Kiva, and the 8,000MT will be used to increase the stock of his products. He is confident that he will pay off the loan without any problems so he can solicit another loan to begin working on his construction.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of staple products

loans.name: Afi Sénam

texts.fr:
Cette dame a ouvert une  boutique dans laquelle elle vend du matériel de bureau, elle fait aussi dans sa boutique du traitement de texte, des impressions sur papiers et la vente de matériel informatique. Elle veut commencer la vente de cartes de recharges et augmenter son stock de marchandises c’est pour cela qu’elle s’adresse à WAGES pour demander son premier crédit afin d’acheter 5 cartons de cartes de recharges et divers matériaux de bureau.
Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant.
texts.en:
This is a lady who opened a shop where she sells office supplies. There also, she offers word-processing, printing on paper, and computer supplies. She wants to start selling mobile phone recharge cards and to augment her stock of merchandise. For these reasons, she is inquiring with WAGES to ask for her first loan, in order to buy five boxes of recharge cards and various office supplies. She is married and the mother with a child.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mobile phone cards and office supplies

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: Gladis tiene 49 años, vive en una casa alquilada con su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 27 y 21 años de edad. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de zapatos de todas las tallas y para todas las edades, vende de manera ambulante en las ferias locales de su ciudad y en cualquier ocasión que se le presente. Su trabajo de comercialización lo realizan por lo general de manera ínter diaria y sus hijos la apoyan en el transporte de la mercadería y también en las ventas. Las ganancias obtenidas le dan la oportunidad de recuperar su capital de inversión y así mantener estable su negocio. Esto anima a Gladis a proyectarse a tener un puesto fijo de ventas para sus zapatos, además de también empezar a vender ropa. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está muy contenta por ser parte de su banco comunal, donde quiere continuar realizando un buen trabajo con su grupo. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de más zapatos para su próxima campaña de ventas por el día del padre.
texts.en:
Gladis is 49. She lives in a rented house with her husband and two children who are 27 and 21. For 10 years she has been selling shoes of all sizes for all ages. She sells on foot in the local fairs in her city for whatever occasion that presents itself. She generally sells every day, and her children help her transport and sell the merchandise. The money from the sales gives her the opportunity to recuperate her investment capital and keep her business stable. This encourages Gladis to plan to have a fixed place to sell her shoes. She also plans to start selling clothes. This is her third loan with MFP. She is very happy to be part of her community bank. She wants to continue doing a god job with her group. The money she is asking for will be used to buy more shoes for the next sales campaign for Father’s Day.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase materials for making clothes.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
JUANA M. D. S., pertenece  al  Banco  Comunal “LAS LIBERTADORAS” su negocio está ubicado en el Jr. Wayna Capac, tiene 52 años, 4 hijos mayores, y su esposo es pescador.

	Ella  tiene una bodega y además venD. comidas por la noches, el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos fue D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, que invirtió en compra D. algunos abarrotes, para surtir su pequeña bodega, y desD. 3 años que está trabajando con Manuela Ramos ha ido creciendo su negocio cada vez y por eso le ha sido necesario subir el monto D. sus préstamos.

Con este préstamo D. S/.1,500.00 Nuevos Soles,  invertirá en  la inicial para comprar un motocar y el resto en compras D. abarrotes para surtir su tienda.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ser una institución que sirve a la comunidad  y porque contribuye con las mujeres D. esta región.
texts.en:
Juana belongs to the "Las Libertadoras" (The Liberators) Community Bank, and her business is located on Wayna Capac street. She is a 52-year-old mother of four grown-up children, and her husband is a fisherman. She has a convenience store and also sells food in the evenings. The first loan she received from Kiva partner Manuela Ramos was for 300 soles, which she used to invest in the purchase of some groceries to stock her small store. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for the past three years and has grown her business with each credit, which is why she has had to increase the amount of her loans. With the current loan she is requesting of 1,500 soles (approximately $500), she plans to use it first to purchase a motocar and the remainder to purchase groceries to stock her store. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for being an institution that serves the community and contributes to helping the women of the region.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a motocar and grocery supplies

loans.name: San Sebastian Group

texts.es: Las socias D. este grupo D. Banco D. Emprendimiento "SAN SEBASTIAN"  esta formado por señoras que viven en un mismo Barrio y se conocen D. muchos años. Este grupo es muy antiguo estando en su 7º ciclo, como presidenta la señora Carol C. S., quien es una D. las fundadoras, dirige al grupo, tiene 4 hijos y trabaja atendiendo una pequeña pension y una tienda D. barrio y gracias al esfuerzo esta terminando D. construir su casita. Como tesorera esta la socia Primitiva G., quien es tambien  una D. las fundadoras del grupo, ella venD. velas en las distintas fechas D. fiestas religiosas, es viuda y tiene un hijo mayor. La Secretaria del grupo es la socia Casilda T., socia antigua, se dedica a la venta D. comida, es muy cumplida.
texts.en:
The San Sebastian group is comprised of women who live in the same neighborhood and have known each other for many years. This group has been around for a while and is now in its 7th loan cycle. Carol C. S., president of the group, is one of the founding members. She has 4 children and works at a small restaurant and neighborhood market. Thanks to her efforts, she is almost finished building her little house. Primitiva G., treasurer and founding member of the group, sells candles during different religious festivities. She is a widow with one grown-up son. The group secretary is Casilda T., a senior member who sells food. She is very polite.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase business capital

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina T. is from the village of Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 38 years old. Lina is married. To make a living, Lina owns and operates a 'sari-sari' (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Lina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lina is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Lina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela es socia del Banco Comunal “24 de Junio”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 17 años de edad, estado civil soltera y sin hijos Mariela estudio educación secundaria completa, vive en la Parcialidad de Alinsuyo Ilave.

Inicia su trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, con un préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra de forraje para ganado ovino y vacuno. 

Su sueño es continuar estudios superiores es por eso que quiere trabajar para ayudarse en sus estudios.

A ella le gustan las facilidades en los préstamos.

loans.use: Para la compra de forraje para ganado.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro tiene 36 años, es un joven muy trabajador y entregado al cuidado de su madre, con quien vive en su casa, tratando de ofrecerle una vida de calidad. Todos los días se levanta muy temprano con el ánimo de salir a trabajar vendiendo y comprando dólares en el distrito de Miraflores (uno de los distritos más turísticos de Lima), pero lo que le diferencia de los demás cambistas es la alegría con que atiende a las personas y sobre todo la seguridad que les brinda. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce personas muy importantes, como dueños o gerentes de empresas que transitan por el lugar, haciéndose conocido entre ellos. En los 15 años que lleva en este negocio considera que lo más difícil es lidiar con los  delincuentes, quienes están al asecho, por ello trata de ser prudente con el dinero que transporta. Para un futuro no muy lejano, Alejandro espera contar con  local seguro y estable donde pueda instalarse y atienda mejor a sus clientes
Este  es su préstamo 18 con Microfinanzas PRISMA, la puntualidad en sus pagos lo ha caracterizado y en su grupo lo reconocen como una persona íntegra y leal. Con los dos mil soles que viene solicitando aumentará su capital de trabajo y así tendrá la posibilidad de incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 36 years old, and a very hardworking young man, who is involved in the care of his mother. She lives in his home and he tries to provide her with a quality life. Everyday he rises very early with a will to go out and work, buying and selling dollars in the Miraflores district (one of the major tourist districts of Lima). But what differentiates him from the other exchangers is the joy with which he attends to people and, above all, the security he offers them.

In the 15 years he has been in this business he considers the most difficult aspect to be dealing with delinquents who lie in wait for him. For this reason, he tries to be prudent with the money he carries. In the near future, Alejandro hopes to have a safe and stable location where he can install himself and better attend to his customers.

This is his 18th loan with PRISMA Microfinance. Alejandro's payments have always been punctual and in his group he is recognized as a person of integrity and loyalty. This $700 will augment his working capital and thereby offer the possibility of increasing his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO INCREASE HIS WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel R., from the village of Magsaysay, Misamis, Oriental, is 38 years old and single. To make a living, Noel owns and operates a specialized retail store whose primary income is derived from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Noel has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Noel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase new items to expand product offerings, he is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to further expand product offerings. This loan will be Noel's second from HSPFI, and he plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa D., 46, is from the village of Casusan. She is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Josefa owns and operates a coconut buying business and operated a specialized retail store. She has been in her business for over six years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Josefa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Josefa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second taken out by Josefa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to support her family members. 
----------------
About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Enoe De La Concepcion

texts.es: Doña Enoe Hernández es una mujer dedicada a la agricultura, sus padres heredaron unas manzana de tierra lo cual se ha dedicado al cultivo de piña ya que estas tierra son buenas una de las dificultad que se le presenta es que cuando sale la producción no puede trasladarle al mercado ya que los caminos están muy deteriorado y le cuesta llevarla al mercado con mucho problemas y mas gastos. Tiene 36 años de edad, y vive junto con su esposo el cual trabaja como docente en una universidad de ingeniería. Con dos hermosos hijos que cursan su primaria. Sus planes es poder mejorar su casa, apoyar a sus hijos ya que en tiempos libre me ayudan a ver la producción. Con este préstamo comprara insumos y fertilizantes para mejorar la producción de piña y poder vender a mejor precio en el mercado y poder pagar en tiempo su préstamo ya que esta contenta por que a través del crédito ha logrado invertir en su producción lo que es beneficioso para poder dar la alimentación a sus hijos y poder saldar las necesidades física de su familia.
texts.en:
Enoe Hernández, 36, is a woman dedicated to farming. Her parents left her some fields in which she has cultivated pineapples since the soil is good. One of the difficulties she faces is not being able to transport her crops to market because the roads are in very poor state and moving crops to market is very problematic and expensive. She lives with her husband, who is a professor at an engineering university, and their two beautiful childen, who are elementary school students. Her plans are to improve her home and to support her children, who help her with production in their free time. With this loan she will buy raw materials and fertilizers to improve her pineapple crop so that she can sell at market for a better price and be able to repay her loan on time. She is happy that, thanks to the credit, she has been able to invest in production which is beneficial in order to feed her children and provide for the physical needs of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials and fertilizers for a better crop.

loans.name: Johnson Hagin

texts.en:
Johnson Hagin is husband to Anne, and they have five children aged 21, 19, 17, 16, and 14. He does mobile retail selling of goods on his wheelbarrow in Kakamega town and has been in this business for the last eight years. He stocks soap, matchboxes, pens and other small household items. He also does some farming in his home area, which is on the outskirts of the town.

This is Johnson's second loan from KADET and he intends to utilize these funds in purchasing more stock of items that he has traditionally sold, and use part of it to diversifying into cereal sales. He feels this will increase his sales and profits ultimately.

Johnson aspires to open a wholesale shop in future and also to own a residential building in the town.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase more stock for his mobile retail goods sales

loans.name: Albie

texts.en: Albie A. is from the village of Looc, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 45 years old, is married, and has seven school-aged children. Albie owns and operates a food stall, selling a variety of bread and snacks in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Albie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Emmie

texts.en:
Emmie B. has a farm. She grows rice to be able to provide an adequate supply of food, clothing and other basic needs for her family. She has one child who is 16 years old now. Currently her child is studying in high school. She dreams to save money to pay for her child's college tuition and books in the future.

Now, she is asking a loan of PHP 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. The loan is truly helpful in buying farm supplies to grow the harvest.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel A. is from the village of Bayabas, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 41 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Rachel owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over eleven years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Rachel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase piglets to raise and sell. Rachel is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 13th from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
