Mary B. is single and has two children. She has no educational background herself. She sells kenkey at Elmina, which she has been doing for some time now and uses her income to pay school fees and utility bills.

To prepare her kenkey Mary buys maize from the market and soaks it in enough water to soften the maize. She washes it on the third day and sends it to the mill to be milled. She then makes a mixture of dough out of the milled wet corn, leaving it to prove (rise) on the next day. She divides the proved dough in two, uses one part for her firm half-cooked dough (she mixes it with water to get it in a porridge form and cooks it for some time to get a firm mixture or texture) and mixes the rest of the uncooked dough with the half-cooked dough. She molds the dough into balls and wraps them in corn husks. She then cooks them till they become soft enough to eat.

The photo was taken at the time the kenkey was ready for consumption and Mary was taking them out to put into another big bowl which will be sent out to where it is sold.

Kenkey can be eaten with various kinds of sauces, such as pepper sauce with fried or roasted fish, roasted chicken, roasted turkey, frog limbs, and any other kind of meat or fish.

Mary will use the loan to purchase more maize to prepare kenkey for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to complete her building.

loans.use: To purchase more maize to prepare kenkey to sell

loans.name: Rolem

texts.en:
Rolem B. is from the village of Binaliwan in Mahinog, Camiguin. She is 33 years old. Rolem is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rolem sells personal beauty products in the local community. Rolem has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Rolem joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rolem has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. Rolem is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Rolem's second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe Sabaly  sont toutes mariées. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans, 3 enfants et vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Zanfina, un des villages de Fana, préfecture de Dioila, deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes du groupe qui se sont connus à travers des liens de voisinage  font essentiellement l’achat et la vente d’articles divers tels les céréales, les condiments alimentaires et le  charbon de bois.
Après avoir correctement remboursé les quatre prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe  Sabaly  sont à leur  cinquième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, une grande quantité de grains de céréales sèches (fonio, petit mil, maïs) et quelques chargements de charrettes en charbon de  bois. 
Elles s’approvisionnent essentiellement sur place auprès des producteurs et effectuent leurs ventes au marché de Fana, à domicile,  généralement au comptant, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15.000FCFA qui sera  utilisé pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group Sabaly are all married. They average 34 years of age and three children each, and they live in traditional extended families in Zanfina, a village of Fana, prefecture of Dioila, 2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali. These women of the group know one another through community ties, and they essentially buy and sell food items, such as grains and condiments, and charcoal. After having properly repaid the four previous loans, the women of the group are now on their fifth solidarity loan, which will be used for buying: a large quantity of dried grains (fonio, small millet, corn) and a few cart loads of charcoal. Supplies are gotten locally from producers. Sales are made at the Fana market and at home. Generally cash is accepted from customers composed of women and men. The group members each envision making an average monthly profit of 15,000 francs CFA that will be used to provide for the family. The rest will be invested in their businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying various items

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis, tiene 44 años, es casado y tiene dos hijos (keithe, Luis Gabriel), él pertenece al banco comunal “Sacsayhuaman” de la Asociación Arariwa, él trabajó como docente en el colegio de la “Gran Unidad Inca Garcilazo de la Vega” pero no le volvieron a contratar entonces se dedico a ser albañil  de forma independiente y como albañil trabajó restaurando y haciendo investigaciones para el “Instituto Nacional del Cultura” de la ciudad del Cusco y actualmente esta esperando que lo vuelvan a contratar para todo este año. El socio y su esposa tienen un negocio familiar, su esposa compra queso de la ciudad de Puno para vender en la ciudad del Cusco. Ella lleva insumos como maíz, papas y queso para vender en la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado. Luis requiere el préstamo para invertir en el negocio familiar, él con una parte va comprar queso y con la otra parte es para pagar el transporte. Luis su  anhelo es comprar una casa y abrir un pequeño taller de artesanía de tipo platería.  

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. En la fotografía el socio esta acompañado de su esposa Ermiña.
texts.en:
Luis is 44 years old, married, and has two children (Keithe and Luis Gabriel). He belongs to the Communal Bank “Sacsayhuaman”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. Luis worked as a high school teacher at “Gran Unidad Inca Garcilazo de la Vega”, but his contract did not get renewed so he is working independently as a mason. As a mason, he is performing restoration work and conducting research for the National Institute of Culture of Cusco and waiting to be rehired for the entire year. Luis and his wife have a family business in which she buys cheese from the city of Puno to sell in Cusco. She needs supplies such as corn, potatoes, and cheese to sell in the city of Puerto Maldonado. Luis needs a loan to invest in the family business. He will use part of the loan to buy cheese and the remainder to pay for the transportation. Luis hopes to buy a house and open a small workshop for making silver handicrafts.

He is grateful for this opportunity and commits to making his payments on time. In the photograph, Luis is accompanied by his wife Ermiña.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cheese & pay for the transportation costs

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es: Mario Alberto G. G. de 34 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Ahuachapán, lugar en el cual vive junto a su familia la cual esta conformada por su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar  junto a tres hijos de 3, 8 y 11 años de edad, de los cuales los dos mayores se dedican a estudiar. El señor Mario comercializa madera en su casa de habitación lugar en el cual vende por mayoreo su productos, repartiéndolo con los diferentes clientes, los cuales en su mayoría son clientes desde hace muchos años atrás, quienes por el excelente servicio prestado por Mario, le compran la madera. Él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar madera en mayor cantidad de manera que pueda obtenerla a precios más bajo, lo cual le permita obtener mayores ganancias. El mayor deseo de Mario es poder incrementar sus ventas, ya que es esta la única fuente de ingresos que posee para sacar adelante a su familia, quien depende por completo de él.
texts.en:
Mario Alberto G. G., 34 years of age, lives in Ahuachapán with his family that is composed of his wife, a homemaker, and three children ages 3, 8, and 11. The two oldest children are in school. Mario sells lumber from his home, where he distributes his product to customers at wholesale. He has had most of his customers for many years that, because of Mario’s excellent service, continue to purchase wood from him. He is requesting a loan to buy larger quantities of lumber to obtain the product at lower prices, and therefore augment his profits. Mario’s greatest desire is to increase his sales. This is because his business is the single source of income to support the family, as he is the sole provider in the household.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase lumber to sell.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
El señor Francisco Javier C. es padre de familia y desea lo mejor. 
A la vivienda le esta haciendo falta un cuarto al frente, ya que tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes y esta utilizando gran parte de la casa. Quieren dividir el negocio de la casa para que este mas privado. 
Solicita el préstamo para poder comprar el material que necesita para empezar la construcción del cuarto, y así podrá tener separado el negocio.
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene del negocio, los gastos familiares los cubrirá con el ingreso que obtiene de su empleo que tiene en una fabrica en el área de producción. 
La persona que aparece en la foto es su esposa la señora Mercedes Torres quien atiende el negocio. El señor Francisco Javier C. se encontraba en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco Javier C. is a family man who always wants the best. He needs to have a room built in the front part of his house because he has a small general store that is taking up the majority of the house. He would like to separate the house and the business so that his family could have more privacy.

He is requesting this loan so that he can purchase the materials he needs to start building a room and separate the business. He plans on repaying the loan with the profits earned from the business. He will cover the family expenses with the money that he obtains as a factory worker (in the production department).

The person featured in this photo is his wife, Mercedes Torres, who minds the store. Mr. C. was at work at the time that this photo was taken.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John L. is a hardworking businessman, twenty-nine years old. He is legally married and blessed with two children, both in school.

John operates a clothing business and he has run his business since 2004. He is using the loan to purchase clothes from Kampala to sell in Masaka along Engine Street. He will purchase kid’s clothes: that is to say dresses, skirts, tops, and so forth.

loans.use: To purchase more children's clothes to sell

loans.name: Lingueres Keur Madiagne 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe lingueres de keur MAD. 2 groupe de cinq (5) vendeuses de légumes et condiment d’un marché de quartier de la ville de Mbour. Le groupe crée depuis cinq (5) ans permette à ses membres de réunir chaque jour des cotisations de deux cent francs CFA qui sont versées chaque jour à un membre du groupe à tour de rôle. Cette somme est injectée dans le commerce pour renforcer le fonds de roulement du groupe. Face à l’insuffisance ses cotisations à régler leurs besoins en fonds de roulement, le groupe sollicite un prêt. La plus part des membres du groupe ont quitté leur village pour s’installer à la ville à fin d’avoir de quoi nourrir leur famille.
texts.en:
The "Lingueres Keur MaD. 2" group consists of 5 sales women who sell vegetables and condiments at the neighborhood market in the city of Mbour. Created 5 years ago this group charges its members 200 CFA francs a day as a membership fee. This money is then loaned to various members of the group. This fund is used as the working capital for the group. As there is insufficient working capital to meet the needs of the group, they have decided to make a loan. Most of the group members have moved from their village to the city to be able to feed their families.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To provide business working capital

loans.name: Chann

texts.en:
Mrs. Chann Y. is a 30-year-old married woman who lives in Choes village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice for a living, while her husband, Mr. Try Eng, is a chicken middleman who earns a small income to support the family. Her husband is in the picture with her. Mrs. Chann Y. is the mother of a child, who is the youngest person.

In order to support her husband's business, Mrs. Chann Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy 70 kg of chickens to sell.

loans.use: To buy 70 kg of chickens

loans.name: Rosalio

texts.es:
El cliente Rosalio de 44 años de edad,labora para el MINSA desde hace 22 años desempeñandose con gran responsabilidad en sus funciones diarias.

Esta solicitando su 7mo credito para comprar materiales de construccion y acondicionar mejor la cocina de su casa, construyendo pantry, poniendole el piso y otras cositas que pueda. 

Rosalio es un hombre responsable, ademas le gusta  estudiar pero por falta de tiempo no ha podido seguir estudiando ya que trabaja en turnos , es un hombre que le encanta ayudar a todos las persona enfermas que lo necesitan. Su mayor sueño es poder una vivienda bonita con las condiciones necesarias.
texts.en:
Rosalio is 44 years old. For the past 22 years, he has worked for MINSA (Ministry of Health) and has been given the great responsibility of overseeing its daily functions.

He is requesting his seventh loan to buy construction materials so that he can renovate the kitchen in his house. Rosalio plans to build a pantry, install a floor, and perform other things that are needed.

Rosalio is a responsible gentleman. He also likes to study, but due to time constraints, he is unable to continue because he works in shifts. Rosalio enjoys helping sick people who are in need. His greatest wish is to have a beautiful home with all the necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovate his kitchen

loans.name: Bisimilai Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Bisimilai” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni city, in Northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 500,000 for each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Mariatu M. K. who is pictured on the left in the back row. Mariatu was born in a place call Sandugu, Port Loko district, Northern Sierra Leone. She is age 34, married and has five children.  Her husband is a businessman and three of her children are attending school. The other two children are still not of school-going age.

For four years now, Mariatu has been selling market food – rice, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), Magi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), onion, chicken, etc. With this loan, she will expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy rice, palm-oil, Magi, onion, chicken, etc.

loans.name: Maria Haydee

texts.es: Maria Haidee tiene 1hijo que se encuentra de 9 meses pues está bajo su cuidado. Desde hace 4 años cuando empezó la venta de cosméticos, con iniciativa propia pues en la comarca donde vive no existen muchas personas que se dedica a este tipo de actividad. El avance de su negocio ha sido su desafío constante, pues vive sola y sostiene su hogar con este negocio y dinero. En la actualidad solicita un crédito que lo invertirá en la compra de lápiz, labial, perfumes, cremas tratamientos y ropa interior, que es lo que más compra su clientela. Su deseo es que  su negocio pueda crecer cada día más tener si propio local.
texts.en:
Maria Haidee has a 9 month old son in her care. Four years ago, she took the initiative to start her own business selling cosmetics since there were no other people in the area engaged in this same activity. Making progress in her business is a constant challenge since she lives alone and relies on her income to maintain her household.

At the moment, Maria is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of eye pencils, lipsticks, perfumes, crèmes, treatments, and undergarments since these items are the most requested by her customers. Her wish is to grow her business each day until she is able to have her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase eye pencils, lipsticks, perfumes, crèmes, treatments, and undergarments

loans.name: Bushura Tutungukye, Kihihi Group

texts.en:
Patrick B., aged 35, is married with a family of four children. He has been operating a retail shop from the Bushura trading center in Kihihi for over 15 years. In here, he trades in a variety of products commonly for domestic use like sugar, salt, soft drinks (sodas, water), cooking oil and much more general merchandise. He does this business alongside his other farming practices that include growing a variety of food crops in Uganda. 

His main drawback is that he has a limited variety of products in his shop that cannot satisfy the customers' demand. Therefore, Patrick is looking forward to increasing stock in his business when he gets this loan, and also expanding into a wholesale shop. This will help him earn more revenue and sustain his daily life needs and further educate his children. 

He also belongs to a group of members who insure each other in paying back the loan.

loans.use: Purchase more stock for the shop

loans.name: Musa S.

texts.en: This is 32 year-old Musa. He is single, and has no children. He has one additional dependent, his fiance, who does not stay with him.  In 2007, Musa established his satellite cinema sport and games business. He began his business because he was watching games from other people's cinemas, then began his own.  He raised the initial capital and he started showing games. Working 4 days a week and 4 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,932,400 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000.  Musa requires a loan in order to buy a smart card and a dish decoder full set.  He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 386,480.  In the future, Musa plans to complete his university course and to get married, and also to increase his profit margin. Weather often disturbs satellite transmission but they can overcome after the rains.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy a smart card and a dish decoder

loans.name: Yusifu S.

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Yusifu, who is married and has two children aged 7 and 10 years. He has one additional dependent who lives with him because Yusifu wants to educate her.

In 2000, Yusifu started his business in ready-made items such as shoes, bags and clothes. He began his business when he was financed by his elder brother, to enable him to cater for his family. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, he earns about 733,700 SLL every month from his business.

Yusifu would like a loan of 4,000,000 SLL to increase his stock. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 600,000 SLL.

In the future, Yusifu plans to start saving to educate his child to university level, to rent a shop and to supply colleagues in business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more shoes, bags, clothes, etc., for his stall

loans.name: Nelson Antonio

texts.es: El señor Nelson tiene 29 años. Posee su negocio que es la venta de artesanía los cuales sale a vender a los diferentes departamentos, este negocio lo inicio por sus padres quienes le enseñaron este medio de vida que para él es muy importante. El desafío que enfrenta actualmente es trasladar sus diferentes productos a los buses pues todos los días los carga para mostrarlo, pero siempre está buscando la forma de salir adelante. Este crédito que solicita es para la compra de materia prima que necesita para la elaboración de sus diferentes artesanías. Su sueño consiste en realizar la compra de un medio de transporte que le permita distribuir sus diferentes productos.
texts.en: Nelson is 29 years old. He has a business selling artisan crafts, which he goes out to sell in different departments. He started this business because of his parents who taught him this way of life, which for him is very important. The challenge that he faces right now is transporting his different products to the buses since everyday he loads them to show them. He is always looking for a way to get ahead. He has asked for this loan to buy raw materials that he needs to make his different artisan crafts. His dream is to purchase a means of transportation which will allow him to distribute his different products.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Yuliya

texts.en:
Yuliya is married with a teenage son Alexander. She is a farming entrepreneur from Kamenka where she grows early spring vegetables, i.e. tomatoes, radishes, etc. Yuliya owns two spacious arch greenhouses. She has been in the farming business for 15 years. Currently she has already invested about 40,000 Grivnyas in this business. The annual cost of seeds and polyethylene film amounts to 5,000-7,000 Grivnyas.  

Yuliya is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to finish construction of the third greenhouse and purchase quality polyethylene film for it. Yuliya is hoping to grow tomatoes in the new greenhouse. Yuliya loves what she is doing and is looking forward to the future. She is grateful for the opportunity this business has given, not only to provide for herself but also to help her family.

loans.use: To finish construction of a new greenhouse & purchase polyethylene film for it

loans.name: Cruz Alexandra

texts.es:
Cruz de 47 años, vende almuezos a $ 1.50 c/u. Vive en el Suburbio de Guayaquil(zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales). 

Para ayudar con los gastos familiares ella empezó a hacer mucha comida en la cocina de su casa.  Ya tiene un año y medio vendiendo almuerzos, cada almuerzo lo vende a $ 1.50 sea cual sea el plato que venda. Tiene deferentes comidas que hace como sopas, y los segundo arroz con pollo, guatita, estofado de pollo etc. Con el préstamo quiere comprar víveres para hacer comida como arroz, bebidas y otra parte comprar cemento y pintura para readecuar el local. 

En el futuro quiere tener un restaurante bien adecuado que cumpla con las expectativas de sus clientes. Y que su familia este bien económicamente.
texts.en:
Cruz, 47, sells lunches for $1.50. She lives in the suburbs of Guayaquil (city outskirts, where most people are street vendors). 

In order to help with family expenses, she began making food in her kitchen. She has already been selling lunches for a year and a half. She sells each lunch for $1.50 a dish. She offers different foods such as soup, and second courses such as chicken and rice, guatita (a tripe stew), braised chicken, etc. With this loan, Cruz will buy groceries to provide food such as rice and drinks. She will also buy cement and paint to spruce up the premises. 

In the future, Cruz wants to have a restaurant well-suited to meet the expectations of her customers. She also wants her family to be well financially.

loans.use: Purchase rice, drinks, cement

loans.name: Emprendedoras Del Sol Group

texts.es: La foto fue tomada en la tiendad de la Señora Leticia T. H. Una integrante del grupo Emprendedoras del sol, el cual está ubicado en la comunidad de Cañada Morelos, en el Estado de Puebla en México. Se ve el grupo al que pertenece y la mercancía que vende la señora Leticia, ella se dedica a atender esta pequeña tienda de abarrotes, negocio que inició hace diez años, solicita el prestamo para la compra de abarrotes y ampliación de su negocio. Sus clientes prefieren comprar con ella por que aparte de tener buenos precios tiene la amabilidad y atención que ellos requieren. Al momento de solicitar su crédito ella se siente contenta y agradecida por la confianza que la gente deposita sobre ella y sus compañeras. Tiene cuarenta años de edad y estudio hasta el sexto año de primaria es casada y tiene cuatro hijos dos mujeres y dos varones. Dentro de sus proyectos personales ella quiere seguir apoyando a que sus hijos concluyan sus estudios.
texts.en: The photo was taken in the store belonging to Leticia, one of the members of the group Emprendedoras del Sol, which is located in the community of Cañada Morelos, in the Mexican state of Puebla. The photo shows the group and the goods that Leticia sells. She runs this little grocery store and she started the business 10 years ago. She is requesting a loan to buy groceries and expand her store. Her customers prefer to buy from her because, apart from having good prices, she has the kindness and attention to their needs that they are looking for. At the moment of requesting the loan, she feels happy and grateful for the confidence that people are placing in her and her group members. She is 40 years old and completed the sixth grade of primary school. She is married and has 4 children, 2 female and 2 male. Through her personal projects, she wants to keep supporting her children so that they can complete their studies.

loans.use: To buy groceries and expand the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: This member is taking out a loan to buy whole-sale fruit.

loans.name: Lubugumu Twekembe-Mukono Group

texts.en:
42-year-old, affable B. Florence operates a pharmacy in Namayuba-Mukono. This business has been in existence for a decade now. Her experience, training and later employment as a nurse have been instrumental in the smooth running and overseeing of operations at her pharmacy. From the point of view of the right prescription of drugs for  patients and advice, she has been up to the mark. 

The aforementioned combined with diligence, proper planning and her good-natured personal qualities have been her stars and stripes. Florence, who is single but with 5 kids, says weekly this business generates her  300,000 shillings. Florence carries the conviction that with this loan, her financial prospects will continue to get better. With this loan, she says she is going to expand her business.

loans.use: The expansion of her pharmacy business

loans.name: Sebastian Pantaleon

texts.es:
Don Sebastian de 48 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa doña Sonia Urbina Fernandez, que es ama de casa, con quien tiene un hijo de 4 añitos, habita en el Munucipio de Juigalpa Chontales. El sr S. ha sido un hombre esforzado que lucha a diario para darle lo mejor a su familia, es Conductor de taxi de donde recibe la mayor parte de sus ingresos, con este trabajo y apoyado con creditos de nuestra institucion ha levantado las paredes de su casa misma que quiere continuar mejorando. 

Solicita el apoyo de Kiva con Financiamiento para invertir en la construccion de un cuarto de 4mts por 3mst, repellarlo y ponerle fino.  

Lo que mas desea es que su Familia goce de buena salud que no les falte el pan de cada dia y continuar laborando.
texts.en:
Sebastian, 48, lives with his wife, Sonia Urbina Fernández, who is a housewife and with whom he has a 4 year old son, in Juigalpa, Chontales.

Mr. S. has been a man dedicated to work daily to provide the best for his family.  He’s a taxi driver which provides the bulk of his income.  With his work and support from loans form our institution he has managed to erect the walls of his house which he wants to continue to improve.  He is, therefore, asking for Kiva support with a loan to invest in the construction of a 4x3 meter room and to seal the walls and add fine touches.

What he most wants is that his family enjoys good health and that they always have bread on the table and to continue working.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Malik

texts.en: Malik is a 42 years old married man, father of 5 children. Malik manufactures car exhausts since 1999 with 21 years of experience. Malik is requesting  a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to buy the necessary products to his business. His work is unique in the region, and is requested by most car mechanics. Malik is well known with his good quality of work, he's also known with his accurate timing and client service. Malik is working hard to provide his family secure living and health. He hopes to expand and improve his business as much as he can, and keep a good base for his family.

loans.use: To Buy necessary products to his business

loans.name: Edeliza

texts.en:
Edeliza U. is from the village of Toril. She is 47 years old. Edeliza is married and has four adult children. 

To make a living, Edeliza owns and operates a hog fattening business. Edeliza has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2003, Edeliza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Edeliza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. 

Edeliza is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Abau

texts.en: Abau is currently in the business of selling tomatoes. She is 30 years old, a widow with one child who goes to school. Abau requested a loan to stock more tomatoes to sell. In the future, Abau hopes to buy a plot of land with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: stock more tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg A. lives in Gyumri city, one of the oldest and most beautiful cities of Armenia, which was affected by the devastating and destroying earthquake in 1987. People of Gyumri have been largely affected by the earthquake and most are still struggling to survive.
 
Gevorg has a long experience in trading in unmounted construction materials. He buys the old, little, dilapidated temporary huts that were given to earthquake survival citizens as temporary housing after the earthquake. His customers are happy to sell those huts to him, following their move to a new apartment.

He is married with two small children. Additional income would greatly assist the family. He has applied for the loan to be able to increase his working capital.

loans.use: additional working capital

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama W. is a very hard-working woman, striving to take care of her three children. She is divorced and does not get assistance from her ex-husband. To make sure her children get something to eat every day and can also go to school, she has two jobs. Besides selling food items, she cooks yams for sale. With the help of the money from the loan she would like to increase her stock to be able to serve more customers. She needs the income to secure the well-being of her family. (In the picture you can see Ama arranging her goods.)

loans.use: to expand the inventory of her little provisions stall.

loans.name: Leang

texts.en: Leang S., 31, resides in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. S. produces traditional baskets, earning an income of about USD 3 each per day. Her husband operates his truck to transport dirt to fill people's land, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Each month, the family spends USD 63 on food and USD 25 on the other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a motorbike for the family's use. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy steering wheel covers, oil and cleaning fluids

loans.name: Nyaka

texts.en: Nyaka J. is 22 years old. She  is currently in business selling fish. She intends to use her loan to stock more fish. She is married to a businessman and they have one baby who is not yet in school. Her future goal is to build a big house.

loans.use: to stock more fish for resale.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 50 years old, married and has five children, two of whom are in school.

Ruth is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Ruth has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional pigs and feed.

Ruth has been raising pigs for 18 years now, and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Ruth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs and feed

loans.name: Maria Virginia

texts.es:
María Virginia nació en la ciudad de Abancay (Apuricma, Perú), ella tiene 48 años está divorciada y  es padre y madre para sus tres hijos.  

María Virginia es una madre de familia que vive con sus hijos en su casa propia que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos (agua, luz y desagüe) en la ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco. Esta zona se caracteriza por su actividad comercial y el turismo.

María Virginia cuando se divorcio, ella tenia que trabajar para sacar adelante a sus hijos y por eso ahora ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza (Duphre, Avon) y es conocida por sus vecinos porque ofrece sus productos mediante catálogos. Estos productos son para que las personas mejoren su imagen personal, en especial las mujeres y con esos ingresos se ayuda para sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Ha solicitado María Virginia a la Asociación Arariwa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles para adquirir más productos de belleza y ofertarlos a sus vecinos, para obtener mayores ganancias. Con los ingresos de la venta de sus productos de belleza cubriría las cuotas del crédito brindado.

María Virginia es una persona muy conocida por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable y una buena madre al querer brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
María Virginia is a mother living with her children in her own house that has all basic utilities (water, electricity and sewage) in the city of Cusco, Cusco Department.  This zone is noted for its commercial activity and tourism.

When María Virginia divorced she needed to work to get her children ahead so she now sells beauty products (Dupree and Avon) and is known by her neighbors because she sells her items via catalogue.  These products are so that people, especially women, can improve their personal image and the income helps her support her children.

María Virginia requested a 1500 new sol loan from Asociación Arariwa to buy more beauty products to offer to her neighbors and earn higher profits.  Income from the sale of the beauty products will cover the granted loan’s repayment.

María Virginia is very well known for being a hard working, responsible woman who is a good mother who wants to provide a better future for her children improving her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to acquire more beauty products.

loans.name: Lyka

texts.en:
Lyka, 28, sells fish and vegetables. Her husband, Srin (pictured with her here), 28, is a construction worker. They have been married since 2004 and have two young daughters. The family lives along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Lyka lives with her widowed mother, sisters and brothers in the same house. She wants to live in a separate home, so she is asking for her first loan of $700 to add to her own money to build her own house to live in.

loans.use: To add to her own money to build a house to live in.

loans.name: Fotemogoban  F Group

texts.fr:
FOTEMOGOBAN F est constitué de 10 femmes toutes mariées, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34  ans,  4 enfants et  vivant dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KAPALA, un village situé à environ 17 km de la ville de SIKASSO 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur premier cycle de prêt de campagne avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire leurs besoins en moyen de production et en intrant agricole. 
Ce groupe de femme fait la culture du pois sucré, du maïs, d’arachide etc 
AFOU, qui est la présidente du groupe, la première debout avec une écharpe blanche,  compte acheter, 3 sacs d’urée et le reste comme frais de labour, de sarclage et de récolte car la récolte du pois sucré est  une activité très difficile pour les femmes. Après les récoltes les produits sont stockés pendant une certaine période avant d’être vendus à des clients venant un peu de partout de la région de Sikasso. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25 000 à 
40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
FOTEMOGOBAN F est constitué de 10 femmes toutes mariées, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34  ans,  4 enfants et  vivant dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KAPALA, un village situé à environ 17 km de la ville de SIKASSO 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur premier cycle de prêt de campagne avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire leurs besoins en moyen de production et en intrant agricole. 
Ce groupe de femme fait la culture du pois sucré, du maïs, d’arachide etc 
AFOU, qui est la présidente du groupe, la première debout avec une écharpe blanche,  compte acheter, 3 sacs d’urée et le reste comme frais de labour, de sarclage et de récolte car la récolte du pois sucré est  une activité très difficile pour les femmes. Après les récoltes les produits sont stockés pendant une certaine période avant d’être vendus à des clients venant un peu de partout de la région de Sikasso. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25 000 à 
40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants et payer les frais de labours et de récolte

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 33 years old and is a married woman with two children ages 10 and 13 years old. She is a farmer and has been growing rice for nine years.

She plans to use her loan to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and fuel for the tractor. Marites is hoping for an increased harvest and income. She also hopes for her children to someday finish college and find jobs for themselves.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and fuel for the tractor

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a blacksmith business in the Philippines for 5 years. She is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to purchase additional steel and other materials for her business.

Mary Joy earns additional income from a tricycle transport business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: To purchase additional steel and other materials

loans.name: Zenon

texts.es: Zenón tiene 31 años de edad, convive con su pareja y tienen dos hijos, Juan y Jonathan de 03 y 01 año de edad. Juntos residen en el poblado de Machente, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tiene su propia casa construida a base de madera y techo de calamina. Zenón, vive en uno de los centros poblados más competentes dentro del distrito de San Francisco, el centro poblado de Machente se caracteriza por ser una urbe de negocios por ser el eje de dos ciudades entre San Francisco y Ayacucho. Él menciona que si hay varios negocios del mismo rubro, es un negocio que funciona, desde luego que cuando abrió su restaurante, sabía lo que hacia, pero no tuvo miedo a la competencia, es mas trato de competir ante ellos y aplico la estrategia de prestar un buen servicio y comida al gusto del cliente. Ante esto, trata de mejorar continuamente en cuanto a la preparación de sus potajes y ofrecer un acogedor lugar en su local. En cuanto a su trabajo cuenta el apoyo de su pareja y a la vez tiene un ayudante quien se encarga de la limpieza. Zenon espera éste crédito, para poder comprarse mesas, sillas y adornos florales, ya que desea brindar una buena atención a sus concurrentes. Su plan a futuro es ampliar su restaurante, con la necesidad de que albergue mayor capacidad de clientela y por ende puede tener más ganancias. Este será su quinto crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y  por ello espera contar con el mismo apoyo de todos ustedes ya que gracias al apoyo de ello trata de mejorar su condición de vida. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá comprar mesas, sillas y adornos florales, para acondicionar su negocio.
texts.en: Zenon, 31, lives with a partner and has 2 children, Juan and Jonathan, who are 3 and 1 years old, respectively.  They live together in the town of Machente, located on the edge of the Peruvian rainforest, where they have built their own home out of wood and metal roofing material.  Zenon lives in one of the most accomplished towns in the San Francisco district.  The town of Machente is known as a center for business, because it is the axis between the two cities of San Francisco and Ayacucho.  Zenon mentions that if there are a number of businesses in the same line of work, it is a business that works.  Of course, when he opened his restaurant, he knew what he was doing, but he wasn't afraid of the competition.  It was more that he wanted to try to compete with them and apply a strategy to provide good service and food to the customers' liking.  Given this, he tries to continually improve in terms of the preparation of his dishes and making his restaurant a welcoming place.  In his work, he has the support of his partner and  he also has an assistant who is in charge of the cleaning.  Zenon awaits this loan, so that he can buy tables, chairs, and floral decorations, since he wants to provide good service to his guests.  In the future, he plans to expand his restaurant, and will need a bigger space to accommodate a larger number of customers and therefore have greater earnings.  This will be his 5th loan with MFP, and he has always been very punctual with his payments because he hopes to be able to rely on the same support from all of you.  Thanks to this support, he is trying to improve his living standards.  With the loan that he requests, he will be able to buy tables, chairs and floral decorations for his business.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs and floral decorations

loans.name: Assion

texts.fr:
Assion est une femme âgée de 29 ans. Elle est mariée  å un contrôleur. Elle n’a pas d’  enfants. 
Assion  travaille comme coiffeuse –esthéticienne  depuis 2007. Elle exerce son activité dans son salon. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. 
Assion  a requis son premier  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des mèches et des produits de soins d’esthétique. Elle veut pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. 
Dans les prochaines années, Assion  voudrait avoir un 2° atelier de coiffure esthétique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Assion is 29 years old and has no children. She is married to a controller. She has been a hairdresser and beautician since 2007 and works in her own salon. She buys her products in Lomé. Assion came to the microfinance institution WAGES and applied for her first loan to buy hair extensions and beauty care products. She wants to be able to provide for her family.

In a few years Assion wants to open a second salon for cosmetic hairdressing. She says that she expects to improve the living standard of her family thanks to her higher income.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions.

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
This is Yvonne, 48, a resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. A single parent and a mother to her three children, the oldest is already working while the two others are still in high school. She, together with her children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Yvonne maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Aside from this she is also selling silver and beads accessories. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 4,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a 35,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy merchandise items and products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Yvonne dreams to expand her business and hopes to have an apartment unit some day. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah has been farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 12 years. She is 50 years old and married to Mugane. They have six children who attend school.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Hannah hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is a thirty-six-year-old single mother of four children, owning a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in second-hand clothes for ten years and she started with 150,000 shillings and now has 5,500,000 shillings as her working capital. Her hardships include increased costs, high taxes and fuel prices. In spite of these challenges, her vision is a big boutique plus educating her children. Harriet needs the loan facility to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni is 32 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. She has a business of selling clothes in Buluk, South Sudan, which she has been doing for five years.

Poni is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan, which she will use to purchase more clothes for sale. She will use the extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Villa Marre

texts.en:
Villa Marre is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 9 children. 

Villa Marre has a shop that sells home made and flavored ice cream bars. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy raw ingredients for making home made ice cream. 

Villa Marre has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Villa Marre hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making home made ice cream to sell

loans.name: Triomphe De Ouanaminthe Group

texts.fr:
Dieumene est la coordonatrice de son groupe TRIOMPHE DE OUANAMINTHE

Elle n’est pas mariée elle a des enfants. Dieumene habite dans la ville de OUANAMINTHE d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.

Dieumene a dirigé son business pendant les 6 dernières années.

Elle voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l’achat du produits alimentaires. Dieumene espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business.

Les autres membres Les Triomphes ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du charbon, du riz et des vetements uses.

Dieumene rêve est l’achat d’un camion pour transporter les marchandises.
texts.en:
Dieumene is the coordinator of her group TRIOMPHE DE OUANAMINTHE. She is not married. She has children and lives in the city of OUANAMINTHE of Haiti, where electricity is rare and water is very limited. 

Dieumene has been running her business for the last six years. She would like to use this loan to invest by buying some grocery items. She hopes that this loan will help her to expand her business. 

The other members of the group need a loan for commerce, such as selling charcoal, rice, and used clothing. 

Dieumene dreams of buying a truck for transporting merchandise.

loans.use: to buy grocery items

loans.name: 03.5.89-Quảng Hưng Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phúc operates a food stall selling cake. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make cake to sell.

Phúc is 59 years old and she is married with three children. She is the leader of a four-member group, the 89 Quảng Hưng solidarity group. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

In 2007, Phúc joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Phúc has successfully repaid six loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Phúc has been involved in this business for five years.

The main hardship that Phúc faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Phúc hopes to build a new house, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make cake to sell.

loans.name: Rosario De Fatima

texts.es:
la sra. Rosario de Fátima junto a su esposo han procreado 4 hijos y se dedican a la caficultura,  contando con mas de 5 años de experiencia en el manejo de este tipo de actividad productiva,  poseen 2 manzanas de café de su propiedad y a la vez se dedican al cultivo de granos de básicos, mismos que le generan otros ingresos para cubrir los gastos del hogar.

Rosario utilizara el credito para la compra de un panel de energia solar, su comunidad esta muy retirada en la montaña y esto dificulta poder contar con energía eléctrica,  servicio que es indispensable para el desarrollo de su familia.
doña Rosario piensa seguir trabajando con prisma para mejorar su finca y optimizar una mejor producción.
texts.en:
Rosario de Fátima and her husband have had four children and they are coffee growers; they have more than five years’ experience running this type of productive activity. They have two manzanas [Central American unit of land measurement] of coffee and they also farm basic grains that generate additional household income.

Rosario will use the loan to buy a solar energy panel.  Her community is very far away in the mountains so it’s difficult to get electricity, an indispensable utility for her family’s development.  Rosario plans to continue working with Prisma to improve her farm and optimize production.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva es socia del Banco Comunal “Kapia Marca”  ubicado en el distrito,  provincia D. Yunguyo y departamento D. Puno, tiene 65 años D. edad, está casada y tiene ocho hijos independientes.

Genoveva trabaja desD. hace más D. ocho años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que incrementó al capital D. su negocio, ella se dedica a la producción  D. artesanías

La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma D. S/. 2,700.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra D. materiales para la confección D. pelucas, cabelleras para los disfraces D. morenada y diablada, también comprará matracas y cascabeles, todo para la fiesta D. Puno, en le negocio trabaja junto con sus hijos y su esposo.

La señora desea continuar en el negocio y mejorar sus ganancias.

Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es la facilidad  del préstamo.
texts.en:
Genoveva  is a member of the “Kapia Marca”  communal bank, located in the district and province of Yunguyo, in Puno department. She is 65, married, and has eight children who are independent. 

Genoveva has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for more than eight years. Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, which increased the working capital of her business. She makes handicrafts. 

She will apply for a new loan for the sum of 2,700 nuevos soles, to buy materials for making wigs and hair for the costumes used in the Morenada and Diablada dances. She will also buy rattles and little bells; all for the Puno festival. 

Her husband and children work with her in the business. She wishes to continue in the business, and improve her earnings. 

What she likes best about her communal bank are the easy loan terms.

loans.use: To buy materials for making wigs and hair used for festival costumes.

loans.name: Choeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Choeun, a 38-year-old woman residing in Pouk District, Siem Reap Province, is the mother of a child enrolled in a public primary school. To earn a living, Choeun has been making bamboo baskets and other containers from her home, a skill she learned from her parents, since 2000. She sells her products to tradesmen who send them to international marketplaces.

Choeun is requesting this loan to buy a used motorcycle for her husband, an outdoor worker, who often needs to use motor-taxi services. The savings in transport fares will help improve the family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle for her husband.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has been farming in the Kitale area for 30 years with her farm producing maize and beans for the local market. She carries out her farming with the help of one farmhand and also runs a cereals retail shop in the local market.

Mary has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo in order to buy poultry birds and construct a poultry unit for her new venture. She says she wants to diversify her farming business due to the challenges of poor prices for milk and other dairy products occasioned by stiff competition in the industry.

Mary aspires to own over 2000 birds in her farm.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds and construct a poultry unit.

loans.name: Reshon

texts.en:
In 2007, ReShon was hit with economic hard times with a layoff from a previous employer, and decided to give entrepreneurship a try. She then put her passion for fashionable accessories and previous experience in online sales and e-commerce to use by starting a business. ReShon now owns Angel Handbags LLC, an online retailer for designer handbags and accessories. Her niche is in a limited number of up-and-coming designers, animal/eco friendly products, and the right combination of search optimization with shopping sites presence. 

ReShon is using this loan to purchase inventory for 2012 and invest in marketing for sales growth. Check out the website here: 

http://www.angelhandbags.com/

loans.use: To purchase inventory for the upcoming 2012 season.

loans.name: Kely

texts.es: Kely es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasun, es dueña de una Ferretería, es soltera y no tiene hijos, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 4 años, agradece a Finca Perú por todas las enseñanzas que le brindaron, aunque es joven siempre trabajo y se esforzó para poder tener todo lo que tiene, las capitaciones le ayudaron a poder formarse como empresaria, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de fierros y cemento, lo que desea es poder tener una sucursal.
texts.en: Kely is a member of the Community Bank Llamkasum, she owns a hardware shop, she is single and has no children. She has worked with Finca Peru for four years, is thankful to Finca Peru for all the coaching provided, even though she is young, she has always worked hard to get what she wants, the loans helped her to become an entrepreneur, now she wants to invest this credit in buying iron and cement, her wish is to have a franchise.

loans.use: To buy iron and cement for hardware shop

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en:
Valentine is 29 years old and married to a cobbler. She has four children, between the ages of 3 and 9, all of whom are enrolled in school. 

Valentine sells shoes and she has been running this business for the past nine years. With this loan she plans to purchase more shoes to resell. With the profits she plans to pay the school fees for her children. In the future, Valentine wants to be the sole supplier of shoes in the local markets nearby.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Linlingnon Group

texts.fr: LINLINGNON est un groupement composé de vingt personnes qui sont des amies. Étiennette, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 56 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Étiennette est une veuve et n'a pas d'enfant. Étiennette vit seule. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assumées par dame Étiennette . Pour y arriver, Étiennette  vend des noix de palme à son domicile depuis trente huit ans. Étiennette vend également de l'huile de palme et prépare du gari (farine de manioc) qu'elle revend par la suite.Étiennette s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Étiennette sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe LINLINGNON un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des noix de palme, de l'huile de palme et du manioc.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 38 years old and a single mother of three children. Two are in primary school and the first born has been admitted to a teachers college. She has been very active in the group meetings and has been able to clear previous loans she received from the group.

She is a regular customer because she has borrowed a loan for four rounds and is very diligent about servicing the loans in good time. She is trusted by her group members. Nancy is a hardworking lady and has been able to meet her family needs through farming. She grows tea leaves and Napier grass which are her main source of income. She also grows food for domestic use. Nancy is employed in a local hotel where the earnings she receives have enabled her to rent a plot of land and plant tea to substitute the family income.

With the hope of securing a loan, her son will be able to join the college, thus relieving the burden from her shoulders. She believes that educating her children is an investment. Repaying of the loan in installments will enable her to maintain other activities focused on her family.

loans.use: Nancy wants to pay college fees for her son.

loans.name: Gurbat

texts.en: Gurbat is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli. He started his business five years ago selling clothing, bags and other apparel items. The business has been growing and he is requesting a loan to increase his stock.

loans.use: To increase his stock

loans.name: Tausaga

texts.en: Tausaga has been married only a few months, but neither she nor her husband have ever had steady employment.  Tausaga used an initial loan from SPBD to purchase seed and supplies to plant a vegetable and fruit garden.  She has been raising cabbages, cucumbers, peas, tomatoes and pineapples.  She hopes to grow this small farm into a reliable income stream. Tausaga has her first loan in full and on time, She is now eligible for a home improvement loan.  Tausaga lives with her husband in a small, open Samoan house.  She is very anxious to build a proper house for her future children.

loans.use: Build house for her family

loans.name: Manuela Janeth

texts.es:
Manuela is 26 years old. She is a young entrepreneur and an overachiever. She is single and attending college. She already works for a company and, recently, purchased her own home - mortgage payments are deducted from her paycheck. She began selling shoes through catalog order only two years ago to pay for college expenses. The biggest forces behind the growth of her business are enthusiasm and her will to grow.

Now she needs a $250.00 loan so that she can purchase merchandise to satisfy her clients’ demands. She commits to paying back her loan within 3 months. You could help Manuela achieve her goals. Do not let her dreams be interrupted. Thank you very much for trusting and for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer.

Manuela tiene 26 años de edad, es una joven emprendedora con grandes deseos de superación, ella es soltera, está estudiando su carrera universitaria y trabaja en una empresa, recientemente ha adquirido su casa propia, que le descuentan por nómina. Para poder cubrir los gastos de sus estudios inició con la venta de calzado por catálogo hace dos años, el entusiasmo y las ganas que tiene de salir adelante han sido el impulso más grande que tiene para hacer crecer su negocio.

Ahora Manuela necesita de un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder surtir los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. Forma parte de los logros de Manuela, no permitas que sus sueños se vean interrumpidos, muchas gracias por tu confianza y ayuda.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in new products to sell

loans.name: Saipolua

texts.en: Saipolua is the oldest member of Malie Centre.  She is 70 years of age, and a widow with 6 children and 24 grandchildren.  Before her husband passed away, he loved working in their plantation. Apart from that he had a pig farm. This is something Saipolua treasured very much, when her husband died. She wants to make sure everything he sweated for is maintained. This is Saipolua's first loan with SPBD and she has so many plans of what she would like to do with the money when she receives it.  She is a very fit mother, extremely hard working, and she has always believed that hard work is the key to long life.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her barbecue business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a stock of paraffin.

loans.name: Churaboy

texts.ru:
Churaboy M. is 58 years old, married, has four children. He has been a client with Microinvest since the beginning of 2005. Sharif has been raising and fattening cattle for sale for more then 15 years. Since nowadays all the farm co-ops have been disbanded, the only farm work that earns a good income for Mr. M. is the fattening of cattle. Mr. M. has used his previous loan from Microinvest to buy calves and after fattening them for 4 month he sold them for double their purchase price. At this time he has more the eight calves on his farm. Mr. M. would like to use this new loan to increase the number of the calves he owns.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Мамарофиев Чурабой , возраст- 58 лет. Женат. Имеет 4-х детей. Клиент МЗФ «Микроинвест» -а с начала 2005 года.Откормом скота занимается более 15 лет. Так как на данное время все колхозы и совхозы расформированы единственным работой приносящий доход клиенту это откорм скота. Клиент на первый полученный доход купил молодняки и после откорма 4-х месяца продал на удвоенную сумму. Так он на данный момент имеет более 8-и молодняков. Клиент хочет получит новый займ и увеличить число молодняков.

loans.use: Purchase of calves for fattening and sale

loans.name: Brisas Del Lago Panajachel Group

texts.es:
The group “Brisas del lago Panajachel” (which in Spanish means “the Breeze from the Panajachel Lake”) is integrated by eighteen women. All the women in this group show an incredible willpower, they are cheerful and extroverted. They all work in the town of Panajachel where they bring happiness to the community whilst they work in their different activities.

The women in the group are very happy because they will receive the first loan in their lives. With it, they hope to see their businesses flourish and consequently improve their standard of living. Even though this is their first loan, all of them have ventured to ask the highest amount that can be given as an initial loan (263USD per person). They are proud of themselves because it is the first time that someone, in this case Friendship Bridge and Kiva, are betting on them and believe in their capabilities.

Most of them will use the loan to buy and then sell clothing (both new and used) at the market or in the streets. Some will use it to buy ingredients in order to prepare food that they will sell during lunch and diner time. Others will use it to buy and sell jewelry and cosmetics. Finally, one of them is a midwife and she will use the money to buy medicines.

The midwife is the town's doctor and she takes care of the deliveries, mostly those of indigenous women. Moreover, she also assists with other sicknesses.

Many of them dream of having their own shops so they don’t have to be street vendors. Others want to pay their first loan in order to show themselves that they are capable of having a good business.

They all dream of having sound businesses that will allow them to count on a steady income and of course, they all dream about the general wellbeing of their families and community.

The women of the group “Brisas del lago Panajachel” only need an initial support so they can move forward, please help them with this credit and they will not let you down. Thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Este grupo de diez y ocho señoras reflejan una fuerza de voluntad increíble, además de ser muy alegres y extrovertidas. Todas ellas trabajan en el pueblo de Panajachel alegrando a la comunidad mientras laboran en sus respectivas empresas.

Las señoras que conforman el grupo están felices porque van a recibir el primer préstamo en sus vidas, ellas tienen la esperanza de que su negocio vaya a florecer y así incrementar sus estándares de vida. A pesar de que este es su primer préstamo, todas las integrantes se van a aventurar a pedir la cantidad más alta que se puede otorgar en un crédito inicial: US$263. Ellas están orgullosas de si mismas ya que por primera vez alguien, Friendship Bridge y Kiva, está apostando por ellas y creen en sus capacidades.

La mayoría van a pedir préstamos para la compra y venta de ropa nueva y usada en el mercado o de manera ambulante. Otras van a pedir para comprar insumos para la venta de almuerzos y comidas. También, hay clientas que venden joyería y cosméticos. Finalmente, en el grupo hay una comadrona que va a utilizar su préstamo para comprar medicinas. La comadrona es la doctora del pueblo que se encarga de los partos de las mujeres indígenas en este caso. Además de asistir con otro tipo de enfermedades.

Muchas de ellas sueñan con tener un local propio ya que venden sus productos como ambulantes. Otras quieren pagar su primer préstamo para poder demostrarse a si mismas que son capaces de tener un buen negocio. También sueñan con tener un negocio estable a lo largo del tiempo para que puedan contar con un ingreso estable. Por supuesto sueñan con tener un bienestar general para su familia y su comunidad.

Las brisas del lago de Panajachel solo necesitan un apoyo inicial para poder salir adelante, apóyenlas con esté crédito y ellas no les fallaran. Gracias

loans.use: The loans will be used in different ways: to buy ingredients to cook and sell food for lunch and dinner, to buy and sell jewelry and cosmetics, to buy and sell used clothing at the market or in the streets and to buy medicine

loans.name: Vidalina's Group

texts.en:
Vidalina, Maximina, and Gladis have belonged to the community bank “Virgen D. Cocharcas” for nine, three, and six years respectively. They say they joined the community bank because they felt like the leaders had confidence in them. Since joining the community bank they have learned the importance of saving and self-esteem.

Vidalina is 53 years old. She is married and has two children. Vidalina was scared when she joined the community bank, and almost withdrew just a few months after joining. Nine years later she feels much more confident and happy that she has continued to ba a member. Vidalina is an artisan weaver who makes beautiful blankets and other products. She has been weaving for over twenty-five years.

Maximina is 48 years old. She is single and has one child. Maximina raises pigs and has recently started raising guinea pigs, which are considered a delicacy in Peru. She has been raising animals for two years, before that she sold emoliente, which is a warm beverage maD. from local herbs and seeds.

Gladis is 40 years old. She is a widow and has three children aged 20, 18, and 4. Gladis sells coca leaves, which are used for medicinal purposes and to make a delicious tea. Gladis travels to the jungle region to buy the coca leaves and then sells them all around the region of Ayacucho.

Vidalina, Maximina, and Gladis need loans of 1400, 600, and 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy wool, thread, guinea pig food, and to make basic home improvements.

Their dreams are to start exporting products internationally, to have security old age, and that their children will finish their education.

loans.use: To buy wool, thread, guinea pig food, and to make basic home improvements.

loans.name: Marisel

texts.es:
Marisel M. is a very hard working woman who is originally from the county of Achuapa, in the city of Leon, in Nicaragua. She has been a farmer there for many years, and she has her own farmyard in her house. Her young son is very proud to have such a hard working mother, and he has already done a lot towards becoming the best student at his school.

In order to give him a better life style, Marisel looked into ways of improving their situation, and has implemented the use of a solar panal as their community has no electricity, and has to use candles at nightime, which can be dangerous and cause accidental fires. To cancel the debt of the panal she has asked for a loan from Ceprodel as it is the only way forward, and would allow for good use of the panal, and give her son the necessary conditions for his intellectual development.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Marisel M. es una dama muy esforzada originaria del municipio Achuapa de la ciudad de León en Nicaragua el cual se dedica desde hace varios años al negocio de ganadería teniendo su propio corral en su casa de habitación. Su pequeño hijo se siente muy orgulloso por tener una madre muy trabajadora y ha hecho todo lo posible por ser el mejor alumno en su sección en el colegio donde estudia.

Para brindarle un mejor estilo de vida a su hijo ha buscado la manera de mejorar su situación y para ello ha implementado un panel solar ya que en su comunidad no poseen energía eléctrica con que iluminarse sino que ocupan candiles por la noche que hasta cierto punto son muy peligrosos por la exposición a incendios accidentales. Para cancelar la deuda del panel ha solicitado crédito en Ceprodel con el único fin de liberar esa deuda y así darle el uso adecuado al panel para continuar proporcionándole las condiciones necesarias a su hijo para que se desarrolle intelectualmente.

loans.use: To pay for a home solar panal/Pago de panel solar para vivienda

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia has had her seamstress business for 6 years. She is 35 years old, married, with two beautiful children ages 16 and 13 who study in school, and her husband is a healthcare aide and he helps with the household expenses. The loan Patricia wants will be used to buy an overlock sewing machine which will allow her improve her product by using the machine to finish her work professionally, resulting in more sales and better working conditions in her shop and being able to support herself.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Patricia es una Sra. que ha logrado tener un taller de costura este negocio lo inicio hace seis años, tiene 35 años de edad, casada con 2 hermosos hijos de 16 y 13 años estudiantes, su esposo es auxiliar de enfermería y ayuda con los gastos. El préstamo lo quiere para comprar una maquina Overlock y así mejorar los acabados de los productos para lograr mas ventas y las condiciones en el taller como en su propia economía.

loans.use: buy an overlock sewing machine

loans.name: Rashidan

texts.en: Rashidan Baji is the wife of K. M. and has been living in a city called Riwind in Pakistan for the last 30 years. Rashidan Baji has a milk business. She has two buffaloes. Her husband sells the milk in a shop and earns a profit. Rashidan Baji and her husband are not educated, but they strive for their children and for their education. Her children are settled in their desired work now. She is applying for a loan to buy a buffalo and sell their milk in a market.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.es: Hola mi nombre es Elizabeth R. H. tengo 29 años de edad, estoy casada y tengo dos hermosos hijos que actualmente estan en la escuela en 2do y 5to grado. , recido en esta comunidad hace unos 9 años. mi nogocio se encuentra en un lugar estrategico para la venta porque estoy muy cerca del centro de educacion basico de Danli, en este momento estoy solicitando ayuda para poder abastecerme de lo necesario para la elaboracion de pan y nacatamales, necesito el dinero para tener mayores ganancias y poder alimentar mi familia que es lo mas importante para mi.

loans.use: compra de carnes, verduras, maiz, leña, condimentos, harina, huevos y azucar

loans.name: Habohon

texts.ru:
Habohon A. lives in the Shahrinav region. She is 45 yeas old, is married and has 4 children. Habohon is a nurse by profession, but since nursing salaries are very small, she purchases and sells vegetables. She has a sales location at the market and has been in this business for 27 years. She purchases vegetables from peasants and resells them at retail prices.

Habohon would like to increase her product assortment. To do this she has applied for a 12 month loan.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Абдулоева Хабохон жительница района Шахринав.Возраст 45 лет , замужем ,имеет 4 детей.По образованию медицинская сестра. Но так как заработная плата очень маленькая ,клиентка занимается куплей продажей овощей .Она имеет торговую точку на рынке .Занимается этим видом деятельности более 27 лет . Она скупает у крестьян овощи и риелизует в розницу. В данныей момент клиентка хочет увеличить ассортимент торговой точки.Но для этого ей нужны деньги .Поэтому она решила взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase product assortment

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en: Hadija A. is a Tanzanian businesswoman who makes a living selling traditional clothing known locA. as Kanga and Vitenge. She buys wholesale and sells to her customers in a local shopping center and in the Buguruni business market. Her dream is to open and run a real store. She requests a loan of  $325 to buy new supplies and expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Primavera.

Rosa es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 3 hijos, Rosa viaja 2 veces por semana a la feria del distrito de Chiara en donde vende abarrotes, además Rosa vende ropa a pedido que ofrece a amigos, familiares, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima a donde viaja 2 veces por mes, sus ventas son al crédito y cobra semanalmente. También Rosa vende cosméticos por catalogo.

Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa para niños, polos. Los sueños de Rosa son tener un local propio donde venda sus productos, construir su casa y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank 'Primavera' (Spring).

Rosa lives with her partner, she's 27 years old and has 3 kids. Rosa travels to the market in the district of Chiara twice a week, where she sells groceries. Rosa also sells clothes according to demands from her friends and family members, and she gets her products in the city of Lima which she travels to twice a month. Her sales are on credit and she charges weekly. Rosa also sells cosmetics from catalogs.

Rosa needs a loan of 1000 soles; money that will be invested in buying kid's clothing and polo shirts. Rosa's dream is to have her own store where she can sell her products, to build a house, and give her kids a good education.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rosa needs a loan of 1000 soles; money that she will invest in buying kid's clothing and polo shirts/Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa para niños, polos.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en: Rabia is 32 years old and lives in the Northern Lebanese city of Tripoli with his parents. He works as a barber and has requested a loan of $1000 in order to redecorate his salon and purchase several new clippers and hair-cutting tools for the business. This will be Rabia's second loan. He is very grateful for the opportunity provided to him by the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new hair-cutting tools and redesign his barbershop

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị M. là một phụ nữ không gặp nhiều may mắn trong cuộc sống  do chồng chị  không may mất sớm một mình chị phải nỗ lực để nuôi hai con còn nhỏ. Chị M. tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Ban đầu chị vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi nhằm tăng  thu nhập cho gia đình nhưng sau đó nhận thấy công việc chăn nuôi đem lại hiệu quả kinh tế không cao nên chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn để đầu tư vào kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá. Hiện nay với mức thu nhập 2000.000đ đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị.     
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay thêm 9.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn mua thêm một số mặt hàng phục vụ ngày càng tốt hơn nhu cầu của bà con địa phương và từ đó tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình
texts.en:
Chị M. is a woman that has experienced many hardships. Because her husband passed at an early age, she has had to work as a single parent to care for her two young children. Chị M. has participated in the TYM Fund since 2003. In the beginning, she borrowed capital for rearing livestock to produce income for the family but after a while, she realized that the business did not help them bring in much income.
