Mwanakombo is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a clothing business, selling swimming costumes and khangas (traditional colorful fabric worn as a wrap) along the beach showers to tourists. In addition she also has a table mat weaving business which contributes another source of income. She faces the major challenge of seasonality. During the cold winter season the availability of tourists at the beach is lower, providing less sales volume. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a boutique shop in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to access funds to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Rebeca Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VILCANOTA”; este banco comunal pertenece al Distrito D. Urubamba, provincia D. Urubamba y Departamento D. Cusco.

La socia Rebeca;  tiene 68 años D. edad  y es casada la socia tiene 2 hijos;  La socia es docente D. profesión ahora ella es cesante y se dedica a alas manualidades, la socia pinta y realiza diferentes bellos trabajos con un arte muy fino; la socia también  realiza cerámica en frio, cose manteles, borda y pinta ; La socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. materiales para la elaboración D. sus manualidades. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. manualidades como hilos D. bordar, cerámica en frio la maza, botones, crochet, pinturas para telas. 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo que se le otorgara para poder mejorar su calidad D. vida y la D. su familia.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “Vilcanota” comunal bank. The bank is located in the Urubamba district of of the Urubamba province, department of Cusco.

The member, Rebeca, is 68 years old and is married. She has two children. She is a former teacher by profession and now she makes her living at handicrafts. She paints and creates different kinds of beautiful works with precise artistry. She also makes non-fired ceramics, sews tablecloths, embroiders and paints. She needs a loan to invest in the purchase of handicrafts like embroidery thread, clay for non-fired ceramics, buttons, crochet and fabric paints. 

She appreciates and values the loan she will be given to be able to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase handicrafts such as embroidery thread, clay for non-fired ceramics, buttons, crochet and fabric paint.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past one year, she has operated a beauty salon. Her potential customers are the local residents. She faces a major challenge of fluctuation in commodities. She dreams of establishing another business in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase hair chemicals, weaves, braids, shampoo and conditioner. She decided to Join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase hair chemicals, weaves, braids, shampoo and conditioner.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana, age 46, operates a buy-and-sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and resells it at a small profit. Her products are shoes, slippers, sandals, and kitchenware. She earns about PHP 5,000 in sales monthly. She has to work hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

The entire family helps each other to manage their household while operating the business. Due to the high cost of basic commodities and the expense of daily allowances for her three children who are still studying, she is requesting a PHP 23,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more shoes, slippers and different kinds of kitchenware. She believes that through her patience in managing her retail shop business, she can generate a bigger income. She hopes that she can support her children until they finish their college level of education.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of shoes, slippers and kitchenware for her retail shop

loans.name: Vaanchigragchaa

texts.en:
Vaanchigragchaa is 59 years old and lives with his wife in a house in Hentii province of Mongolia. His wife helps him to manage the family business and also their children's businesses by selling spare parts while others are away. 

Vaanchigragchaa started his business in 2003 by selling  spare parts for Russian cars. He has many years of business and practical experience. He also has created a regular client base. In other words, he has been in the transportation business for most of his lifetime. 

Currently, he transports goods to business companies. He is a diligent and hard-working man who says "I have been in the transportation business for my lifetime. I can not imagine my life without cars and trucks. For this reason, selling spare parts is very close to my interests and work." He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase spare parts.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Pilicila

texts.en: Pilicila is 60 years old, married, and has five children.  She is a hardworking business woman.  For the last five years, she has been running a grocery selling beans and potatoes to earn a living. Previously, she was a dairy farmer. In the next five years, Pilicila wants to become the supplier of potatoes in her region. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 KES, which she will use to buy potatoes and beans.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes and beans.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a mother of four grown up children. She runs a clothing sales business at a busy estate in Nairobi. She has been in this business for six years. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is financial constraints. She works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy more clothes to grow her business. In the future, she hopes to grow the business to wholesale. She also hopes to build her own business premises where she will not be paying rent. She describes herself as honest, determined, and focused.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Mahmadali

texts.ru: Махмадали  трудолюбивый и честный человек. Ему 34года у него жена и  2 детей. Махмадали занимается куплей и продажей запчастей на местном рынке. Он работает усердно, и привозить высококачественные запчасти. Он имеет много постоянных клиентов и на рынке очень большой спрос для запчастей. Более 7 лет Махмадали успешно продолжает данный бизнес и у него очень хороший опыт. Он хотел бы получить займ в размере 3000$ США для покупки высококачественных запчастей с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Mahmadali is a hardworking and honest man. He is 34 years old, he has a wife and two children. Mahmadali is in buying and selling spare parts on the local market. He works diligently and brings in high quality spare parts. He has many regular customers and there's a large demand for this type of products on the market. Mahmadali has been successfully doing this business for more than seven years and he has a very good experience. He wants to get a loan in the amount of $3,000 USD to buy high quality spare parts with the purpose of growing his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Ahlam

texts.en:
Ahlam is a  young woman who is 29 years old. She is married with two sons and two daughters. Her husband is a municipal employee with a decent salary, but he also works part time in cutting wood for sale in order to increase the family income. Ahlam wants to help her husband in purchasing a new machine for cutting wood to improve his work and increase his sales, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan from FATEN. When Ahlam gets the loan, she will be able to help her husband to purchase this wood-cutting machine, so he will improve his work, produce more wood, and increase his sales, which will increase his income and provide the family with better living conditions. Ahlam is a conservative woman, so her husband Mohammad was photographed instead in the FATEN branch.


About this loan product:
 FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase a new wood-cutting machine.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en: Dina is a married woman with seven children. Dina is 44 years old and resides at Cabgan, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Dina is operating a fishing business, selling seafood products such as crabs, fish and shrimp in the local community to earn a living. She's been in this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 8,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase raw materials for the business. Dina has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Dina wants to expand and improve her business and to finish the studies of her children.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for the business

loans.name: Fausto

texts.es:
el sr. Fausto tiene 59 años de edad,  esta casado y se dedica a la caficultura, cuenta con más de 6 años de experiencia en el manejo de la tierra, posee media manzana de café,  junto con sus hijos se dedican a la agricultura,  lo que le genera otros ingresos para cubrir los gastos del hogar.

Fausto utilizara el credito para la compra de un panel solar, no cuentan con el servicio de energía eléctrica en su comunidad, gracias a este sistema podra iluminarse y tener entretenimeinto para su familia.
ya no utilizaran mas los candiles para alumbrarse, tendran mas tiempo por las noches para realizar actividades cotidianas y para la educación de sus hijos, podran hacer sus tareas por las noches.
texts.en:
Fausto, 59, is married and is a coffee grower.  He has more than 6 years’ experience working the soil; he has ½-manzana [Central American unit of land measurement] of coffee.  He farms together with his children which generates other income to cover household expenses.

Fausto will use the loan to buy a solar panel.  They do not have electricity in his community and thanks to this system he will be able to have illumination and entertainment for his family.  They will no longer use candles for light and will have time at night to do daily chores and for the education of his children; they will be able to do their homework at night.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: El señor Víctor, es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa e hijos , don Víctor labora como guarda de seguridad en una empresa privada , pero también tiene un pequeño negocio de ropa y  zapatos  de segunda ya que la situación económica está muy dura y no le ajusta su salario para los gatos de la vivienda ; ya que tiene un proyecto en su vida como es iniciar a construir un cuarto para gozar de mas privacidad ya que donde habitan actualmente es muy pequeño .Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atraves de fondo Kiva para mejorar sus condiciones de vida , siendo una persona muy bajos recursos pero con grades deseos de superación .
texts.en:
Señor Víctor lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe with his wife and children. Don Victor works as security guard at a private company but he also has a small business selling used clothing and shoes as the economic situation is very difficult and his salary doesn't cover the household expenses; he has a life project which is to start building a room so as to have more privacy as where they are currently living is very small. He is grateful to Afodenic through Kiva for the support given him to improve their living conditions as he is a person of small means but with a strong desire to excel.

.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Mayuge Group

texts.en:
Winfrida is the facilitator of the Mayuge group. Winfrida and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Winfrida takes care of two children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Winfrida had a very good maize yield harvesting eight bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Winfrida was only able to harvest two bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Winfrida and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Winfrida will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Mayuge group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Winfrida is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Provincia de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 6 filhos dos quais 4 ainda frequentam a Escola. Fez 4ªclasse e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos seus pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

É comerciante ha mais de 10 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 6.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 16.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (bebidas alcoolicas, carnes e refrescos) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. O primeiro emprestimo foi de 10.000.00mt, para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir  a sua casa e mobilar, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the district of Boane, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. She is single and has six children, four of which still attend school. She completed 4th grade and stopped because her parents lacked financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and does not support anyone else.
She has been in retail for over ten years and earns an income of about 6.000mt a month. She uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in her bank account.
She has never had loans in other banks. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her second loan with Hluvuku. It is for 16.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase goods such as alcoholic beverages, meat and refreshments in order to increase the quantity of her merchandise. The first loan was for 10.000mt, for the same purpose.
She pledges to repay as scheduled. In the future she plans to finish building and furnishing her house. For that reason she intends to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase goods for selling (alcoholic beverages, meat and refreshments).

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
Evangelina nació en la provincia de Urubamba pues  vive en el poblado de Rumichaca Baja. (La provincia de Urubamba está ubicada al norte de la ciudad del Cusco, a orillas del río Vilcanota, en una zona que se conoce como el “Valle Sagrado” debido a su clima templado, tierra  fértil y abundantes riachuelos, que hacen de este valle uno de los más bellos del planeta.).

Evangelina tiene 48 años edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos, ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia, ella tiene dos actividades económicas la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores como pollos. Ya son cuatro años que se dedica a la venta de pollos y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar pollos. 

Evangelina es integrante del banco comunal “Nueva Vision de Rumichaca”. Este  grupo está conformado con 19 socios que viven  en la provincia de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Evangelina was born in Urubamba Province.  She lives in the Rumichaca Baja neighborhood.  (Urubamba Province is located to the north of the city of Cusco, on the shores of Vilcanota River.  The area is known as “Valle Sagrado” (Sacred Valley) for its mild climate, fertile land and abundant streams that make this valley one of the most beautiful on the planet.)

Evangelina is 48 years old and with her partner has three children.  She is an enterprising and hardworking woman who keeps her family moving forward.  She has two businesses- agriculture and raising small animals like chickens.  She has made her living selling chickens for four years already, and it is been going very well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.  At this point, Evangelina is requesting the loan to purchase chickens.

Evangelina is a member of the communal bank “Nueva Vision de Rumichaca” (New vision of Rumichaca).  This group is made up of 19 members who live in Urubamba Province.

loans.use: to purchase chickens.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es: Felicita es socia del Banco Comunal Imperio, tiene 53 años, ella tiene una tienda de maquinarias pesadas, es madre de 5 hijos, es viuda. Desde que entro a Finca Perú su vida ha cambiado por todas las cosas que pudo aprender, para su negocio como para su hogar , con mucho esfuerzo pudo sacar adelante a su familia, las capacitaciones que recibió en su Banco Comunal le ayudaron mucho a todo lo que ha podido lograr, da gracias porque le ayudaron cuando ella mas lo necesitaba, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de taladros.
texts.en: Felicita is a member of the Imperio Communal Bank. She is 53 years old and owns a store that sells heavy machinery. She is a widowed mother of five. Since she became a part of Finca Perú, her life has changed because of all the things she has learned both for her business and for her home. With great effort, she has been able to help her family get ahead. The training that she has received from her bank has helped her achieve a lot, and she is grateful because the group helped her when she needed it most. Now she will invest this loan in purchasing drills.

loans.use: to purchase drills.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a 28-year-old single business lady. She lives in the Mombasa area in Kenya. She started buying and selling ready-made clothes six months ago, and the business has been catching up. She knew Milango through friends and she decided to join so that she can be able to save and access funding for her business. Now she seeks a loan to buy more clothes for sale. She hopes that in five years time, the business will have grown into a whole business and she will be able concentrate on it fully. The challenge in the business is the competition. The extra income that she will raise will improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is 48 years old and married with four children, all of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She has run a medicine shop  in the South Sudan for the past six years.

Phoebe has received a SSP 4,500 loan through WOYE MFI to purchase additional medicine items.

loans.use: to buy medicine for her shop

loans.name: Jesulome 2 Group

texts.fr: JESULOME 2 est un groupement composé de vingt personnes qui sont résident dans un même village. Solange, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Solange est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Valentin. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge.Solange vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assumées par le couple. Pour y arriver, Solange des condiments et du maïs de façon secondaire depuis sept ans. Solange s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Solange sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESULOME 2 un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des condiments et du maïs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on the stock to meet customers demand.

loans.name: Eldaniz

texts.en: Eldaniz is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli region, settled in Sumgait city. This 30-year-old man has been engaged in his business for 7 years. Eldaniz sells clothes. He supports his family with this business. Now he needs a loan amount of $1200 to increase range of goods.

loans.use: To increase range of goods

loans.name: Ulufale

texts.en: Ulufale is 32 years old and is married with five children.  Her husband passed away two years ago, leaving her alone to raise and support her children.  Ulufale fell very ill after her husband’s passing, and she was in the hospital for three months.  Her children dropped out of school and began working on the taro plantation.  When Ulufale was well enough to leave the hospital, she found so much joy and hope in her children’s strength and she vowed to go on with her life and put the past firmly behind her.  Her resolve to gain financial security was strengthened by this experience, and she now works on her plantation daily and is taking out a loan to purchase some fertilizer and to pay the school fees necessary to get her children back in school.  Her hope is that she can save enough money to take her family overseas, as she wants to ensure that her children have lives full of opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for taro plantation and children’s school fees

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.es:
Business Description

Ms. Alexandra began her business four years ago, selling her products as a traveling saleswoman. She travelled between different sectors of her city, but decided in the end to place her business in her home. She sells basic needs items, and her sales increase evey day.

Loan Use

She is confident that this loan will allow her to purchase more merchandise for her store. With her customers continuning to ask for new products, she needs to stock a variety of items in order to satisfy the demand so that her customers don't take their business elsewhere.

Personal Information

She is 44 years old, her home is made of cement and her goal is to have a larger store within her home so that she can better tend to her customers, but this has been difficult as she has not had the capital to invest.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Descripción del Negocio

La Señora Alexandra empezó su negocio hace 4 años con un capital producto de venta de mercadería ambulante, ella recorría diferentes lugares de la ciudad pero decidió ponerse una tienda en su propia casa, vende productos de primera necesidad y su actividad en cuanto a las ventas han aumentado cada día mas

Uso del Préstamo

Ella confía en el préstamo que se le entregue para de esta manera poder comprar mas mercadería para su tienda ya que los clientes cada día hacen nuevos pedidos, pues quiere tener variedad de productos para que así sus clientes no tengan que comprar en otros lugares.

Información Personal

Tiene 44 años y un hijo, su vivienda es de cemento, sus metas siempre es tener un local grande en su casa para de esta manera poder atender la necesidad de sus clientes pero le ha sido difícil ya que no cuenta con el capital necesario.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en: Ramil Q. is a 22-year-old trader who has his own food market in the part of Bilasuvar region of southern Azerbaijan. Ramil is an internally displaced person who fled to Bilasuvar from Nagorniy Karabakh during the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993. Ramil has three years of experience in trading. In his small market he sells food, beverages, cigarettes and toiletry. Ramil lives with his old parents and his market is the only source of revenue in his family.  Ramil is satisfied with his revenue in the market but he thinks he could earn much more by  offering more goods to sell. He applied for 1200 USD to expand his business.  He plans to pay the loan back in 18 months.

loans.use: Going to improve his store conditions

loans.name: Ni Wayan Palem

texts.id:
The prolonging economic crisis has been causing the price hike on many products, including animal feed. Ni Wayan Palem, who has been doing pig farming for a long time, at times was unsure about its sustainability and almost gave up. His husband's income as a farmer was very minimal and seasonal. She tried many different jobs to make ends meet. In this tough situation she is determined to stick with pig farming. DINARI is her hope to help with her problem with animal feed's cost. She hopes to use the loan to purchase the animal feed as well as to purchase more hogs. She hopes to expand her pig farming business. The profit from her business will be used to cover her family's basic needs and for her two children's education.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To purchase animal feed and more sows.

loans.name: Kato

texts.en:
Kato sells fish which are caught in Lake Victoria. Lake Victoria is the second largest fresh water lake in the world and is just 20km from downtown Kampala. The major fish are the Nile Perch and Talapia. Talapia are native and the perch were introduced. 
Kato gets her fish from the fisherman. The fish are already smoked, dried and salted. Since there is no refrigeration, this is the only way to sell this product in the villages. Usually these fish are then steamed or stewed in a broth and are eaten in a hearty soup and is very tasty. 
Kato also sells a very small fish, about the size of a minnow. These are also dried by skewing about a dozen of them on a thin stick and left out to dry. They are sold by the stick and are used in a mix with g-nuts to make a delightful, high-calorie paste treat often spread on matooke. Children love it.
Kato has been buying fish from the fisherman for 20 years and has a very established clientele that purchases their fish from her. She will use her loan to buy more fish so she can supply more customers and to pay for transport of the fish.

loans.use: To buy more fish from the fisherman and to pay for transportation from Lake Victoria to her market.

loans.name: Lurdes Jeremias Q.

texts.pt:
Lurdes Jeremias Quefasse N., resident of the Infulene neighborhood, is married with five children. She is entering her first loan cycle. She will borrow 4000 meticais and pay it back in four months. She has a kiosk at her home, from which she sells oil, vinegar, eggs, flour, etc. With these funds, she will increase her amount of stock.

Translated from Portuguese by Ilse Ackerman, Kiva volunteer.

Lurdes Jeremias Quefasse N., portadora do BI nº 100318621G, Residente do bairro Infulene vive maritalmente tem 5 filhos esta no 1º ciclo vai tomar o valor de 4000 mt para pagar em 4 meses vende na sua casa tem uma barraca vende oleo , vinagre ovos farinha ovos e etc. com o valor ela vai aumentar o stock.

loans.use: increase amount of stock

loans.name: Hokim

texts.ru:
Hokim K. is 45 years old, has specialized secondary education and is an accountant by profession. He is married and has 4 children. Hokim has a small grocery store which is located in the fifth microregion of the town of Tursun-zoda. He sells mostly groceries and has been in this business for the past 3 years. He wants to use the loan to increase the assortment of his inventory. The loan will also give an opportunity for the residents of Tursun-zoda to buy the necessary groceries close to where they live.

Hokim plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Кодиров Хоким, возраст – 45 лет, образование – средне-специальное, по специальности – бухгалтер, женат, имеет 4-х детей. Хоким имеет небольшой магазин, который расположен на 5 микрорайоне в городе Турсунзаде. Основный товар, которым он торгует это продукты питания. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 3 лет. Полученный кредит он хочеи использовать на приобретение нового ассортимента продаваемого товара. Получив данный кредит он увеличит ассортимент предлагаемого товара, а жители города Турсунзаде получат возможность приобретать необходимые им продукты питания прям рядом со своими домами.

Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Don Santos is 37 years old and is originally from the community of La Borgoña - Ticuantepe. He produces pineapples and has been in this industry for 15 years. This has allowed him to maintain the life of his wife and two children who are studying in primary and grade school. His wife supports the family by helping out with household tasks, takes care of the kids and vends his products in different stores with her husband. He dedicates as much time in the production of the product. The manufacturing requires much investment at high costs. These investments include organic chemicals for the soil and plantations. Sometimes he also does other activities like bricklaying in order to gain extra income so he can pay off other expenses like daily diets, educating his kids and pay for basic services. In these times, he needs to buy fertilizer to help him develop his pineapples and his crop to be successful.

This story has been translated from Spanish to English by Nikita Ramchandani, KIVA Volunteer.

Don Santos tiene 37 años, es originario de la comunidad de La Borgoña - Ticuantepe, se dedica a producir piña, posee 15 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, la cual le ha permitido mantener a su esposa y sus 2 hijos, quienes se encuentran estudiando en primaria y secundaria, la esposa lo apoya realizando los quehaceres del hogar, cuidando de los niños y comercializa el producto en los diferentes mercados con su esposo. El señor le dedica el mayor tiempo posible al mantenimiento de la producción, el cual conlleva un proceso artesanal manufacturero que requiere de mucha inversión debido a los altos costos de los productos y químicos orgánicos que requiere el suelo y las plantaciones. En ocasiones el señor realiza otras actividades como albañilería, con el objetivo de percibir ingresos extras que le permitan subsanar todos los gastos como la alimentación diaria, educación de los hijos y pago de servicios básicos. En estos momentos el señor necesita comprar fertilizantes para que le ayude al desarrollo de las piñas y su cosecha sea todo un éxito.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer chemicals and herbicides.

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en: Lisa T. runs a pork cake business in her village of Lalovaea. She mainly supplies to nearby companies and village stores. Lisa T. is a very active woman, and is still willing to stay in the program for as long as she can live. With the financial support that SPBD have provided, it has helped her in many ways, which she is thankful for. Without this support she would never be at where she is right now. With her requested loan she plans to buy more ingredients to increase her production.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for her pork cake business

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
For the past eight years, Tatyana has operated a kiosk selling cosmetics at a market in Pavlograd, Ukraine. A hardworking mother and wife, Tatyana has successfully grown her business to establish a stable income for her family. With an enterprising spirit and rich experience in the sphere of market trade, she has worked hard to expand her business. Currently, Tatyana makes about $400 in profit each month and has about $3000 in inventory.

Tatyana is seeking a loan to purchase new merchandise. With the increased profits she hopes to continue expanding her business. Eventually Tatyana would like to open a new vending facility. This loan will benefit her business and family as Tatyana’s husband is physically challenged and the money Tatyana makes is the main income for the family.

loans.use: Purchase new inventory

loans.name: Zaituni Namusoke's Group

texts.en:
Zaituni is leader of a group with four members. She is 48 years old and married with eight children. They are between 30 and 12 years old. Two of them are in school. The community she resides and works in is semi-urban.

She buys charcoal from vendors to sell at wholesale and retail. She also makes pancakes and chapattis and fries cassava. Because she carries out her business near a school, her clients are the villagers and school children.

Her main challenges are the unstable prices and limited capital. She wants to increase her stock and to contribute to her family's welfare. Her biggest dream is to build a commercial block of rental houses to earn her more income.

Zaituni has successfully paid back more than three loans.

loans.use: To stock more charcoal and ingredients for frying snacks.

loans.name: Cinthia Lali

texts.es:
Cinthia Lali T. R. runs a profitable business selling handcrafted items in “El Centro,” a well known shopping center in the Tarapoto, in the District of San Martín. Cinthia is a member of the communal bank “Virgen de la Inmaculada” and started her business selling crocheted string bags handcrafted by her mother. When she realized that this was a good business venture, she began to add items little by little and she now sells wide variety of goods including those you see in the photo. There is a great demand for these items from tourists who come to her stall looking for handcrafted items. She now brings in items from other locations, which insures that she is selling unique handicrafts. This is how Cinthia maintains and increases the number of customers she attracts.

With this loan of 800 Nuevo Sol ($275), which she will pay off in six months, Cinthia will purchase many colors of string and different types of fabric (which she uses to make into beautiful bags). She will also buy fabric from the indigenous Shipiba tribe which is available in Iquitos. All of this will enable her to have a good selection of unique items for her customers. At her young age, Cinthia is already a determined businesswoman who wants to continue expanding her business. She is 24 years old and has a new born daughter who is her inspiration to continue to improve her situation. With entrepreneurial vision, she hopes to have her own shop and become more independent. Thanks to the support of her husband she is able to improve their lives with this business; she has no plans to stop until she realizes her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

La señora Cinthia Lali T. R., es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen de la Inmaculada” vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia de San Martín y distrito de Tarapoto, se dedica a la venta de Artesanías, ella vende en un Centro Comercial muy conocido con el nombre “El Centro” ubicado en el Jr. Moyabamba del distrito de San Martín, ya que este es un buen negocio rentable. Cinthia, se inició vendiendo bolsos de hilos que su mamá los confeccionaba donde ella se dió cuenta que era un buen negocio, y fue implementando poco a poco hasta obtener lo que tiene ahora, ella tiene una buena demanda por parte de los turistas, que llegan a su puesto buscando artesanías, ya que ella trae novedades de otros lugares y se cerciora que no se repita el Stok de los otros puestos, así es como ella mantiene e incrementa el numero de su clientes,. Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00 que será pagado en 6 cuotas mensuales, comprará: hilos de colores, telas de diferentes tipos para la elaboración de sus bolsos que ella misma los confecciona y que después serán vendidos, además comprará telas Shipiba y que no hay acá, si no en Iquitos donde abunda bastante este material, y que la gente aledaña consume, de esa manera busca tener bien surtido su negocio y así sus clientes encuentren de todo. A su corta edad ya es una mujer empresaria, decidida y con ganas de seguir trabajando ella tiene 24 años de edad y 1 hija recién nacida, quien es el estímulo para seguir trabajando y superándose cada vez mas, con visión empresarial piensa tener un local propio e independizarse en su negocio, gracias al apoyo de su pareja, ella esta saliendo adelante y no piensa darse por vencida hasta lograr sus objetivos trazado

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of fabric and string for handicrafts

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Mrs. Seng K. is a wedding chef in Preak Takeo Village in Kandal Province who very much enjoys her business of cooking delicious meals for wedding guests, while her husband, Mr. Thol Nov, is a house constructor in the  village. Although Mrs. Seng K. and her husband both have business activities, they still cannot afford to complete their new house. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to finish it. She and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To complete construction of her new house.

loans.name: Selwa's Twende Na Wakati Group

texts.en:
Selwa is 28 years old and married with a four-year-old child. She has been a juice and bites (snacks) seller since 2005. She works at her business each day, earning a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Selwa is now requesting a loan to increase her current stock. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Fatma.

loans.use: To increase current stock

loans.name: Santos Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Santos Rosa B. L., tiene treintainueve años, vive en la calle San Martín 219 en el distrito de Mache en la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió primaria completa y no siguió estudiando, porque no le gustaba estudiar, manifiesta, le gustaba más el negocio.
Se casó a los diecisiete años con Juber Aredo con el que tuvo una hija mujer y un hijo varón, los que son educados solamente por ella ya que se separó de su pareja.
Empezó su negocio con la venta de quesillo, con ayuda del primer préstamo de Manuela Ramos que fue de 300 soles compró abarrotes con lo que empezó a surtir una bodega. El préstamo lo devolvió en cuatro meses.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2000 soles, el cual cancelará en 4 meses, comprará arroz, azúcar y aceite para continuar surtiendo su tienda.
Rosa es una mujer muy valiente y emprendedora que lucha sola por la vida, enfrentando a una sociedad que no comprende el hecho de ser una madre que lucha sola para educar a dos hijos.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal Progresistas y se desempeña como secretaria.
Sueña con ir de paseo turístico a Chile.
texts.en:
Mrs. Santos Rosa B. L. is 39 years old, lives at 219 San Martín Street in the Mache district in the province of Otuzco in the department of La Libertad, Perú. She completed primary school and did not continue studying because she did not like it. She said she liked business better. When she was seventeen years old she married Juber Aredo with whom she had a daughter and a son. She has raised them alone as she is separated from her husband. She started her business selling cheese and with the help of the first loan from Manuela Ramos which was for 300 soles she bought groceries with which she started to supply a small store. She paid back this loan in four months. With this loan of S/. 2000 soles, which she will pay in 4 months, she will buy rice, sugar and oil to continue supplying her store. Rosa is a very brave and entrepreneurial woman who struggles through life alone, confronting a society that does not understand how it is to be a single mother raising two children. She belongs to the Progresistas Communal Bank and serves as the secretary. She dreams of going on a trip to Chile.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy varied products (groceries)

loans.name: Tunsume

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Tunsume F. from Mbeya. She is single with 1 child who is 3 years old. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting 2 dependents because they are schooling in the area. Tunsume has been running a used clothing business since 2006. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week, and is assisted by her children. Tunsume currently earns about $70 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to purchase additional stock of cloth. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of the business.

Tunsume thanks you for your support!

Used clothing sales business: Secondhand clothes journey across the oceans from America and Europe, and are then washed, ironed, and sold in bulk by wholesalers in Tanzania to retailers who then re-wash and re-iron them for sale on the streets and in the surrounding towns and villages. These clothes are becoming increasingly popular, especially amongst the younger generation, because of their low cost and the general appeal of anything modern.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of clothing

loans.name: Mbaye Mactar

texts.fr: Mbaye mactar est agé de 45 ans il est pere de famille et s 'active dans da fabrication de meubles lit armoires et autre meuble de maison depuis plus de dix (10) ans .son atelier est installé dans  sa maison .il est societaire de la caisse depuis 12 mois et a eu à bénéficié de plusieurs prets de la caisse pour le renforcement de son activité.Avec le pret sollicité il va developper son activité en renforçant ses capacités de production par l' achat de quantité importante de bois.
texts.en:
Mbaye Mactar A. is 45 years old and a family man. For more than ten years he has worked as a furniture maker producing beds, wardrobes and other items of household furniture. His workshop is set up in his house. He has been a member of the credit union for 12 months and has benefitted from several loans to strengthen his business. With this requested loan he will develop his business by increasing his production capability through the purchase of a large quantity of wood.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purcahse a large quantity of wood

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es: Teodoro tiene 40 años de edad, vive con la madre de sus tres hijos desde hace 10 años. Sus padres le enseñaron al arte de cultivar la tierra, y siempre ha tratado de sembrar varias hectáreas para que la cosecha no falte en ninguna temporada, en esta oportunidad está sembrando papa con 15 sacos de semilla y después sembrará arvejas de tres sacos de semilla. Para Teodoro no hay descanso, terminan de cosechar una, y la otra chacra está para trabajar, y en la otra vuelve a sembrar y de ese modo siempre puedan estar en permanente cosecha y no les falte el dinero. Comenta que para la agricultura hay que tener mucha paciencia y suerte porque hay temporadas donde no se gana, y temporadas muy buenas. Pero igual tiene que seguir sembrando sea rentable o no. Es un cliente que vienen trabajando por cuarta vez con MFPrisma, siendo muy responsable en sus pagos.  Además está muy agradecido por facilitarles los préstamos que le permite seguir sembrando. Como va sembrar papa de 15 sacos, para ello le falta abono que cuesta 180 soles el saco, asimismo comprará las 3 bolsas de semillas de arvejas.
texts.en:
Teodoro, 40, has lived for 10 years with the mother of his three children. His parents taught him the art of cultivating the land, and he has always tried to sow his hectares so that he would have a crop in every season. At this time he is sowing potatoes with 15 sacks of seed, after which he will sow three sacks of peas. There is no rest for Teodoro, as soon as one crop has been harvested, another field needs work, then he goes back to sow the first, and in this way they can always be harvesting and they don't run out of money. He says that to do agriculture needs much patience and luck, because there are seasons where there is no profit, and other seasons are very good, but either way he has to keep sowing, profitable or not. He is a client who is now working for the fourth time with MFPrisma, being very responsible in his payments. Moreover, he is very grateful for the loans that have been facilitated, permitting him to keep planting. Since he is going to sow 15 sacks of potatoes, he needs fertilizer costing $60 per sack, and at the same time he will buy the 3 sacks of pea seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Sillah K.

texts.fr: Né le 10 Octobre 1980, M. M. K. Sillah est marié et a trois (03) personnes à charge. C’est un homme très entreprenant qui s’est lancé très tôt  dan le commerce dès qu’il abandonna les études. Il détient aujourd’hui une boutique d’alimentation générale dans le quartier Nkafu à Lomé. N’arrivant plus à satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle très nombreuse par insuffisance de ses moyens financiers, il sollicite un financement pour approvisionner suffisamment sa boutique. Cet apport financier lui permettra de faire face aux demandes de ses clients, d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaires et ses revenus.
texts.en:
Born on October 10, 1980, M. Sillah K. M. is married and has three persons to support. He's a very enterprising man who started his business early on, just after dropping out of school. Today, he owns a grocery store in the Nkafu neighborhood in Lomé. Unable to satisfy the needs of his numerous clients due to a lack of financial means, he's seeking a loan to buy supplies for his shop. This will enable him to meet customer demand, and to increase both his revenue and his income.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for his shop

loans.name: Yon

texts.en: Mrs. Yun K. is 24 years old and lives in Kompong Cham province where she earns a living as a rice farmer as well as growing vegetable for sell, and began her business since 1990. She is married with one child, whom is teenager and attend school. Her husband, Mr. Preng Yon, is 27 years old. He is a recycles trader who is purchases from villagers by using his motorcycle for transportation, and resell to wholesaler for profit. He currently earns approximately $3 per day to cover his family's living expenses. To grow her husband business for additional income, K. has requested a loan for her husband to use as capital for business to buy more recycles to stock and some part remaining the money to use for cultivating. K.'s husband is pictured in the photo because she was not available.

loans.use: To buy more used goods to resell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam has been a bread and soup seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 8 years. She belongs to Wapendanao Group (Group code 2069). She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 175. Every day she works at her business for 14 hours. She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more bread and meat for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Mariam is 38 years old, married, and has three children: ages 11, 8 and 7.

loans.use: To buy more bread and meat for her business.

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Ngô Thị Hiền năm nay 42 tuổi .Năm 1997 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Đến nay sau hơn 10 năm tham gia Quỹ gia đình chị đã tích luỹ thêm vốn để đầu tư vào dịch vụ điện nước phục vụ nhu cầu của bà con nông thôn.  Anh Hùng chồng chị là cán bộ hưu trí hiện đang làm thêm công tác xã hội tại thôn Với thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng kinh tế gia đình chị Hiền đang ngày càng ổn định và có thêm điều kiện để đầu tư cho con đi học đại học.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư cho chăn nuôi và mua thêm thiết bị phục vụ cho công việc kinh doanh dịch vụ điện nước của gia đình
texts.en:
Ms. Ngô Thị Hiền is 42 years old. In 1997, she joined TYM Fund and borrowed capital to invest in rearing pigs. Today, after more than ten years of participation in the fund, her family has accumulated a financial reserve to invest towards a utilities (electricity and plumbing) business services the needs of the community. Mr. Hùng, her husband, is a retired government employee who is currently active in social programs for their local community. With an income of 5,000,000 VND per month, Ms. Hiền's family's financial situation continues to improve each day and allows them to make plans for their children to attend high school. For the upcoming loan cycle, she hopes to borrow 10,000,000 VND to put towards rearing livestock and materials for their electricity/plumbing business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising Livestock; Electricity/Plumbing Business

loans.name: Khodor

texts.en:
Khodor is a 39-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their six children. Khodor has been working as a house painter since 1988. He requested a loan of 1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a car for his business. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time.
Khodor is special in his work because he knows he does it well. His clients are people from his region. When he first started his business, he had difficulty building networking. Khodor decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on improving and purchase a painting shop.

loans.use: To purchase a car for his business.

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
Nguyễn Thị H. is a 51 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. H. is the group leader of a 6 member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Trung Bạn 2 - 01 (1).

H. is married and has 2 adult children. To making a living, H. owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income from the business comes primarily from selling fried foods in the local community. H. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000,000VND a month from these activities.

H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a new loan to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. The loan will be the first loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Nguyễn Thị Hà is a 36 year old female who is requesting a loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2.  Nguyễn Thị

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
Abbass is a 52-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Abbass has been working as a car repairer for twelve years. He also sells tires and car spare parts.

Abbass requested a loan of 2,000 U.S. dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tires for his business. This is the first time that Abbass has requested a loan.

Abbass is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face any competition. He decided on his business because he took after his father’s business, as well as learning it since he was young. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tires for his business

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen A. is eighty-two years old. He is married and has six children: three daughters and three sons. He lives with his wife and some grandchildren in a family apartment in a town called Kofiase, which is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Stephen says his children are all grown and live independently. His wife is a farmer and food vendor.

Stephen is a commercial driver. He drives a Urvan bus (a small Nissan vehicle). He conveys goods and people to and from his community and other nearby communities. He works from morning to the evening. He says his bus, which is his only source of income, is virtually broken down and so wants a loan to have it repaired and maintained. Stephen has been driving for over twenty-five years. He is hopeful to maintain the bus and improve upon his standard of living.

loans.use: To repair his vehicle

loans.name: Hernan

texts.en:
Hernan is a 36-year-old grocery store owner.  He is married to Lidia Estigarribia, his wife of four years.

Hernan has worked in the industry since he was young.  His parents owned a small grocery store, which is where he learned all about being a grocer.  After he finished high school he started taking care of the family business.  Afterwards, he married his wife.  Together, they started his own business as best as he knew how.  They ran their grocery from their home, as they live right outside of the marketplace in the city of Coronel Oviedo.

As time passed, they realized that the business was successful.  They originally sold hot bread, but Herman and Lidia applied for a loan in order to diversify their products.  Today, they sell stuffed animals, thermoses, toys, paintings, and more.  The business is growing and Hernan hanks Kiva for its help.

loans.use: The purchase of clocks, paintings, stuffed animals, thermoses, toys, etc.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is 46 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Youssef has worked as a mason for 20 years. He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase tools for his work. This is his third loan cycle and he has always paid on time.

Youssef's previous loans helped him improve his business as well as his financial situation. Youssef is successful in his work because he does it well. His clients are people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t have experience, which made it difficult to build a network of clients. He also had to learn new masonry techniques in order to face the competition. Youssef set up as a mason because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Irish

texts.en: "It was hard managing a farm without enough capital. Especially now that I have a kid going to school ... So I need to work hard for everything my family might need," says Irish D., a wife and farmer from Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. She would like a loan of 7,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy complete fertilizers and insecticides. This loan will be invested in her farm and hopefully could bring a good harvest for her family. She continues to avail herself of CEVI services. She has loans, training and insurance coverage for herself.

loans.use: To buy complete fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Субон

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan


Субон мужчина, который занимается полностью откормом и продажей скота. У него крупнорогатый скот. С периода первого кредитования у него заметно увеличился оборотный капитал животноводства, а также увеличилась прибыль с данного бизнеса.
На следующий кредит Субон хочет купить корм для коров и купить ещё одного молодого быка.

loans.use: откорм и продажа скота

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia F. manages her own business. She is a native of the busy town of Cardona, Rizal province, in the Philippines. She is happily living with her four children, who are all of legal age. Her business partner is her second son Arnuld, who is 37 years old. Cornelia is 67 years old, yet full of determination to rise up from poverty.

Due to her desire to overcome poverty, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2003. Her hope was to have access to capital for her business. She carefully spent her previous loans to stock her general store, her primary business, and on upholstery, her secondary one. Both of her businesses are performing well and she is satisfied with the proceeds she receives. She wants to invest more in her businesses.

Now on her 11th loan, she asks for an amount of 20,000 pesos as additional capital to pay for stock for her general store. Part of the loan will also finance her upholstery business. She is hopeful that with the trust and confidence given by ASHI, in partnership with KIVA, she will be able to expand and make her businesses sustainable.

loans.use: To pay for stock for her general store and to finance her upholstery business.

loans.name: María Anelida

texts.es:
María tiene 48 años de edad, su esposo la abandonó hace cuatro años y desde entonces vive junto a sus cinco hijos en el sector 20 de Enero, distrito de Pomalca, ubicado a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Lleva 18 años vendiendo fruta en los exteriores del mercado de la ciudad de Pomalca, ella compra su mercancía en el mercado Moshoqueque (el principal mercado mayorista de la Chiclayo) para luego venderla diariamente a sus clientes habituales.

Este establecimiento es la única fuente de ingreso familiar, motivo por el cual ella trata de dar lo mejor de si para sacar adelante su negocio, su buen trato y la calidad de sus productos ha hecho que su puesto sea uno de los preferidos por las personas que diariamente compran en ese lugar.

María se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más fruta para ampliar su negocio, su más grande anhelo es llegar a ser distribuidora de frutas y de esa manera asegurarle a sus hijos una educación de calidad.

Ella es muy conocida y estimada por sus vecinos y compañeros del mercado, los que la consideran una mujer alegre, responsable y que ha sabido sacar a su familia adelante a pesar de las adversidades.
texts.en:
Maria is 48 years old. Her husband abandoned her 4 years ago and since then, she has lived with her 5 children in the January 20th sector of Pomalca District, located 10 minutes outside the city of Chiclayo.

For 18 years she has been selling fruit outside the market in the city of Pomalca. Maria buys her merchandise in the Moshoqueque market (the principle wholesale market of Chiclayo) to resell daily to her regular customers.

Maria's establishment is the only source of her family income and for this reason she tries to do her best to advance her business. Her good service and the quality of her products have make her stand one of the favorites of people who shop daily in this location.

This is Maria's first request for a loan from our institution. She is asking for $175 to buy more fruit and expand her business. Her grand desire is to become a distributor of fruits and, in this manner, assure her children of a quality education. She is well known and respected by her neighbors and companions at the market, who consider her a happy and responsible woman who has known how to move her family forward despite adversities.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY FRUIT TO SELL

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: S. is a 36-year-old farmer who lives in Kampong Chhnang Province. S. is married to Mr. Mao, age 34, who works with her in the farming business. On the other hand, this couple currently fish in and around Tunle Sap River for additional profits. S. said that she has been facing difficulty with her living condition for along time because her house is too small and very old. Therefore, she would like a loan to add to her personal saving in order to build a new house. S. has three school-aged children.

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: Zamra Group

texts.en: Sadeqa the leader of Zamra group. The group lives in District 4, Kabul, Afghanistan, and there are four members in this group. The total requested amount is 40,000 AFN. Each of them would like to receive a loan for her own business. Sadeqa and Sharefa request a loan for their tailoring business. Zamra requests a loan for her husband’s business of selling fresh fruit, and Banafsha wants to take a loan for her husband’s business of selling gas. They admire this process and want to thank Kiva, too.

loans.use: To grow their businesses

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.en:
Aquilina A., 43 years old, grows rice for a living. She has seven children. Her eldest child is 23 and still living with her. Aquilina works from 6 AM to 3 PM to ensure an abundant harvest. She would like to ask for a second loan from Community Economic Ventures. She plans to buy seeds and fertilizer to ensure her crop are healthy. 

Aquilina likes the CEVI services because aside from it’s helping a great number of people, it has only 2% interest rate, which is very affordable and easy to repay.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Seela

texts.en:
Seela S. is a woman living in the town of Sapini Siufaga. She is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Seela owns & operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Seela has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 400 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Seela joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Seela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1500 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. Seela is now requesting a new loan of 2000 WST which will be used to purchase more fishing equipment including hooks & nets. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Seela plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is currently in the business of selling tea and bread in a restaurant and is requesting a loan to purchase sugar and milk to make ice cream to sell.  Mary is 28 years old and is married to a mechanic. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a shop.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase sugar and milk to make ice cream to sell.

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en: Mrs. Yorn R. lives in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia with her husband and her two teenage children. Both of the children are students in the local public school. Mrs. Yorn R. earns a living by making silk skirts by hand. On a typical day, she makes one or two skirts for her customers. Most of her clients also come to receive the advance for a few days or a week. Her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver and farmer. Recently Yorn R. has received many orders from her clients but she does not have enough silk to make the orders. That is why she is applying for a loan to buy more silk from other weavers to fulfill the orders from her customers.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Homidjon

texts.en:
K. Homidjon is 53 years old and is married with two children. Since 2004 he has been raising and selling animals. He has his own cattle and, little by little over time, he has been improving and expanding his business with the goal of improving his family’s standard of living and continuing to pay for his children’s education. His wife (pictured) actively helps him with the business.

IMON International has been a fundamental part of Homidjon´s business, having provided loans which have been used to purchase calves and cows. Today, once again, Homidjon faces this need but he trusts that his loan will be granted to that he can help his business and his family.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit:  www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more cattle in order to expand his business

loans.name: Anielka De La Concepcion

texts.es: Anielka tiene 26 años, por lo que es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora. Esta joven es cliente de Fundación León 2000 desde hace 4 años, por lo que ha sido lo más importante para mantener a su hijo. Ella lucha todos los días para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, por lo que ella mejora las técnicas para atraer a sus clientes ella visita la vivienda de sus clientes, además les aconseja cuales son los productos más recomendables para cada uno de ellos. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de ciertos productos necesarios como cremas, colonias, tratamientos, pintura de uñas, pintura de labios entre otros productos. Su deseo es tener una tienda para generar más ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Anielka, 26, is a hard-working, tenacious woman. She has been collaborating with Fundación León for four years which has been very important for her in supporting her son. She struggles daily to improve her family's living conditions. She improves her techniques to attract more customers. She visits her customers in their homes and advises them on which products are most recommended for each one of them. She requests funding to buy certain needed products like creams, colognes, treatments, nail polish, lipsticks, among other. Her wish is to have a store in order to produce more income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Obiya East C Apiyo Concy Group

texts.en: A. Concy is a hardworking businesswoman representing a group of five members. She is 45 years old and married, and she has one child who is enrolled in school. She cares for four additional dependents who are also in school. She deals with a local brewing business and has been running her business for over ten years. She is using the loan to purchase millet, charcoal and so forth for her business. She is a promising businesswoman whose dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase millet, charcoal and so forth for her business.

loans.name: Yemisi

texts.en:
Fifty-four-year-old Yemisi, a widow, has five children under her care. She has been a member of LAPO Microfinance for the past two years with a good record. She sells tailoring materials and accessories to make a living in Lagos State, Nigeria. She also sells  sarongs to her customers. She has been in the business for over five years. She makes sure customers' demands are met while she equally improves herself financially. Yemisi hopes to offer her fatherless children a higher level of education.

Yemisi is requesting for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more tailoring materials and accessories to sell. She thanks Kiva lenders for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase tailoring materials and accessories to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa C. de 25 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y solo cuenta con luz, su esposo es maestro albañil ellos tienen 2 hijos de 3 y 1 año. 

Debido al poco ingreso económico que tenía en su casa y la desesperante idea de tener su propio negocio decidió hace 4 años iniciar con la misma actividad que los padres tenían cuando ella era pequeña, con unos pocos ahorros compro víveres y puso una pequeña tienda en su casa. 

Incremento su tienda trabajando desde las 07h00 hasta las 21h30 todos los días, ahora ella la tiene muy surtida con arroz, azúcar, enlatados, bebidas, dulces etc. 

Quiere con el préstamo alquilar un local en el terminal de Guayaquil (lugar donde se estacionan los buses para ir a las ciudades y provincias deL Ecuador). En el futuro quiere tener sucursales de su tienda.
texts.en:
Elsa C. is 25 years old and lives in the periurban area of Fortín in Guayaquil. Her house is made of cement and receives electricity. Her husband is a master bricklayer. They have two children, ages 3 and 1.

Due to her limited household income, she came up with the idea out of desperation to have her own business. Four years ago, she started this business with her parents. She used some of her savings to buy groceries and open a small store in her home. Elsa increased her store by working from 7am until 10:30pm every day. She now has a well-stocked inventory of rice, sugar, canned goods, beverages, candy, and other items.

She wants a loan so that she can rent a location at the terminal in Guayaquil (where the buses park before they leave to the cities and provinces throughout Ecuador). In the future, she wants to branch out her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rent a vending location at the bus terminal

loans.name: Troab

texts.en: Mrs. Troab L., a resident of Prek Ta Ong I-ID village in Kandal province, is a farmer who owns a plot of land upon which she cultivates sesame. Because she currently lacks sufficient funds to support her farming, she is requesting a loan to buy both a hose for the water machine and sesame seeds.  Troab is a widow with two children, one of whom is a security guard in a private company, while the other one is employed in a small company.

loans.use: To buy a hose for the water machine and sesame seeds

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Estela pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN MARIA DE INQUILPATA” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal tiene 4 ciclos de funcionamiento. 

Estela, tiene 56 años y es natural de la comunidad de Inquilpata del distrito de Anta del departamento del Cusco. Su principal actividad económica es atender su tienda de abarrotes y su actividad económica complementaria es vender chicha, cerveza y gaseosas en el Campo Ferial de la Comunidad Campesina de Inquilpata-Anta los días viernes.  Ella nos cuenta que también tiene una chacra donde siembra y cosecha papas y habas. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

Estela es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, ella requiere el crédito para comprar azúcar, fideos, cerveza y gaseosas y manifiesta, que se encuentra contenta y satisfecha con los servicios de crédito, ahorro y capacitación que brinda la Asociación.  

Estela se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. La comunidad de Inquilpata se encuentra a una hora y diez minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Estela belongs to the "Virgin Mary of Inquilpata" community bank of the Arariwa Association. The community bank has functioned for 4 cycles. Estela is 56 years old and is a native of the community of Inquilpata in the Anta district of the Cusco department. Her main economic activity is tending her grocery store, and her complementary business is selling chicha (a local beer), beer, and soft drinks at the Country Fair of the Rural Community of Inquilpata-Anta on Thursdays. She tells us that she also has a farm where she plants and harvests potatoes and beans. She has worked at her business for several years, and it is going very well for her, thanks to the effort that she puts into her work. Estela is a hard-working and enterprising mother who always looks for opportunities to advance and with her daily effort to provide a better future for her children. She needs the loan to buy sugar, pasta, beer, and soft drinks. She says that she is happy and satisfied with the credit, savings, and training services that the Association offers. Estela is thankful for the opportunity offered through the loans and promises to make the payments on schedule. The community of Inquilpata is and hour and ten minutes from the city of Cusco.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sugra, pasta, beer, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a mother of 4 and she is 35 years of age. She is a widow and she takes care of her children all alone in terms of feeding, clothing and sponsoring their education. She sells drinks to earn a living in Lagos and she has been in the business for more than 7 years. 

She hopes for growth in her business and that of her family. She asking for the loan of NGN50, 000 to purchase more drink in crates to sell that will boost her profit margin. 
Ruth is member in LAPO micro finance with good repayment record and she promise to repay her loan as at when due. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drink to sell to sell.

loans.name: Kristo Nti Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Mary is a 41-year-old woman who describes herself as industrious.  She is married to a farmer and has 4 children between the ages of 12 and 20 years old.  Mary would like to help her children obtain higher education.  

Mary operates a food vendor business, preparing and selling items such as rice, stew, yams and plantains.  She also generates income from cocoa farming.  Mary plans to use the loan to buy food ingredients like rice, plantains, yams, vegetables, spices, etc. in bulk.  She hopes to eventually expand her business and open her own restaurant.  

Mary is currently the leader of the trust bank group called 'Kristo Nti', which means “For the sake of Christ” in Twi, the language most commonly spoken in Ghana. She believes that she was elected group leader because she is faithful.  There are 6 members in the group.  The other group members operate trading and food vendor businesses. They hope to receive the loan to buy more stock to grow their business and provide more support to their family.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients like rice, plantains, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar U. is from the village of La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 45 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Oscar raises corn for sale. He has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Oscar joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from GDMPC which was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings to raise. Oscar is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the third loan taken out by Oscar from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental.
