Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

location.town: La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Sokun's Group

texts.en:
This group loan has six members who live in Roluos village in Kandal province. They will all use their portion of the loan for different purposes. 


Mrs. Sokun K. is the group leader who has been selected by the other members. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sochun S., is a construction worker. She currently has a problem because her field is infertile. So, to improve production, Mrs. Sokun K. is asking for a loan to bU. fertilizer. 


She is the mother of four children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the others are construction workers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stocking up on wheat flour

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
La señora Ana Julia Z. F., tiene la edad de 51 años vive en el Barrio Laureles Sur es casada y su esposo es fiscal de proyectos de una casa en construcción, siendo sus ingresos parte esencial de la economía del hogar, tienen 2 hijos adolecentes, el cual uno de ellos trabaja y apoya a sus padres y el otro estudia su carrera universitaria. Ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos desde hace mas  de 20 años y refiere que le va muy bien y que su mercadería tiene buena aceptación entre sus clientas, desde muy joven la señora se dedico al comercio, siendo sus padres quienes la ayudaron en sus inicios en el negocio.

Ellos habitan en una casa humilde que por ahora no posee el dinero para realizar una remodelación al porche de su hogar, es por esta razón que solicita de un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como cerámica, cemento, caliche, que le permitan llevar a  cabo este proyecto que les traerá mejores comodidades, seguridad y un buen desarrollo socio económico para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana Julia Z. F. is 51 years old. She lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood. She is married and her husband is a project manager at a construction company and his income is an essential part of the family finances. They have 2 teenage children. One of them works and supports his parents and the other one is studying at the university. She has sold shoes for more than 20 years and she remarks that it has gone very well for her. Her merchandise is well accepted by her customers. She has been a saleswoman since she was very young and her parents helped her get started in the business. They live in a humble home. At this time, they don't have the money to remodel the porch on the house and that is why she is asking for this loan to purchase contruction materials such as ceramic tile, cement, and caliche, which will allow them to finish this project and bring more comfort, safety and good social economic development for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To remodel the porch on their home

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip M. lives the village of Brgy. Escoting, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 29 years old, married and has two school-aged children. He makes a living raising pigs and other livestock. He has been in this line of work for more than five years, and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

Earlier this year, Philip joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his life and ability to engage in business. He is applying for a 5,000 PHP loan, his first, to buy more livestock to raise. He plans to use the additional revenue generated by his business to improve his family's living standards. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern parts of the country. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to raise

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower is 48 years old and is married with four children. She graduated from intermediate school.

The borrower has been working in tailoring for more than twenty-five years and has therefore acquired a great deal of experience. She possesses a high reputation as a skilled lady and this has gained her lots of customers and led to an increase in her income.

The purpose behind this loan is to purchase a sewing machine and cloth.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and cloth

loans.name: Gilma Isabel

texts.es: Gilma Isabel S. N. de 37 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco, ubicado en el departamento de Usulután. Vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como albañil y junto a dos hijos de 14 y 17 años de edad. Gilma trabaja en su propio negocio, el cual es una tienda en la que se comercializan productos de primera necesidad como pan, agua, gas propano, medicinas y algunas golosinas, y su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación. Gilma desea mucho el poder surtir en gran medida su negocio, ya que de esta forma podrá vender más y obtener más ganancias, es por esto que solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar todos los productos necesarios para brindarles todo lo que sus clientes buscan, de esta forma ella podrá brindar un mejor servicio el cual se vea recompensado con más clientes. Para Gilma su negocio es muy importante ya que cuenta con la ventaja de poseerlo en su hogar lo cual le permite atenderlo y así mismo estar junto a sus hijos a los cuales al mismo tiempo les puede brindar todo lo que necesiten.
texts.en:
Gilma Isabel S. N. is 37 years old and lives in Jiquilisco, located in the Usulután department. She lives with her husband, who works as a mason, and her two children, ages 14 and 17. Gilma has her own business where she runs a store out of her home, selling primary needs products, such as bread, water, propane gas, medication, and some sweets. Gilma would very much like to stock her business in order to be able to increase her sales and earnings. She is requesting this loan in order to buy all the products to give her customers all that they need, be able to improve her service, and be rewarded with more customers. Gilma’s business is very important to her and it gives her the advantage of being located in her home, which allows her to tend to it and be with her children, while at the same time providing for all of their needs.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Martin

texts.es: El señor Martin es soltero vive en la comunidad Tacuarembo a 30 km. De la carretera San Luis el vive con su señora madre y su hermana en la cual ellos están pendiente de el pero mas se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, cría Cerdos y se dedica a la venta de animales  por que vende hasta 12 torillos anual, también siembra maíz y guarda forraje para sus animales de todo lo que el siembra, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara para la siembra y preparado de la tierra, también para la compra de alimento mejorado para sus animales, es muy trabajador el solo mantiene a su familia esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado..
texts.en:
Sr. Martin is single and lives along Km30 of the San Luis Highway in the community of Tacuarembo with his mother and sister. He raises pigs and cattle, selling up to twelve young bulls each year. Martin also grows corn and fodder for his animals, which is basically everything that he plants.

The money from this loan will be used to prepare his land for planting crops. He will also buy better feed for his animals. Martin works very hard because he is the only one supporting his family. He is extremely grateful to Emprender for the support that has been provided.

loans.use: Pay to have his land prepared for growing corn & purchase feed for his animals

loans.name: Nyiikira Okole Women's Group-Kampala

texts.en:
Youthful and industrious hard work, energy, buoyancy and resolve have been 28-year-old N. Betty’s calling cards and her advantage in her six years of operation in her Pub and Restaurant business along Entebbe road-Kampala. She has been holding on tenaciously to this purpose ever since she got pep talk encouragement from friends to obtain a footing in this business. Striking a happy medium in business is always a tall order, but with a sense of determination, one will always prevail. Once she got into her stride back then, it’s been hard for even the hardest of circumstances to throw her out of gear. 

Betty previously operated a shop. She says her clients are mostly working class individuals. Her husband, she says, has always been at her beck and call. What is on the horizon for Betty is the opening up of another Pub in the near future. Over $67 is what she makes in a week. With this loan, Betty says she is going to be financially empowered to smoothly shoulder most of her responsibilities like paying her kids' school dues.  Betty is the mother of three and is affiliated with the Nyiikira Okole group-Kampala.

loans.use: The school dues of her three kids

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene A. L. de 48 años de edad, madre soltera de dos jóvenes de 15 y 17 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar, ella ha sido una mujer muy emprendedora la cual siempre ha luchado muy duro por sacar adelante a sus dos hijos. Marlene posee un comedor en el cual se encarga de elaborar desayunos y almuerzos, así mismo comercializa platillos típicos tales como: tamales, pupusas y yuca frita, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado de Mejicanos, lugar en el cual habita junto a su familia. El mayor deseo de Marlene es el de poder mejorar las condiciones de su negocio ya que es gracias ha este como ha podido contar con todo lo necesario para su hogar. Es por esto que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar: verduras, frutas, granos básicos, jugos, café y todo lo necesario para contar con más materia prima para la elaboración de alimentos, y así de esta forma aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Marlene A. L. is 48 years old and a single mother of two teenagers, ages 15 and 17, who are in school. She is an enterprising woman who has always fought very hard so that her two children can get ahead. Marlene manages a diner where she serves breakfast and lunch. She prepares traditional dishes such as tamales, pupusas, and fried cassava. Her business is located in the Mejicanos Market, a place near where she lives with her family.

Marlene’s greatest wish is to improve the conditions of her business, which has helped her provide everything she needs for her home. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she will have the necessary funds to buy vegetables, fruits, basic grains, juices, coffee, and other essential supplies for preparing her dishes. This will enable her to increase her sales.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & supplies for preparing her dishes

loans.name: Yerly

texts.es:
La señora Yerly pertenece al banco comunal El Arenal, del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali,  tiene 43 años y está casada.  Tiene 4 hijos, su esposo maneja moto car (transportista).  Lleva 3 años trabajando con los prestamos de Manuela Ramos, para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar.
Yerly se dedica a vender  por las mañanas jugos, hamburguesas y gaseosas  en su casa, que se encuentra cerca de una posta médica (Centro de Salud). 
Con su ultimo préstamo de S/. 2,500.00 soles, piensa invertirlo en su negocio, comprará una nueva licuadora y una extractora que mucha falta le hace, comprara también ½ saco de azúcar, 1 botella de esencia de vainilla, 1 botella de miel, 1 botella de algarrobina, 3 jarras y 1doc. De vasos y una pequeña vitrina.
La señora Yerly está muy agradecida  con Manuela Ramos  por la confianza  y la oportunidad de poder realizar un negocio propio que le genera ingresos a su hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. Yerly is a member of the Communal Bank “El Arenal”, which is in the Calleria District of the Department of Ucayali. She is 43 years old, married, and has four children. Her husband drives a motorcycle taxi as a carrier.

Yerly has worked with the loans from Manuela Ramos for three years in order to help her husband with the household expenses. She sells breakfast juices, hamburgers, and sodas from her house that sits next to a health clinic. With this latest loan of 2500 PEN, she plans to invest in her business by purchasing a blender and a juicer that she currently lacks. Yerly will also buy half a sack of sugar, one bottle of vanilla extract, one bottle of honey, one bottle of carob extract, three pitchers, a dozen glasses, and a small display case.

Sra. Yerly is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for the confidence and the opportunity to pursue her own business so that she can generate household income.

loans.use: Purchase a blender, a juicer, and supplies for her business

loans.name: Sop Naby Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de Solidarité SOP NABY est créé le 24 avril 2010. Il est composé de 09 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Elle nouent des liens de familiarité et d'amitié assez solides. Leur activité principale est le commerce. Le groupe fait partie du Banc villageois de FOGNY2

Madame Maty N., à gauche de la photo et levant la main est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 31 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants en charge.

son activité consiste la coiffure. Elle achète des mèches et des produits pour la coiffure et s'installe chez elle dans une pièce qui fait office de salon pour pratiquer son activité.

Son crédit lui permettra d'acheter plus de mèches et de produits pour mener à bien son activité.

Son objectif est de prendre en charge ses besoins personnels et de participer à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
The solidarity group, Sop Naby, was created on 24th April 2010. It is made up of nine women who live in the same neighborhood. They have established quite a strong friendship. Their principal activity is trading. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois in Fogny2.

Mrs. Maty N., on the left hand side of the photo with her hand raised, is in charge of the group. She is 31 years old, married and mother to two children, who are in her care.

She has a hairdressing business. She buys hair extensions and hair products, and has a room in her house which serves as a salon for her business.

Her loan will allow her to buy more hair extensions and products to carry out her activity.

Her aim is to cover her personal needs and contribute to taking care of her family.

loans.use: Purchase of hair extensions and hairdressing products

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba M. sells cloth and materials at Abura by moving from one area to another on foot. Araba has no educational background. She is divorced and has four children. She is responsible for the well-being of her family. Her loan will be used to buy additional cloth to expand her business. She hopes to build a shop for her business.

loans.use: buy additional cloth to expand her business

loans.name: Tan

texts.en:
Tan S., 41, is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate his business more efficiently. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. S. is married and resides with her husband and four children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia, an area known for being well-supplied with freshwater from major rivers. 

S. produces rice wine to sell, earning an income of USD 3 per day. The family has to spend USD 20 on food, USD 3 on electricity, and USD 17 on other necessary expenses every month.  This is S.'s first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy motorbike for her husband to operate his business

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani is 39 years old. She lives with her family in the area named Chorasta which is located in a city Depalpur. Depalpur is known for its agriculture industry in Pakistan. She has been living there since her marriage. 
She is a housewife, prefers to stay at home and does her household responsibilities.  
Her husband’s name is A. G. and he operates a construction supplies business in the market. He is doing this business for over 15 years and has a good clientele base. 
Rani has given birth to 2 daughters both are illiterate and couldn’t get education due to financial constraints. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy construction supplies such as cement, bricks and sand in bulk which enable him to fulfill the demands of his customers and earn maximum profits. 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for construction supplies selling business

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en: Cheng L., 41, is married and resides with her two children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Cheng is a teacher at a public school, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband sells groceries, earning an income of USD 5 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 80 on food and USD 40 on the other necessary expenses. Cheng is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to start a new business as a motor-taxi driver. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her sixth loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to start a new business

loans.name: Hannington

texts.en: Hannington is a 28-year-old hardworking man, married to a nursing aid living in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. For 15 years, he has been growing maize and tomatoes which have facilitated him in paying school fees for his children. His major challenge is price fluctuation and his vision is to supply the region sustainably. Hannington needs the loan to prepare land for maize planting.

loans.use: Preparation of land for maize planting

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Mrs. Ester C. is from the barangay of Cotta Area, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old, widowed and blessed with 1 child who is now an adult and married. To make a living, she is presently engaged in making and selling earrings, bracelets, anklets and other body accessories. She’s been engaged in this kind of business for 5 years already and earns approximately Php6, 000 a month from this business activity.

In May 2007, Ester joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ester as an active member of Paglaum MPC under the Regular Loan Program and has successfully repaid a loan of Php20, 000. She is now requesting a loan of Php20, 000 as her 8th loan, which will be used as capital for her jewelry sales business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, savings for future use, loan repayments, possible product innovations, and business expansion.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To provide additional capital for her jewelry business

loans.name: Loma Guazu Group

texts.es:
El comité está compuesto por 15 integrantes muy trabajadoras y sacrificadas, la mayoría debe trabajar y generar ingresos para mantener el hogar.
La Sra. Laura A. es la presidenta de dicho comité, vive con su marido e hijos, posee una pequeña despensa en su hogar que le ayuda al sustento de su familia. El crédito que percibe de parte de la fundación le sirve para invertir en su negocio y de esa manera crecer comercial y económicamente.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of 15 members who are very hard-working, devoted women.  Most of them must work to generate an income to cover their household expenses.

Mrs. Laura Auqino is the president of the group.  She lives with her husband and children.  She has a small grocery store in her home that allows her to help maintain her family.  The loan she receives from the foundation will be invested in her business so she can grow in sales and earnings.

loans.use: To purchase sweets, fruit, beverages, vegetables, legumes, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Gulbarchyn's Group

texts.en:
Gulbarchyn A. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Balykchi, a small town in Isykul region. She is 32 and married to a construction worker. Together they are bringing up two sons and two daughters. The youngest daughter is preschool age (under seven) and the other children study at school. 

In order to earn additional money to cover family expenses the family two years ago started to breed livestock. At the moment they have five livestock animals. With money received from the loan Gulbarchyn wants to increase the number of livestock. In the future she wants to improve the family’s living conditions and also repair the house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy clothes in large quantity to resell

loans.name: Fraciah

texts.en:
Fraciah W. W. has been selling fruits and vegetables for two years. She is married to Simon and the mother of three children.

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a staff member, and this is her first loan from KADET. She will use the KES 20,000 to purchase more fruits and vegetables for sale. The anticipated profit she will use to open another grocery business in Athi River.

In the future, she hopes to grow her business and eventually purchase a plot of land and have her own business premise.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Eneria

texts.en:
Eneria T. is from the village of Pobalcion three Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old. Eneria is married and has eight adult children. Eneria owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Eneria has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2006, Eneria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Eneria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Eneria is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to buy feeds and other farm supplies for sale. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Eneria from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC: 

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other farms supply for sale

loans.name: Las Cultivadoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama las "Las Cultivadoras", y se ubica en México. El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes y es la septima vez que piden un prestamo. La señora Guadalupe es la tesorera del grupo. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa que inicio hace 6 años. Solicita el prestamo para comprar pantalones y playeras que vende en su comunidad las cuales ya tiene comprometidas. Ella tiene 63 años, estudio hasta el tercer año de primaria, es soltera y no tiene ningun dependiente economico. Al momento de solicitar este prestamo se siente entusiasmada por obtener la oportunidad de solicitar un prestamo y seguir adelante para hacer crecer su negocio y ser conocida por toda la comunidad. 

Quiere este prestamo para compra de mercancia y con esto tener mas clientes y obtener una mejor calidad de vida y apoyar a su familia en los gastos economicos, tambien espera lograr sus sueños y ser una mujer exitosa.
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Cultivadoras” (The Cultivators) and is located in the State of Puebla in Mexico.  There are nine members and they are requesting a loan for the seventh time.  Sra. Guadalupe is the group treasurer.  She started selling clothes six years ago.  Guadalupe is requesting a loan to buy trousers and t-shirts to sell in her community since she has already received orders.  She is 63 years old and has a third grade education.  Guadalupe is single and has no financial dependents.  Upon submitting her loan request, she was excited about having the opportunity to obtain a loan and move forward with growing her business.  She is known throughout the entire community.  

By using this loan to buy merchandise, Guadalupe will be able to attract more customers, achieve a better quality of life, and support her family financially with the expenses.  She also wants to fulfill her dreams and become a successful woman.

loans.use: to purchase trousers and t-shirts.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Evelyn works hard to support her family. 

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a vulcanizing shop and food processing. Evelyn is borrowing 17,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase spare parts for maintenance of her motorcycle transport business. 

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for maintinance

loans.name: Souhaila

texts.en: Souhaila is a 47-year-old married woman living in Tyre with her husband and three children. She opened a grocery store two years ago to help her husband in covering their expenses and to improve their living conditions. Souhaila works hard to improve her business, buying products with special offers most of the time. She has requested a loan from Al Majmoua-Kiva partner in order to increase her business capital and to pay for her daughter's medical surgery. Her customers are relatives, neighbors, and friends. She's honest and a woman with good customer service. She hopes to expand her business more and continue providing healthy living to her family.

loans.use: To increase her business capital and pay for her daughter's surgery

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
This is Regina, 52, a resident of Queson City, Philippines. She is married to Delfin, a welder. With her husband, she manages the family household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Regina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Regina earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 45,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory and also to buy a freezer for her soft drinks. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Regina hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery products, inventory items and equipment needed in her variety store.

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina is a working lady sewing clothes for her neighbor clients. She is very skillful in her work and her customers like her designs. They give her regular orders every month. Zarina has four children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. Her husband is a contractor and builds houses and buildings on contract. Both Zarina and her husband work very hard so they can afford their children's school fees and put three meals on the table. 

Zarina has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah for the further expansion of her sewing business. With this loan, she will buy a new sewing machine that will allow her to finish the orders on time and earn better profits. She is very experienced in her work as she has been doing it for the past 10 years. She is confident that a loan will be productive for her. 

Zarina is a regular client of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In previous loan years, she has established good credit behavior and never missed a meeting. In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah passbook) is Zarina.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for a sewing business.

loans.name: Duo Samuel Group

texts.es: Duo Samuel, este Grupo esta Formado por Gricelda ella es la lider D. este duo,ella se dedica a la venta D. producto comestibles D. primera nececidad.ella nos cuenta que lleva varios años D. dedicarse a esta actividad y esta contenta porque sus ventas han aumentado considerablemente, es por eso que esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. productos comestibles D. primera nececidad,el siguiente socio esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. arina para elavorar pan,el sueño D. ellos es tener un local mas granD.,y tener mas oportunidades D. ingreso en un futuro.
texts.en:
Duo Samuel.

Gricelda is the leader of this Duo.  She sells basic need groceries.  She tells us that she’s been in this line of work for several years and she’s happy because sales have increased considerably.  This is why she’s asking for this loan to buy basic need groceries.  The other member is asking for the loan to buy flour to make bread.   Their dream is to have a larger locale and more income opportunities in the future.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 49 years, married, and she has been operating a retail shop for ten years as her primary business and also a livestock as her secondary businesses for twenty years. She makes a monthly profit of KES.25,000. She has applied for a loan of KES 60,000 which she plans to purchase a dairy cow.

With the anticipated profit she plans to strengthen both  her businesses by diversifying into farming.

In the near future she hopes to expand her business and uplift the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her secondary business.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has three children.
 
Leonardo has a shop that sells fish like sardines and milk fish. He has had this business for four years. He requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fish to resell.

Leonardo has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Leonardo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 26 years. She does both dairy and crop farming. She is 45 years old and married to John. They have eight school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her third loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow.

In the future, Rachel hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en: Mejumaa is a married woman with four children; three attend school while one is still young. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past ten years, Mejumaa has operated a tailoring business, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other tailors in the area. Mejumaa dreams of expanding her business in the future. With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to repair her tailoring machine, purchase cloth materials and sewing threads. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To repair her tailoring machine, purchase cloth materials and sewing threads.

loans.name: Mangala

texts.en: Mangala is 46 years old.  She is married and has three children 24, 21 and 8 years old.  In 1999, she established her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her shop.  In the future, Mangala plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. For a borrower to improve living her standard, extra training is needed. In the Katmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 47-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and two school-aged children. He has owned a pastry shop since 2006, and has more than 15 years of experience. He cooperates financially with his wife, who works as a teacher to be able to pay the heavy life expenses. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase more merchandise. He intends to augment his business productivity to get higher revenue in order to improve the family’s financial status.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 42 years old and married with 4 children, living in a rented house with 6 people in Hoima, Uganda. He has been running a business of spare parts for 10 years.

He started by working as a mechanic and later started his own spare parts shop. He faces a challenge of electricity being unstable, and hopes in the future to have a hardware shop. He is requesting a loan to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is married with 2 children. He is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is operating a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for 5 years, and every month he earns about 5,000 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to repair his existing vehicle for better service.

Rogelio has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, he hopes to finish the studies of his children and to have another motorcycle.

loans.use: to repair his existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Retamas De Mazo Cruz Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RETAMAS DE MAZO C.” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Senkata, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Margarita. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Tienda de abarrotes, ganado vacuno, tejido de mantas costura de polleras, producción de calzados.

La señora Margarita  indica que este es el primer ciclo que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por comunicación de los familiares. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas que viene trabajando hace años atrás, aprendo este oficio de su mamá. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana y revistas) que de Desaguadero y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella es casada  y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro y el crédito.
texts.en:
The “RETAMAS DE MAZO C.” communal bank is about to start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Center. The group is made up of six members and is governed by a board of directors headed by Mrs. Margarita. The members' businesses are varied and include:
a grocery store, cows, weaving blankets, sewing skirts, and shoemaking.

Mrs. Margarita says that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer, and that she joined because of a family member. She currently has a business weaving blankets, which she has done for several years. She learned this work from her mother.

Margarita is taking out a loan to increase her working capital, and buy wool and magazines from Desaguadero. She later sells based on orders. This work allows her to generate an income to support her family where possible. She is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she enjoys the savings and the loans.

loans.use: to buy wool and magazines

loans.name: La Alternativa 1 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Ruth is just one member of the 10 person group, La Alternativa 1 & 3. This group is located in Samaná, a lush rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. These Dominican entrepreneurs are able to unite in solidarity, allowing them access to funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own. Their businesses are operated from their house or by walking in their community and others nearby. Businesses like beauty salons, clothes and food sales, are some of the principal activities in this group of ten entrepreneurs.

Ruth is a middle-aged woman that lives in Samaná, Dominican Republic. She is a mother of 5 children, and she lives together her long term partner. Ruth has been an Esperanza associate for 6 years and this is her 13th loan with us. She is running a small vending business where she sells cosmetics and beauty products. The earnings from her business will allow her to continue to support her children and put her one step closer to her dream, which is to run an ice cream store and to finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic and beauty products to sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel used his previous loan of 40, 000 Kenya shillings to buy timber.  He was able to make for furniture for resale.  With additional furniture in his workshop, he was able to attract more customers hence good sale. He is still practicing dairy farming to supplement his income
Samuel moved his business to a bigger business premise.  He has requested for 50, 000 Kenya shillings to buy a power saw.

loans.use: To buy a power saw

loans.name: Marifat

texts.ru: Маърифат  1963 года рождения, муж 12 лет назад уехал на заработки в Россию  и без вести пропал. Маърифат одна сама воспитала своих детей.  У нее 3 детей: 2 сыновей и дочь. Работает она в поликлинике старшей медсестрой. Работает там она в течении 5 лет. Её старший сын  работает на стройке , делает ремонт помещений. Другой её сын находиться в России и ежемесячно присылает ей деньги. Это ее первый кредит в нашей организации. Этот кредит на хочет приобрести колыбель и подарков для внука. По нашей традиции она как бабушка должна накупит много игрушек и одежды. Её внуку сделают обрезание и проведут свадьбу. Она планирует  после погашения еще получить кредит на ремонт дома.  Сейчас она благодарна  нашей организации за поддержку.
texts.en: Marifat was born in 1963.  Her husband left to go to Russia for work twelve years ago and went missing.  Marifat raised her children alone.  She has three children: two sons and a daughter.  She works as a senior nurse at a hospital and has been working there for five years.  Her oldest son works at a construction site and repairs buildings.  Her other son is in Russia and sends her money monthly.  This is Marifat's first loan with our organization.  She wants to use this loan to purchase a crib and gifts for her grandson.  According to our tradition, she, as the grandmother, has to purchase many toys and clothing.  They will hold a circumcision ceremony for her grandson and hold a wedding.  Marifat plans to obtain another loan for home repair after repaying this loan.  Now, she is grateful to our organization for support.

loans.use: to purchase a crib and gfts for her grandson

loans.name: Marco

texts.es:
Marco tiene 50 años edad y es casado y fruto de esta unión tiene siete hijos, él nació en el distrito de Ollantaytambo de la provincia de Urubamba y actualmente vive en el poblado de la Cantuta de la provincia de Urubamba, él es carpintero y se dedica a la elaboración de mesas, sillas, roperos y otras cosas más. En esta oportunidad Marco requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como madera y calvos. 

Marco es integrante del banco comunal “Nueva Vision de Rumichaca”. Este  grupo está conformado con 19 socios que viven  en la provincia de Urubamba. La provincia de Urubamba está ubicada al norte de la ciudad del Cusco, a orillas del río Vilcanota, en una zona que se conoce como el “Valle Sagrado” debido a su clima templado, tierra  fértil y abundantes riachuelos, que hacen de este valle uno de los más bellos del planeta.
texts.en:
Marco is 50 years old and married with seven children. He was born in the Ollantaytambo District in Urubamba Province and currently lives in the town of Cantuta. He's a carpenter and makes tables, chairs, armoires, and other items. At the moment, Marco needs this loan to buy materials such as wood and nails. 

Marco is a member of the Nueva Vision de Rumichaca communal bank, a group of 19 members who live in Urubamba Province, located north of the city of Cusco on the banks of the Vilcanota River. The area is known as the Sacred Valley for its mild climate, fertile soil, and abundant streams that make this valley one of the most beautiful on the planet.

loans.use: to buy materials such as wood and nails.

loans.name: Islom

texts.ru: Ислом молодой человек 24 лет, женат пока не имеет детей. Он проживает в сельской местности Бобочон Гафуровского района, поэтому основным доходом у него является прибыль с продажи скота. На полученный кредит он хочет купить корм для скота и отремонтировать хлев где он держит скот. Сейчас у него несколько голов мелко рогатого скота. Он благодаря кредитам смог увеличить поголовье баранов и улучшить социальное положение семьи.
texts.en: Islom is a young 24 year-old man, married and does not yet have children.  He lives in a rural area of the Bobjon Gafurov district, and this is why his main income is the profit from sales of livestock.  He wants to use this loan to purchase fodder for livestock and to repair a shed, where he keeps livestock.  Currently, Islom has several heads of small livestock.  Thanks to the lenders, he was able to increase his sheep headcount and improve his family's social status.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en: Mr.Ganbaatar is 28 years old and lives with his wife and his son in ger, Arhangai province of Mongolia. His wife unemployed and his son goes to the secondary school. He is hairdresser. He is 20-25 people to cut hair. His monthly income is 450,000 - 500,000MNT.   He said, "I want to my hairdresser business, because my customers usually overjoyed". Now his business many regular customer. He is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase a hair-dye, barber's goods for hairdresser's tools for his business.  Mr.Ganbaatar goal is expand his business. His local residents appreciates him as a tidy and restraint man.

loans.use: To purchase a hair-dye, barber's goods for hairdresser's tools for his business

loans.name: Perla

texts.en: Perla is 58 years old and lives in Lobogon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. Perla works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to pay for materials and labor for house renovations. Perla has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Perla hopes to own a comfortable house.

loans.use: to pay for materials and labor for house renovations.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: After graduating from vocational school where she learned how to sew, Patience decided to set up her own sewing center in Ve-Wudome (near Hohoe). With over 15 years of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her to purchase more cloth for resale to her customer, zippers, thread and buttons. She aims at using the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a peasant farmer) with the upkeep of their house and ensure that their child is able to experience a better life. She also wants to save enough to build a fashion designer center to employ teenage girls and mothers.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth, zippers, thread and buttons
